original: log pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: That which is associated with wrong views, etc., is nonvirtuous.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be understood for the other causes.

original: thal ba'i sman dang tsher ma la sogs pa dang phrad pa lang tshor ba med pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: thal ba'i sman dang tsher ma la sogs pa dang phrad pa lang tshor ba med pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of the absence of pleasure is the contact with ashes, thorns, etc.

original: de ni bde ba'i dngos kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i dngos kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: This is the direct cause of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ni brgyud ba'i sgo nas rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ni brgyud ba'i sgo nas rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the indirect cause of suffering.

original: de bzhin du chos 'das pa rnams ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i rnams kyi byed rgyu ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin du chos 'das pa rnams ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i rnams kyi byed rgyu ste ;
translated: In the same way, past factors are the active cause of future and present factors.

original: de yang 'das ba rnams kyi 'bras bu ni ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams la sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos byed rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'das ba rnams kyi 'bras bu ni ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams la sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos byed rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, the past factors are the active cause of future and present factors by the fact that they do not hinder the arising of their effect.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams 'das pa rnams kyi byed rgyu ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams 'das pa rnams kyi byed rgyu ste /
translated: The present factors are the active cause of past factors.

original: de rnams ma 'ongs ba'i 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ma 'ongs ba'i 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But these past factors are not the effect of the present factors.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams kyis gnyi ga ste 'dus ma byas rnams kyi des gnyi gnyid 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te /üîΩde ni 'dus byas rnams kyi byed ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams kyis gnyi ga ste 'dus ma byas rnams kyi des gnyi gnyid 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te / de ni 'dus byas rnams kyi byed ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The unconditioned factors are the homogeneous and heterogeneous causes of the conditioned factors.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are the efficient cause of the conditioned factors.

original: 'dus byas rnams de'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams de'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: But the conditioned factors are not the effect of the unconditioned factors.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod bar bya ste /
translated: This is why we must add:

original: byed rgyur gyur ba las de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: byed rgyur gyur ba las de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: The unconditioned factor is not the effect of the cause of which it is the effect.

original: chos thams cad byed rgyu yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed rgyu yin la /
translated: All factors are the efficient cause of the unconditioned factors.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni 'dus byas kho na'o ;
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni 'dus byas kho na'o ;
translated: But the unconditioned factors are the effect of the conditioned factors.

original: / de bzhin du dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gzugs med pa'i phung po skyed pa la nus pa yod do //
analyzed: / de bzhin du dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gzugs med pa'i phung po skyed pa la nus pa yod do //
translated: In the same way, the formless meditative attainments are capable of producing the material form of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: 'di ltar kye ma dmyal ba dang yi dags la sogs pa 'di rnams ni mchog tu sdug bsngal ba'o snyam nas dmyal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pa dge ba skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar kye ma dmyal ba dang yi dags la sogs pa 'di rnams ni mchog tu sdug bsngal ba'o snyam nas dmyal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pa dge ba skye la /
translated: In fact, when one thinks of the hells, of the hungry ghosts, etc., with a thought of aversion, a wholesome thought arises in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: @262b de las rim gyis tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bas gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @262b de las rim gyis tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bas gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and from that, through gradually abiding in morality and applying oneself to meditation, the formless meditative attainments arise.

original: byed pa'i rgyu bshad zin to /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu bshad zin to /
translated: The active cause has been explained.

original: // / lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras /
analyzed: // / lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras /
translated: The simultaneous cause is that which is the effect of one another.

original: rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúcause‚Äù is applied.

original: 'di la kha cig ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos phan tshun 'bras bur gyur pa dag kho na yin no zhes nges bar 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos phan tshun 'bras bur gyur pa dag kho na yin no zhes nges bar 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Some assert that the simultaneous cause is only those phenomena that are the effect of one another.

original: de ltar na phan tshun 'bras bu ma yin pa rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa bsam bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na phan tshun 'bras bu ma yin pa rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa bsam bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then those that are not the effect of one another would be the simultaneous cause,

original: de'i phyir chos mthun ba'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mthun ba'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the characteristics of similar type would not be simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu yin par gyur na lhan cig 'byung ba nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu yin par gyur na lhan cig 'byung ba nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be ascertained that if they are the effect of one another, they are simultaneous, but not if they are not.

original: de lta yin dang lhan cig 'byung ba thams cad lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du nye bar gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lhan cig 'byung ba thams cad lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du nye bar gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then all coexistent things would be reciprocal coexistent causes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bshad de /
translated: For that very reason, it is said that they are reciprocal results.

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /üîΩ'bras bu dang lhan cig 'byung bas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir / 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'byung bas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Because they are reciprocal causes.üîΩThey are coexistent causes because they are coexistent and causes.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba yang 'di yin la rgyu yang yin pas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba yang 'di yin la rgyu yang yin pas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: They are coexistent causes because they are coexistent and causes.

original: yang na lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu yin pas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu yin pas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Or, they are coexistent causes because they are the causes of coexistent things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, they are reciprocal coexistent causes.

original: 'di dpe med par rtogs par mi nus bas 'dri bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dpe med par rtogs par mi nus bas 'dri bar byed pa ni /
translated: Since it is not possible to understand this without an example, it is asked:

original: dper na ci lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na ci lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: What is an example of this?

original: 'dir rgol ba'i tshig ni /
analyzed: 'dir rgol ba'i tshig ni /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response is:

original: 'dri ba'i don ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i don ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the question is not established.

original: thams cad dper brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad dper brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: All are examples.

original: 'dir thams cad dper brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad dper brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But not all are examples here.

original: 'on kyang gang zhig bzhin no zhes bya bas nye bar ston pa dper ma brjod pa yang yod do /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig bzhin no zhes bya bas nye bar ston pa dper ma brjod pa yang yod do /
translated: But there are also examples that are not mentioned by the phrase ‚Äúlike what?‚Äù

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun dang / mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun no //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun dang / mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun no //
translated: The characteristics of mind and mental factors are mutually concomitant.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni //
translated: The four great elements

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: are mutually concomitant.

original: rdzas lhag ma yod kyang gsum gcig gis yin te /
analyzed: rdzas lhag ma yod kyang gsum gcig gis yin te /
translated: Even though the remaining substances exist, three are one.

original: rang gi ngo bo la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / rdzas skal ba mnyam pa la mi ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / rdzas skal ba mnyam pa la mi ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they do not rely on their own nature, they do not rely on the homogeneous collection of substances.

original: gzhan rnams re re gsum la ltos shing /
analyzed: gzhan rnams re re gsum la ltos shing /
translated: The others rely on one, three,

original: bzhi 'dus pa rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rjes su 'jug nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi 'dus pa rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rjes su 'jug nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because the collection of four elements is able to engage in derivative form.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid lhag ma nyid ma gtogs pa gzhan rdzas lhag ma nyid yod pas na 'di dpyad @263a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid lhag ma nyid ma gtogs pa gzhan rdzas lhag ma nyid yod pas na 'di dpyad @263a * //
translated: The remaining characteristics are not derivative form, but the remaining substances exist.

original: bar bya'o // de ltar 'dus byas thams cad cas gang bshad pa ha cang thal ba dang / ci rigs bar zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bar bya'o // de ltar 'dus byas thams cad cas gang bshad pa ha cang thal ba dang / ci rigs bar zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, the term ‚Äúall‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúall conditioned states are reciprocal effects‚Äù is an overstatement, and the term ‚Äúas is appropriate‚Äù is stated.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The following is taught:

original: thams cad lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin gyi thams cad kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin gyi thams cad kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: All are coemergent causes, but not all are reciprocal effects.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid yin pa na sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag kyang phan tshun mtshan nyid can rnams kyang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid yin pa na sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag kyang phan tshun mtshan nyid can rnams kyang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those that are reciprocal effects are the mental factors, and those that are reciprocal characteristics should be stated.

original: 'di yang rtsod pa'i tshig gi lan nyid kyis bshad do //
analyzed: 'di yang rtsod pa'i tshig gi lan nyid kyis bshad do //
translated: This is also explained by the response to the objection.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid med bzhin du chos ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid med bzhin du chos ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Even though they are not reciprocal effects, the primary elements are the cause of the derivative form that is derived from them.üîΩThe primary elements are the cause of the derivative original: chos ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi yin gyi /üîΩde dag ni de'i ma yin te ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi yin gyi /üîΩde dag ni de'i ma yin te ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The primary elements are the cause of the derivative form that is derived from them.üîΩThe primary

original: kha bskang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar kha bskang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha bskang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar kha bskang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúshould be supplied‚Äù means ‚Äúshould be supplied as a supplement.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mtshan nyid ma khyab pa byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mtshan nyid ma khyab pa byas she na /
translated: Why are the characteristics not all-inclusive?üîΩThe treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'dus byas kyi chos 'bras bu gcig pa rnams kyi'o zhes bstan bcos las de skad 'don pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'dus byas kyi chos 'bras bu gcig pa rnams kyi'o zhes bstan bcos las de skad 'don pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe co-originating cause is of conditioned factors that have the same effect.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur ma bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur ma bshad do //
translated: The treatise does not explain that form that is concomitant with mind is a co-originating cause of mind.

original: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang gis lan smras pa /üîΩmtshan nyid bh'am byam t'u na t'a y'am tsa ye sems thams cad dang lhan cig skye bar nges par gyur pa rnams sems la bltos pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang gis lan smras pa / mtshan nyid bh'am byam t'u na t'a y'am tsa ye sems thams cad dang lhan cig skye bar nges par gyur pa rnams sems la bltos pas 'jug ste /
translated: On this point Master Sa·πÖghabhadra offers the following response:üîΩThe characteristics of all form that definitely arises simultaneously with mind are engaged in relation to mind.

original: de dag nyid sems dang phan tshun lhan cig yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur bshad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid sems dang phan tshun lhan cig yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur bshad do //
translated: Since they are mutually simultaneous with mind, they are explained as co-originating causes.

original: sems dang lhan cig skye bar ma nges pa 'ga' zhig ni mang ba dang nyung bar dmigs so //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig skye bar ma nges pa 'ga' zhig ni mang ba dang nyung bar dmigs so //
translated: Some are not necessarily born together with the mind, and some are observed to be more or less.

original: lus rang bzhin ni dman pa ma yin pa'i tshogs dang ngag gi las ni sems thams cad dang lhan cig par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: lus rang bzhin ni dman pa ma yin pa'i tshogs dang ngag gi las ni sems thams cad dang lhan cig par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: The body is not a collection of inferior natures, and verbal action does not occur with every mind,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa la de dag med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa la de dag med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist in the non-concentrated state.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni sems la ltos nas 'jug pas phan tshun bltos pa ma yin te /üîΩdharm'a mu khee nee pi hi dz'a ti:sthi ty'a d'i n'a mu pa ku ru te /üîΩskye ba'i gnas pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni sems la ltos nas 'jug pas phan tshun bltos pa ma yin te / dharm'a mu khee nee pi hi dz'a ti:sthi ty'a d'i n'a mu pa ku ru te / skye ba'i gnas pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since all these, birth, etc., occur in dependence on the mind, they are not mutually dependent.üîΩThe sutra says: ‚ÄúThe mind is the forerunner of phenomena, the mind is their chief, and they are mind-made.‚Äù

original: de dag phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur ma bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur ma bshad pa'o //
translated: Birth, etc., are not explained as mutually co-arisen causes.

original: lus dang ngag gi las sems dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa rnams sems la rag las pa nyid rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la rag (gang gi phyir skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs pa rnams ni chos gtso bor gyur ba nyid kyis nye bar
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las sems dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa rnams sems la rag las pa nyid rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la rag (gang gi phyir skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs pa rnams ni chos gtso bor gyur ba nyid kyis nye bar
translated: And physical and verbal karma and mental factors that are concomitant with the mind are dependent on the mind.

original: byed do/) / las pa nyid ces rnam par bshad pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: byed do/) / las pa nyid ces rnam par bshad pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it explained that they are dependent?

original: de ltar @263b mtshan nyid bshad pa la don ma tshang ba nyid bstan bcos kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgnas brtan gyis kyang gal te skye ba las gcig pa la sogs pa smos pa nyid kyis dus gcig gtogs ba nyid kyang chud pa nyid ma yin nam /üîΩdus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar @263b mtshan nyid bshad pa la don ma tshang ba nyid bstan bcos kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro // gnas brtan gyis kyang gal te skye ba las gcig pa la sogs pa smos pa nyid kyis dus gcig gtogs ba nyid kyang chud pa nyid ma yin nam / dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: If this is the explanation of the characteristics, then the treatise would have the fault of incompleteness.

original: zhes yang ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: zhes yang ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: The elder also says: If the phrase ‚Äúarisen‚Äù includes the possession of the same time, why is the phrase ‚Äúat the same time‚Äù mentioned?

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ste /
translated: It is mentioned because the possession of the same time includes the past and future.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag dang ma bral bar shes bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag dang ma bral bar shes bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: In order to understand that it is not disassociated from the past and future times,

original: mi skye ba'i chos can shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or in order to understand that it is not a nonarisen phenomenon.

original: de lta na 'on dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na 'on dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then it is included in one time.

original: de lta na yang dus gcig pa kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang dus gcig pa kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, it is understood to be only one time.

original: 'bras bu smos pas ni skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bur bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu smos pas ni skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bur bsdu'o //
translated: The result of conscious effort is included in the result of separation.

original: gal te rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gnyis kyang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gnyis kyang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Aren't the two results of natural outflow and karmic maturation also the nature of results?

original: de dag logs su ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: de dag logs su ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why are they mentioned separately?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
translated: The result of conscious effort is of four types:

original: lhan cig dang / mjug thogs dang / dus gzhan du skye ba dang mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig dang / mjug thogs dang / dus gzhan du skye ba dang mi skye ba'o //
translated: arising simultaneously, arising immediately after, arising at another time, and not arising.

original: de la 'dir rgyu lhan cig tu ma gyur ba'i 'bras bu bstan pas tshogs pa rnams dang lhan cig skyes ba skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa bsal lo //
analyzed: de la 'dir rgyu lhan cig tu ma gyur ba'i 'bras bu bstan pas tshogs pa rnams dang lhan cig skyes ba skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa bsal lo //
translated: Here, the result of the collection is not a result simultaneous with its cause, because it is a result of conscious effort.

original: rang gi ngo bo rang gi ngo bo'i 'bras bu ma yin pas phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rang gi ngo bo'i 'bras bu ma yin pas phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of conscious effort is not a result of the same substance as its cause, because the cause and result are not the same substance.

original: tshogs pa lhan cig skye ba ma yin zhing skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang gcig ma yin pas /
analyzed: tshogs pa lhan cig skye ba ma yin zhing skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang gcig ma yin pas /
translated: The collection is not a result simultaneous with its cause, nor is it a result of conscious effort.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid gsungs so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid gsungs so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the master Sa·πÖghabhadra says that this verse was composed to refute those two.

original: gcig nyid dang tha dad pas kyang mngon par brjod ba rtogs bar bya ste lhan cig pas ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang tha dad pas kyang mngon par brjod ba rtogs bar bya ste lhan cig pas ma yin no //
translated: One should understand that the collection is expressed as one and different, but not as simultaneous.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'di dag 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'di dag 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The result of conscious effort and the result of separation are not the same result.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i 'bras bu ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dir 'bras bu smos pas skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i 'bras bu ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dir 'bras bu smos pas skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The result of the collection is not a result of the same substance as its cause, because it is not a result of natural outflow. Therefore, the result of conscious effort is indicated here by the word result.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu yang de'i khyad par nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu yang de'i khyad par nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The effect of separation is also a specific type of dominant effect.

original: gang zhig 'di dag thams cad kyi dus gzhan dang mjug thogs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di dag thams cad kyi dus gzhan dang mjug thogs su gzung ngo //
translated: It is grasped at the time of all of these and immediately after all of these.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bdag po'i 'bras bu mi gzung ba de ni chos thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin gyi de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa kho na'i ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bdag po'i 'bras bu mi gzung ba de ni chos thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin gyi de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa kho na'i ma yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, the dominant effect is not grasped here, because it is the effect of all phenomena and it is not only the effect of those that immediately follow it.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di dag 'bras bu'i nye ba'i mtshan nyid rnams ma yin pas bdag po'i 'bras bu yang @264a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di dag 'bras bu'i nye ba'i mtshan nyid rnams ma yin pas bdag po'i 'bras bu yang @264a * //
translated: Others say: These are not the characteristics of the effect of the dominant condition, because the effect of the dominant condition is the effect of all phenomena.

original: 'dis 'bras bu'i sgras gzung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'bras bu'i sgras gzung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: This is grasped by the term effect.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis thun mong ba'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa nyid ces so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis thun mong ba'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa nyid ces so //
translated: They are not common characteristics of minds and mental factors.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don du bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don du bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The former term ‚Äúone‚Äù should be included in the sense of ‚Äútogether.‚Äù

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang zhes bya ba de'i sgra gang yin pa de ni snga ma'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang zhes bya ba de'i sgra gang yin pa de ni snga ma'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúone‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúhaving the same arising, abiding, and cessation‚Äù is the former term.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra phyi ma ni thun mong pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra phyi ma ni thun mong pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The latter term ‚Äúone‚Äù should be understood as having a general meaning.

original: de lta na rgyu bcus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na rgyu bcus zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúdue to ten causes.‚Äù

original: dus las bzhi dang / 'bras bu las gsum dang / dge ba la sogs pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: dus las bzhi dang / 'bras bu las gsum dang / dge ba la sogs pa gsum gyis so //
translated: The four times, the three fruits, and the three such as virtue.

original: 'dir ni ma nyam pa'i rnam pa ci rigs par yongs su bgrang gi / thams cad la thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni ma nyam pa'i rnam pa ci rigs par yongs su bgrang gi / thams cad la thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the aspects of non-manifest karma are enumerated in whatever way is appropriate, but not all for all.

original: de la dge ba la sogs pa rnams ni phan tshun du bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba la sogs pa rnams ni phan tshun du bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, those that are virtuous and so on do not have their own nature in relation to each other.

original: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa zag pa med pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa zag pa med pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med la /
translated: Similarly, those that are uncontaminated and subsumed by the uninterrupted path do not have the fruitions of karmic maturation.

original: gzhan rnams la ni bral ba'i 'bras bu yod do //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni bral ba'i 'bras bu yod do //
translated: Others have the fruitions of separation.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa rnams la ni 'bras bu thams cad yod do //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa rnams la ni 'bras bu thams cad yod do //
translated: Those that are virtuous and contaminated and subsumed by the uninterrupted path have all the fruitions.

original: gzhan rnams la ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang bral ba'i 'bras bum gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang bral ba'i 'bras bum gtogs pa'o //
translated: The other minds and mental factors are the effect of the dominant condition of the other minds and mental factors.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The neutral minds and mental factors are the effect of the dominant condition of the other minds and mental factors.

original: de ltar na kha cig ni rgyu lnga yis dang / kha cig ni brgyad kyis sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kha cig ni rgyu lnga yis dang / kha cig ni brgyad kyis sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, some minds and mental factors are the effect of five causes, and some are the effect of eight causes.

original: sems nang na nyung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs ba dag dang gzugs med pa rnams su gal te ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'khor nyung ba'i phyir nyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems nang na nyung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs ba dag dang gzugs med pa rnams su gal te ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'khor nyung ba'i phyir nyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors of the second concentration and above, and the formless states, are called few because their retinue is small.

original: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /üîΩde dag ci'i phyir sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la / de dag ci'i phyir sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Except for their own characteristics.üîΩWhy are they not coemergent causes of mind?

original: de'i mtshan nyid rnams kho nal byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid rnams kho nal byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not endowed with the activity of mind.

original: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi yin te /
translated: Others say there are fourteen.

original: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin dus mang po ba'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang sems la byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin dus mang po ba'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang sems la byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Just as the characteristics of the homogeneous cause are not coemergent causes, so too the characteristics of the pervasive cause are not coemergent causes because they do not function in the mind.

original: de ltan rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltan rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that is so, then the treatise topic divisions declares:

original: gal te sa mang po dag gi mtshan nyid rnams sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin na'o //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig chogs la lta ba'i @264b rgyu can yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te sa mang po dag gi mtshan nyid rnams sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin na'o // sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig chogs la lta ba'i @264b rgyu can yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If the characteristics of the great elements are not coemergent causes of mind,üîΩthen how could the characteristics of the great elements be the cause of the truth of suffering?üîΩThe truth of suffering has the view of the transitory collection as its cause.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod do //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod do // 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The truth of suffering has the view of the transitory collection as its cause but is not a cause of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: It is a cause of the view of the transitory collection but is not a cause of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig chogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
analyzed: 'jig chogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
translated: It is a cause of the view of the transitory collection and has the view of the transitory collection as its cause.üîΩIt is not a cause of the view of the transitory collection and does not have the view of the transitory collection as its cause.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a view of the transitory collection that is not a cause of the view of the transitory collection?

original: de la bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste de dag la 'di bsam par bya'o //üîΩde la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste de dag la 'di bsam par bya'o // de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: The four truths are as follows: All negative tendencies anu≈õaya that are to be abandoned by seeing the four truths and all concomitant states such as feeling vedanƒÅ that are concomitant with them are called the truth of suffering du·∏•khasatya.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun tu 'gro ba 'das pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun tu 'gro ba 'das pa dang /
translated: That which is caused by the view of the transitory collection but is not a cause of the view of the transitory collection is the truth of suffering that is past and present negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, except for those negative tendencies and concomitant states concomitant with them and the truth of suffering that is past and present negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that are pervasive sarvatraga.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang /
translated: and future afflicted view of the self and the truth of suffering concomitant with it,üîΩand except for the arising, aging, enduring and impermanence of those phenomena concomitant with afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is any afflicted truth of suffering other than those,üîΩand it is future negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas ma 'ongs ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa dus gsum pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas ma 'ongs ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa dus gsum pa rnams dang /
translated: and those concomitant with them such as feeling and so on, and those that are not pervasive to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that exist in the three times.

original: kun tu 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs bar ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / 'gog ba dang lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dus gsum ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams te /üîΩde dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs bar ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / 'gog ba dang lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dus gsum ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams te / de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: Those that are past and future that are omnipresent, those concomitant with them such as feeling, those that are abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path and those concomitant with them such as feeling,üîΩare causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: But they are not causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de ltar sngar skyas pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'di @265a * //
analyzed: de ltar sngar skyas pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'di @265a * //
translated: The afflicted view of the self previously explained is the cause of these

original: dag gi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: dag gi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu yin gyi /
translated: by being an omnipresent cause.

original: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: But they are not causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not omnipresent causes.

original: skyes pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu sngar skyes ba ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu sngar skyes ba ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i rgyu'o //
translated: The result of natural outflow of a cause that arose previously is the cause of these by being an omnipresent cause.

original: mu gnyis pa na med do //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa na med do //
translated: The second possibility does not exist.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
translated: It is also the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa gang zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa gang zhe na / de'i phyir ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What is the cause of the afflicted view of the self and is also a result of the afflicted view of the self?

original: ma gtogs pa yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is not included‚Äù refers to the arising, etc. of those factors associated with the afflicted view of the self.

original: de dag sngar skyes pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus skyed pa yin la /üîΩda ltar byung ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag sngar skyes pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus skyed pa yin la / da ltar byung ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
translated: The previously arisen afflicted view of the self generates the arising, etc. of those factors associated with it through its universal cause.üîΩThe present arising of those factors associated with the afflicted view of the self is generated by the co-existent cause.

original: de dag gis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba da ltar byung ba bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba da ltar byung ba bskyed pa yin no //
translated: The present arising of the afflicted view of the self is generated by the co-existent cause of those factors associated with it.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Therefore, the co-existent cause consists of fifty-four factors.

original: zhes bya ba gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the established doctrine.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin la /
translated: What is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self and is not a result of the afflicted view of the self?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /üîΩde ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'am skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste / de ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'am skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'am /
translated: And it is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: It is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self by being a pervasive cause, a homogeneous cause, or a co-existent cause.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang de'i ma yin no //üîΩma gtogs ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho bo cag gis ni skye ba la sogs ba kho na bshad de /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang de'i ma yin no // ma gtogs ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho bo cag gis ni skye ba la sogs ba kho na bshad de /
translated: Nor is the afflicted view of the self a cause of that.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúother than those‚Äù refers to birth, etc.

original: de dag gi don du 'dir nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma gtogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi don du 'dir nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro // ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: We have explained them here, and they are the subject matter of this chapter.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: We should say that whatever is other than those is caused by the afflicted view of the self and is a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: kha che ba rnams na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: 'o na ji ltar 'don zhen 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes de skad du 'don te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'don zhen 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes de skad du 'don te /
translated: But if that is so, how is it that the Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúExcept for the origination, aging, duration, and impermanence of the afflicted view of the self‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ni sems mi skyed de rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ni sems mi skyed de rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is not that origination and so on do not generate the mind, like their own secondary characteristics.

original: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don to //
translated: Therefore, it does not say, ‚Äúthe dharmas concomitant with that.‚Äù

original: kha che ba rnams na re zhes bya ba smos pa ni de dag gis kyang de skad du 'don par bya ba'am zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu @265b cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no des shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re zhes bya ba smos pa ni de dag gis kyang de skad du 'don par bya ba'am zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu @265b cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no des shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Kashmiris say: The term ‚Äúsome‚Äù indicates that there is no reason for them to say that.

original: gzhan dag na ro tshogs 'di dag thams cad phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na ro tshogs 'di dag thams cad phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: All these collections are mutually coemergent causes.

original: chos gzhan gnas pa'i phyir 'di dag thams cad mi 'thad par spang nyid du bshad do //üîΩcig car skyes pa rnams la yang rab tu 'jug pa nyid sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid do //üîΩgzugs dang sems dang ldan ba ma yin pa'i 'du byed dang sems las byung ba rnams rab tu 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug ba yang yin te /üîΩsems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sems dang mtshungs bar ldan ba'i 'du byed rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gzhan gnas pa'i phyir 'di dag thams cad mi 'thad par spang nyid du bshad do // cig car skyes pa rnams la yang rab tu 'jug pa nyid sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid do // gzugs dang sems dang ldan ba ma yin pa'i 'du byed dang sems las byung ba rnams rab tu 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug ba yang yin te / sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sems dang mtshungs bar ldan ba'i 'du byed rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since the other dharmas are not so, all of this is explained as being untenable and to be rejected.

original: gnyi ga ma gtogs pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /üîΩchos kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //üîΩde dag phan tshun dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /üîΩgang las chos phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /

original: de'i stobs kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang 'bras bu du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir chos ches mang ba de dag de'i tshogs kyi 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang 'bras bu du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir chos ches mang ba de dag de'i tshogs kyi 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: because they are not generated by the power of that mind, and because they are many results of that mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: For that reason, they are not called concomitant with mind.

original: 'o na ci ltar de dag sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar de dag sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How then are they co-arisen causes of mind?

original: sems skye ba la sogs pa rnams la de rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems skye ba la sogs pa rnams la de rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are engaged in the generation of mind.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi 'byung ba'i skye ba la bsogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun 'bras bu mi skyed bas 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi 'byung ba'i skye ba la bsogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun 'bras bu mi skyed bas 'di la skyon med do //
translated: The elements are not co-arisen causes of the primary elements, because the primary elements do not generate each other.

original: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not co-arisen causes of each other, because they are engaged in a single object.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni sems las byung ba rnams dang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni sems las byung ba rnams dang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors, the meditative development of the absorptions and the uncontaminated vows are concomitant with mind.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid dang skye ba nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid de rnams ni bya ba bskal ba'i phyir sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid dang skye ba nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid de rnams ni bya ba bskal ba'i phyir sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: The characteristics of those characteristics, such as arising, and the characteristics of the characteristics of arising, etc., are not coemergent causes of mind because they are too remote.

original: phan tshun du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun du yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they reciprocal causes,

original: chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not engaged in the same object.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs ba dang bcas pa phan tshun dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩrdul phra rab rdzas brgyad pa la sogs pa dag gi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / chos gzhan pa yod pa ma yin yang gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa bzhin du dri dang @266a * //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs ba dang bcas pa phan tshun dang zhes bya ba la / rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad pa la sogs pa dag gi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / chos gzhan pa yod pa ma yin yang gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa bzhin du dri dang @266a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the form derived from the great elements that are not homogeneous‚Äù refers to the following.

original: ro dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form derived from the great elements that are not homogeneous is not a different substance from the eight substances of the atoms, etc., but it is like the element of form, etc., in that it lacks smell and taste.

original: thogs pa med pa cung zad dang // zhes bya ba ni so sor thar ba'i sdom pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa cung zad dang // zhes bya ba ni so sor thar ba'i sdom pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the unmanifest form‚Äù refers to the prƒÅtimok·π£a vows.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa rnam pa bdun ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin te sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa rnam pa bdun ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin te sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seven types of unimpeded derivative form subsumed by the absorptions and uncontaminated vows are causes of each other as coemergent causes because they are concomitant with the mind.

original: thams cad 'byung ba dag dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba dag dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: All are causes of the primary elements.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'am thogs pa med kyang rung lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'am thogs pa med kyang rung lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Both impeded and unimpeded derivative form are coemergent causes of the primary elements.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: But the primary elements are not coemergent causes of derivative form because the primary elements are not concomitant with the mind.üîΩBoth primary elements and derivative form are coemergent causes of each other.üîΩBut the primary elements are not coemergent causes of derivative form because the primary elements are not concomitant with the mind.üîΩThe primary elements are not coemergent causes of derivative form because the primary elements are not concomitant with the mind.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis ka yang lhan cig 'byung gi / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin te /üîΩthob pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu du ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis ka yang lhan cig 'byung gi / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin te / thob pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu du ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The primary elements are not coemergent causes of derivative form because the primary elements are not concomitant with the mind.üîΩThe primary elements are not coemergent causes of derivative form because the primary elements are not concomitant with the mind.üîΩThe primary elements are not coemergent causes of derivative form because the primary elements are not concomitant with the mind.

original: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang chos mi mthun pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang chos mi mthun pa'am /

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang chos mi mthun pa ston pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar thob pa rnams kyis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu khon yin la /üîΩsems kyis ni bral pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //üîΩthob pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni thob pa rnams kho na yin la sems kyis ni sems so //üîΩsems gzhan gyi rnam par smin pa ni gzhan yin te /üîΩthob pa rnams 'phen par byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang chos mi mthun pa ston pa'o // 'di ltar thob pa rnams kyis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu khon yin la / sems kyis ni bral pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no // thob pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni thob pa rnams kho na yin la sems kyis ni sems so // sems gzhan gyi rnam par smin pa ni gzhan yin te / thob pa rnams 'phen par byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental factors are not similar to the mind in this respect.üîΩThe mind is the result of conscious effort and the dominant result of the action.

original: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig spyod pa'i ngang tshul can yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang de'i ngang tshul can ma yin bar ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig spyod pa'i ngang tshul can yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni / lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang de'i ngang tshul can ma yin bar ston par byed pa'o //

original: lhan cig tu skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: lhan cig tu skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because they are born, endure, and perish together.

original: 'bras bu gcig ni nda ta y'a tsa /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig ni nda ta y'a tsa /
translated: The effect of the same outcome is the effect of uniform outflow.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams rgyur byas bas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams rgyur byas bas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, derivative form is one, because it is derived from the four great elements.

original: sngar skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / phyis skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / phyis skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu yin no //
translated: The great elements that arise earlier are the homogeneous cause of the great elements that arise later.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus kyang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus kyang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The effect of uniform outflow is also the homogeneous cause.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
translated: The great elements are the cause of derivative form that possesses an effect.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not the co-existent cause,

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu @266b du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu @266b du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect of uniform outflow and the effect of retribution are different.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin la /
translated: The causally concordant and causally concordant-retribution results of virtue and nonvirtue are not the active cause of form derived from the elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang gi rang bzhin kho na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang gi rang bzhin kho na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: The intrinsic nature of form derived from the elements is not the active result.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'ga' zhig ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du sems te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'ga' zhig ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du sems te /
translated: Some say that form derived from the great elements is a coemergent cause,

original: skyed pa po la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa po la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the producer and so on.

original: de dag thams cad kyang rung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All of these are correct.

original: re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gang smras pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gang smras pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the statement, ‚ÄúThat which is a cause as a coemergent cause is a coemergent cause.‚Äù

original: sa bon la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some say that seeds and so on

original: sa bon dang / myu gu dang / 'o ma dang / sbubs 'phyis pa dang / sdong bu la sogs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: sa bon dang / myu gu dang / 'o ma dang / sbubs 'phyis pa dang / sdong bu la sogs pa rnams sam /
translated: Or, seed and sprout, milk and curd, the trunk of a plantain tree, and so on.

original: yang na sa bon dang / 'o ma dang / brdabs pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: yang na sa bon dang / 'o ma dang / brdabs pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: Or, seed, milk, and striking a bell, and so on.

original: de la sa bon ni snga la /
analyzed: de la sa bon ni snga la /
translated: In that regard, the seed is earlier,

original: myu gu ni 'phyi zhing 'am ni snga la zho ni 'phyi'o //
analyzed: myu gu ni 'phyi zhing 'am ni snga la zho ni 'phyi'o //
translated: and the sprout is later, or the milk is earlier and the curd is later.

original: brdabs pa ni snga la sgra ni 'phyi'o //
analyzed: brdabs pa ni snga la sgra ni 'phyi'o //
translated: Striking is earlier and the sound is later.üîΩSince this mode is not seen,

original: tshul 'di mi snang bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang / phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di mi snang bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang / phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: that is, since the cause and effect do not occur simultaneously, and the nature of cause and effect is not seen.

original: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩskyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs su dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang dngos por 'byung ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs su dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang dngos por 'byung ba mi rigs te /
translated: How can coexistent things be cause and effect?üîΩIt is illogical for coexistent things to be cause and effect, because it is illogical for things that exist in the present to be cause and effect.

original: bdag nyid der grub pa'i phyir dang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bdag nyid der grub pa'i phyir dang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is illogical for things that exist in the present to be cause and effect, because it is illogical for things that exist in the present to be either an established entity or a nonexistent entity.

original: de'i phyir de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthat will be explained.‚Äù

original: lhan cig 'byung ba la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the state of being cause and effect is seen even in co-existent causes, he says, for example, and so on.

original: 'od mar me'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'od mar me'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it understood that light is the cause of the lamp?

original: 'di ni mar me'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang 'gro ba dang gnas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'di ni mar me'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang 'gro ba dang gnas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because light follows the increase, decrease, movement, and stillness of the lamp.

original: 'od don du gnyer ba rnams mar me nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / de la sdang ba rnams mar me gsod par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od don du gnyer ba rnams mar me nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / de la sdang ba rnams mar me gsod par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who seek light take up the lamp, and because those who hate it engage in extinguishing the lamp.

original: re zhig ci mar me 'od kyi rgyu yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'di skad du /
analyzed: re zhig ci mar me 'od kyi rgyu yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'di skad du /
translated: ‚ÄúIs the lamp the cause of light?‚Äù and so on.

original: gnyi ga las grub pa ni shes par byed pa yin na 'dis ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos por shes par nus pa ma yin te dpyad pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: gnyi ga las grub pa ni shes par byed pa yin na 'dis ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos por shes par nus pa ma yin te dpyad pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: If the effect is established from both, then the cause is the producer. But this does not prove that coexistent things are a cause, because of the analysis.

original: tshogs pa sngar byung ba ni @267a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa sngar byung ba ni @267a * //
translated: The prior collection is the cause of the light and the flame.

original: 'bru mar dang sdong bu dang / me la sogs pa phrad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar dang sdong bu dang / me la sogs pa phrad pa'o //
translated: The prior collection is the conjunction of oil, wick, and fire.

original: de la ji ltar 'od dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang po'i rgyu 'bru mar dang / sdong bu dang me yin pa de bzhin du 'od dang bcas pa'i mar me'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu yang 'bru mar dang sdong bu dang ;
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'od dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang po'i rgyu 'bru mar dang / sdong bu dang me yin pa de bzhin du 'od dang bcas pa'i mar me'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu yang 'bru mar dang sdong bu dang ;
translated: Just as the light of the first moment is the effect of the conjunction of oil, wick, and fire, so too the second moment of the flame with its light is the effect of the conjunction of oil, wick, and fire.

original: me dang phrad ba kho na yin gyi 'od kyi rgyu mar me ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me dang phrad ba kho na yin gyi 'od kyi rgyu mar me ni ma yin no //
translated: The flame with its light is not the cause of the light.

original: de bzhin du tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho na grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho na grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the prior collection is the cause of the sprout with its shadow.

original: grib ma'i myu gu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grib ma'i myu gu ni ma yin no //
translated: The shadow is not the cause of the sprout.

original: de la grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu dang po'i rgyu zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs gang yin pa de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu dang po'i rgyu zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs gang yin pa de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The cause of the first sprout together with its stain is the same as the cause of the second and subsequent sprouts.

original: gal te de ltar lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos po ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos po ma yin na /
translated: If coexistent things are not the basis of causality,

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: then how can they be said to be possessed?

original: de dag dang ldan pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause they are possessed‚Äù is as follows.

original: yod pa dang med pa de dag 'bras bu gang yod pa de ni de dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de dag 'bras bu gang yod pa de ni de dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The existence or nonexistence of any effect is said to be possessed by those causes.

original: de dag dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni de dag dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni de dag dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The state of being possessed by those causes is called possession.

original: re zhig mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mar me dang / myu gu dang / grib ma bzhin lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung na phan tshun ni go ci ltar rung ste yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mar me dang / myu gu dang / grib ma bzhin lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung na phan tshun ni go ci ltar rung ste yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: For now, if co-arisen things such as eye, form, eye consciousness, lamp, sprout, and shadow are not suitable as cause and effect, how could they be mutually? The meaning is that they do not exist.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable that those that arise simultaneously with the mind are the co-arisen causes of the mind,

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshan gzhi'i yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshan gzhi'i yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: and that characteristics are of the basis of characteristics.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of that alone.

original: phan tshun dag yod pa dang med pa yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: phan tshun dag yod pa dang med pa yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that because mutual existence and nonexistence exist.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If that is so, then, etc.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung bas med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung bas med na mi 'byung ba yin te /

original: de ni phan tshun dag yod pa dang / med na de dang ldan pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun dag yod pa dang / med na de dang ldan pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist or do not exist in mutual dependence, then it follows that they are in a relationship of mutual causality, like a seed and a sprout.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩphan tshun dag yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur te / phan tshun dag yod pa'am /
translated: It also follows that the primary elements and derivative form are in a relationship of mutual causality,

original: med na yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩsems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya @267b ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: med na yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya @267b ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: because they exist or do not exist in mutual dependence.üîΩIf they exist or do not exist in mutual dependence, then it follows that they are in a relationship of mutual causality, like a seed and a sprout.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the following:

original: phan tshun thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: phan tshun thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It also follows that the secondary characteristics of the mind and so on are in a relationship of mutual causality.

original: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams med par ni sems la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams med par ni sems la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba med do //
translated: The secondary characteristics of the mind and so on do not occur in the absence of the mind and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the secondary characteristics that accompany the mind and the obtainment that arises simultaneously with the mind and so on.

original: sems la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'jug pa rnams thob ba dang ldan pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'jug pa rnams thob ba dang ldan pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmind and so on‚Äù should be understood to include the obtainment of the mental factors and so on.

original: 'dir de'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga phyir 'byung ba dag kho na la rigs kyi /
analyzed: 'dir de'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga phyir 'byung ba dag kho na la rigs kyi /
translated: Here, the cause and effect are only sequential, because there is no error in their characteristics.

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that they are simultaneous, because there would be an error.

original: 'o na ni dbyu gu gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni dbyu gu gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the case of the three sticks,

original: ji ltar dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba gang dag phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de dag phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: ji ltar dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba gang dag phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de dag phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: just as the three sticks stand by the power of mutual support, so too, those that are simultaneous and stand by the power of mutual support are the effect of each other.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore they are simultaneous causes.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni phan tshun stobs dang 'byung ba'i stobs kyis gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni phan tshun stobs dang 'byung ba'i stobs kyis gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Primary matter does not stand by the power of mutual support or the power of the elements.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi stobs kyis yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi stobs kyis yin no //
translated: It is by the power of their own characteristics.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //

original: re zhig ci 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la ;
analyzed: re zhig ci 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la ;
translated: First of all, are these, etc.

original: dbyu gu gsum ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The three staffs are not enduring, because they are momentary.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ji srid de ltar skyes pa dang / 'gal ba'i rkyen med kyi bar du de ltar gnas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma'i mngon par tshogs te gnas pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: ji srid de ltar skyes pa dang / 'gal ba'i rkyen med kyi bar du de ltar gnas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma'i mngon par tshogs te gnas pa skye ba yin no //
translated: As long as there is no arising of something opposed to them, the prior moments of their endurance, which are the causes of the subsequent moments, are generated in a series.

original: phan tshun gyi stobs kho nas de na gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi stobs kho nas de na gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not endure by the power of their mutual dependence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

analyzed: de la gzhan yang zhes bya brgyas bar 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de lta na dpe don dang mi mtshungs so //

analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshungs par ston par byed de /

original: sogs pa smos pas ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa dang byed rgyu'i rgyu la sogs pa gzung gi mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text indicates that homogeneous causes, omnipresent causes, causes of karmic maturation, and active causes are also similar to the example of the eye and its primary elements.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text indicates that homogeneous causes, omnipresent causes, causes of karmic maturation, and active causes are also similar to the example of the eye and its primary elements.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text indicates that homogeneous causes, omnipresent causes, causes of karmic maturation, and active causes are also similar to the example of the eye and its primary elements.

analyzed: phan tshun gyi 'bras bu can no // gang zhig @268a * //

analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i 'bras bu nye ba dang ring bar skyed pa dang gsos 'debs par byed pa'i phyir na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni phan tshun du nyon mongs ba can rnams kyi yin la /
