translated: Undeclared states are homogeneous causes of each other.

original: gzhan dag na ri lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na ri lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Others say: Undeclared form is the homogeneous cause of the five types of undeclared form alone and so on.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gsal ba yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gsal ba yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin la /
translated: Because they possess focal objects, feeling and so on are clear but form is not.

original: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba'i 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba'i 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for the result of a clear action to be unclear.

original: dman pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu yin pa bkag gi / gsal ba mi gsal ba yin pa ni ma bkag ste /
analyzed: dman pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu yin pa bkag gi / gsal ba mi gsal ba yin pa ni ma bkag ste /
translated: The result of a cause that is inferior is not denied, but the result of a clear action being unclear is denied.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes ba'i yang gsum po yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes ba'i yang gsum po yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then consciousness would not be the third result,

original: dngos po tsam la lta ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la lta ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because it would be the mere thing itself.

original: gzhan dag na re cig shos gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re cig shos gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The other is clear.

original: gzugs lung du ma bstan pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma thams cad do //
analyzed: gzugs lung du ma bstan pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma thams cad do //
translated: Undeclared form is all that remains of form when the declared form of body and speech, that is, the form that is the informative action and the noninformative action, is excluded.

original: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The embryo at the kalala stage is the result of the ten stages, beginning with the kalala stage.

original: nur nur bo dang / mer mer po dang / gor gor po dang / mkhrang 'gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs rnams ni mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga'o //
analyzed: nur nur bo dang / mer mer po dang / gor gor po dang / mkhrang 'gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs rnams ni mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga'o //
translated: The five stages of the womb are the stages of kalala, arbuda, pe≈õin, ghana, and pra≈õƒÅkhƒÅ.

original: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs rnams zhing tsas pa'i gnas skabs lnga'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs rnams zhing tsas pa'i gnas skabs lnga'o //
translated: The five stages of growth are the stages of the infant, the child, the youth, the adult, and the aged person.

original: de la nur nur po'i gnas skabs 'phel ba yid pa'i phyir sngar skyes pa phyis skye ba'i gnas skabs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas gnas skabs bcu char dag gi yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la nur nur po'i gnas skabs 'phel ba yid pa'i phyir sngar skyes pa phyis skye ba'i gnas skabs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas gnas skabs bcu char dag gi yang rgyu yin no //
translated: The kalala stage is the homogeneous cause of the ten stages, because it is the cause of the later stages that arise from its development.

original: de bzhin du mer mer po @268b la sogs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mer mer po @268b la sogs pa rnams kyang /
translated: The arbuda stage and so on are also like this.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa dag gi yin no zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa dag gi yin no zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to each.

original: re re phri nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re re phri nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúsubtracting one‚Äù means

original: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni snga ma'am /
analyzed: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni snga ma'am /
translated: that the result of the homogeneous cause is either earlier or later.

original: lhan cig pa yin pa rnam bar gzhag par bya ba ma yin pas re re phri nas zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: lhan cig pa yin pa rnam bar gzhag par bya ba ma yin pas re re phri nas zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Since it is not to be posited as coemergent, it is explained as ‚Äúsubtracted from each.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs snga ma dgu rnams ni phyi ma'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas skabs snga ma dgu rnams ni phyi ma'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: The first nine states are conditions of the latter,

original: bcu pa rgan ba'i gnas skabs kyi bar du rkyen te rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bcu pa rgan ba'i gnas skabs kyi bar du rkyen te rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: up to the tenth state of old age, but they are not causes.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that they would have results.

original: de'i phyir ris mthun gcig la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ris mthun gcig la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore the Abhidharmakosa notes, ‚ÄúIn one type of life.‚Äù

original: skye ba gcig la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba gcig la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means in one birth.

original: rnam pa mthun pa gzhan du ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa mthun pa gzhan du ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: In other similar types,

original: dper na sngar skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu po dag ni phyis skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu char gyi yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te 'dra ba'i yin pa'i phyir dang / sngar skyes pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dper na sngar skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu po dag ni phyis skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu char gyi yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te 'dra ba'i yin pa'i phyir dang / sngar skyes pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: for example, the ten states subsumed by the type of life of a human born previously are homogeneous causes of the ten states subsumed by the type of life of a human born later, because they are similar and because they arise earlier.

original: nur nur po'i gzugs ni rgyu nyid dang tha ma rgan po'i gzugs ni 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: nur nur po'i gzugs ni rgyu nyid dang tha ma rgan po'i gzugs ni 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The form of the embryo is the cause, and the form of the old person is the result.

original: phyi'i dag la yang zhes bya ba la nas dang s'a lu la sogs pa dag la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dag la yang zhes bya ba la nas dang s'a lu la sogs pa dag la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the external, also, this same method should be applied as appropriate to barley, rice, and so on.

original: mdo sde pa kha cig na re gzugs la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med kyi de ni rkyen la rag las te skye ba yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa kha cig na re gzugs la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med kyi de ni rkyen la rag las te skye ba yin te /
translated: Some Sautrantikas say that form does not have a homogeneous cause, but it arises in dependence on conditions,

original: khrod pa'i gting nas drangs pa'i sa las myu gu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrod pa'i gting nas drangs pa'i sa las myu gu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a sprout arises from earth that is drawn up from the depths of the field.üîΩIn this way, the seed of that sprout does not exist in that earth.

original: 'di ltar de la de'i sa bon yod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi dbang du byas nas gang dag gzugs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la de'i sa bon yod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi dbang du byas nas gang dag gzugs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the desire realm‚Äù is stated from the perspective of those who say this.

original: rgyu dang bdag po zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bdag po zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Cause and dominant condition means causal condition and dominant condition.

original: de la skyes zin ba'i phyir dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la skyes zin ba'i phyir dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have already arisen and because they are unobscured neutral form.

original: 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Past primary elements are not the coemergent cause, the homogeneous cause, the concomitant cause or the omnipresent cause of future primary elements.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'dra ba'i phyir dang sngar skyes pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing rkyen rnams las bdag po'i rkyen yin par rtogs par bya ba yin pas 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir dang sngar skyes pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing rkyen rnams las bdag po'i rkyen yin par rtogs par bya ba yin pas 'gal ba med de /
translated: They are the homogeneous cause because they are similar and because they arise earlier. They are the dominant condition of those primary elements from among the conditions.

original: 'dir nye ba ni bdag po'i rkyen dang rgyur bshad do /
analyzed: 'dir nye ba ni bdag po'i rkyen dang rgyur bshad do /
translated: There is no contradiction because they are explained to be the dominant condition and the cause of that which is proximate.

original: @269a * // ring ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba rigs pa dang 'gal bas 'di gzhung gi tshul du mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: @269a * // ring ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba rigs pa dang 'gal bas 'di gzhung gi tshul du mi gzung ngo //
translated: The condition that is distant is not to be accepted as a principle because it contradicts reasoning.

original: na dh'a tu yugti bh'irya te khron pa'i gting nas bton pa'i sa la yang myu gu skyes pa'i snga rol nas bon yod kyang rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir myu gu mi skye'o //
analyzed: na dh'a tu yugti bh'irya te khron pa'i gting nas bton pa'i sa la yang myu gu skyes pa'i snga rol nas bon yod kyang rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir myu gu mi skye'o //
translated: Even though the seed exists prior to the sprout, the sprout does not arise from the seed because it is devoid of conditions.

original: de lta ma yin te skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med na ni thams cad de las skye ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med na ni thams cad de las skye ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, if the homogeneous cause did not exist, everything would arise from everything,

original: yang na cung zad kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: yang na cung zad kyang mi skye ste /
translated: or nothing would arise,

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no fixed cause.

original: 'dra ba nyid nges par ma dpyad pa'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na de lta na sa dgu pa rnams dang / ris lnga pa rnams phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur na rigs pa ma yin pas 'dra ba nyid nges par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid nges par ma dpyad pa'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na de lta na sa dgu pa rnams dang / ris lnga pa rnams phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur na rigs pa ma yin pas 'dra ba nyid nges par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: If all things were the homogeneous cause of all things because of the mere similarity of their nature, then it would follow that the nine levels would be the homogeneous cause of each other, and the five types of rebirth would be the homogeneous cause of each other.üîΩBut that is illogical. Therefore, in order to determine the similarity that is the homogeneous cause, the question is asked:

original: ci 'dra ba thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Is the homogeneous cause only that which is similar?

original: de lta na yang phyis skye ba yang sngar skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyis skye ba yang sngar skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: However, a later arising dharma is a homogeneous cause of a former arising dharma.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yang lhan cig skyes pa yin la ;
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yang lhan cig skyes pa yin la ;
translated: And a simultaneous dharma is a homogeneous cause of a simultaneous dharma.

original: ma skyes pa yang skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And a nonarisen dharma is a homogeneous cause of a nonarisen dharma.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, not all former dharmas are homogeneous causes of later dharmas.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sngar skyes rnams zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sngar skyes rnams zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThose that have arisen previously.‚Äù

original: sngar skyes pa nyid kyis 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa nyid kyis 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba gzung ngo //
translated: Those that have arisen previously are past and present dharmas.

original: de ltar na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin par sngar skyes pa dang phyis skyes pa rnams so zhes brjod na 'bras bu ma skyes pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur ma bshad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa yin no // de lta ma yin par sngar skyes pa dang phyis skyes pa rnams so zhes brjod na 'bras bu ma skyes pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur ma bshad par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus the definition of a homogeneous cause is complete.üîΩIf it were otherwise, that is, if the root text stated, ‚ÄúThose that have arisen previously and those that will arise later,‚Äù then an unarisen effect would not be described as a homogeneous cause.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams zhes brjod na /
translated: If the root text stated, ‚ÄúThose that are past, future, and present,‚Äù then a future dharma would not be a homogeneous cause.

original: 'bras bu 'das pa ma bshad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa ma bshad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of past action has not yet been explained.

original: de ltar bshad na 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: If this is explained in this way, then past action is homogeneous cause of past, future, and present action.

original: da ltar byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: Present action is homogeneous cause of future action.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But future action is not homogeneous cause of future action.üîΩFrom what is this known?

original: 'di gang las zhes bya ni ci lung ngam 'on te rigs pa las yin zhes bya'o //üîΩma 'ongs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gang las zhes bya ni ci lung ngam 'on te rigs pa las yin zhes bya'o // ma 'ongs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: From scripture or from reasoning?

original: bstan bcos las te zhes bya bas ni lung ston par byed de /
analyzed: bstan bcos las te zhes bya bas ni lung ston par byed de /
translated: The author of the treatise declares that future action is not homogeneous cause.üîΩWhat is homogeneous cause?

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar byung ba @269b rnams ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar byung ba @269b rnams ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Past roots of virtue are homogeneous cause of later roots of virtue that are more advanced.

original: aa yi ma t'i ta warn'a s'a n'a dh'a bhe de na grantha: de ltar na 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni dus kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: aa yi ma t'i ta warn'a s'a n'a dh'a bhe de na grantha: de ltar na 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni dus kyi dbye bas so //
translated: Thus past are causes of past and present.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The dharmas associated with them, such as sensation, etc., are also causes of similar dharmas.

original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu ma 'ongs ('dis 'das pa nus pas bsgribs pas lam tha dang pa brgyud) pa med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu ma 'ongs ('dis 'das pa nus pas bsgribs pas lam tha dang pa brgyud) pa med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no future homogeneous cause.

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams she na /
translated: How can past and present be homogeneous causes?

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because future dharmas are not mentioned as being homogeneous causes.

original: gal te bstan bcos tshad mar byed na gang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dus gsum pa nyid du ston pa 'di yang bstan bcos yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos tshad mar byed na gang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dus gsum pa nyid du ston pa 'di yang bstan bcos yin no //
translated: If you accept the authority of the treatises, then this treatise would contradict the statement that the homogeneous cause belongs to the three times.

original: smras pa nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: We say that it is never.

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin no zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin no zhes sbyar te /
translated: It is not a cause because it is not the proper occasion.

original: dus gsum kar yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gsum kar yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is a cause in all three times.

original: 'dis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This demonstrates that homogeneous cause exists in the future.üîΩThe treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:üîΩIt is not that it never is.

original: des ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs ba bzhin du yang bkag pas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: des ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs ba bzhin du yang bkag pas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, just as future homogeneous cause is refuted, it is also refuted in the treatise.

original: phal che ba'i tshul la brten nas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa la dgongs te gsungs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal che ba'i tshul la brten nas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa la dgongs te gsungs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The treatise does not contradict that because it is stated with the intention of focusing on coemergent causes and so on that are the majority.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'dra ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'dra ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang yin par 'dod do //
translated: Because they do not have a sequence of earlier and later and because cause and effect are not similar, future states are also asserted to be homogeneous cause.

original: gang zhig chos ma 'ongs pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig chos ma 'ongs pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: That which is a future phenomenon is also a homogeneous cause.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ni gegs thams cad log pa yin pa'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du nges te /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ni gegs thams cad log pa yin pa'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du nges te /
translated: That which is about to arise is definitely a homogeneous cause because all obstructions to its arising have ceased.

original: snga phyi'i rim pa gnas pa de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs tha ma la dgongs nas /
analyzed: snga phyi'i rim pa gnas pa de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs tha ma la dgongs nas /
translated: Since the order of earlier and later is definite, the final state of the future is intended.

original: nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin zhes gsungs pas ma 'ongs pa yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin zhes gsungs pas ma 'ongs pa yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since it is said that it is never not a cause, the future is also a homogeneous cause.

original: de'i de ni lan du mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i de ni lan du mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: That is not a suitable response.üîΩIf you say that the final state is intended, then the state of arising is not a cause because it does not exist earlier.

original: tha ma'i gnas la dgongs pa yin zhe na ni snga na med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs ni ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir nam yang rgyu ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba @270a * //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas la dgongs pa yin zhe na ni snga na med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs ni ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir nam yang rgyu ma yin no // zhes bya ba @270a * //
translated: Since the state of arising is that which has arisen from what has not yet arisen, it is said that it is never not a cause.

original: 'di 'gal te /
analyzed: 'di 'gal te /
translated: This contradicts the treatise.

original: gnas skabs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes evident the entity that is the cause of all the states.

original: gzhan dag na re tha ma'i gnas skabs kyang ma byung ba las da ltar byung ba'i dus nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tha ma'i gnas skabs kyang ma byung ba las da ltar byung ba'i dus nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Others say: The final state also is the present time, because it did not exist before.

original: tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The collection of causes is the result of the state.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni snga phyi'i rim pa ma nges pas skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i gnas skabs kyang phyis dngos po la mngon par 'jug go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni snga phyi'i rim pa ma nges pas skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i gnas skabs kyang phyis dngos po la mngon par 'jug go //
translated: The future is not definite in terms of sequence, because the state that is about to arise is later than the state that has already arisen.

original: dus nges pas ni 'das pa snga pa dang / ma 'ongs pas 'phyi ba dang da ltar ba snga phyi med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus nges pas ni 'das pa snga pa dang / ma 'ongs pas 'phyi ba dang da ltar ba snga phyi med pa ma yin no //
translated: But the past is not later than the present, nor is the future.

original: de la yang skye ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa dang phyis byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: de la yang skye ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa dang phyis byas pa yin pas /
translated: Moreover, the future is called arising and arising again, because it is later than the present.

original: de'i tshe de 'bras bu la nye pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de 'bras bu la nye pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is near to the result.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag ba zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag ba zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsimilar and immediately antecedent‚Äù is the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: rtog pa 'di zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu la byas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu la byas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis conceptualization‚Äù refers to the homogeneous cause.üîΩSince it is certain that it is the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition that removes all obstacles to the arising of a dharma, it is never not the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition.

original: chos ma skyes ba'i tshe'i gnas skabs na gegs thams cad bsal ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por nges pas nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin bzhin du ci'i phyir 'di skad duüîΩgal te zhes bya ba rgya cher smras so //
analyzed: chos ma skyes ba'i tshe'i gnas skabs na gegs thams cad bsal ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por nges pas nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin bzhin du ci'i phyir 'di skad du gal te zhes bya ba rgya cher smras so //
translated: Why then does the root text ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not the case that‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on?

original: gnas brtan 'dus bzang ni 'di la skyon med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan 'dus bzang ni 'di la skyon med do zhes zer ro //
translated: The elder Sa·πÉghabhadra says that there is no error here.

original: go skabs bzhin pas rab tu phye bas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: go skabs bzhin pas rab tu phye bas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The equivalent and immediately antecedent condition is distinguished by the fact that it is the immediately preceding condition that is capable of giving rise to a dharma.

original: skye ba'i go skabs 'byin pa yin gyi skyes pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: skye ba'i go skabs 'byin pa yin gyi skyes pa ni ma yin la /
translated: It gives rise to the opportunity for the arising of a dharma, but it does not give rise to the dharma that has already arisen.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyi rgyu las skye ba 'byin pa nyid sa bon gyi chos su gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyi rgyu las skye ba 'byin pa nyid sa bon gyi chos su gnas pa yin no //
translated: The fact that it gives rise to the arising of a dharma that is in the nature of a seed from a cause that is in the nature of a seed is what constitutes its being in the nature of a seed.

original: de ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang rgyu med par mtshungs pas da ltar ba rnams 'bras bu lnga 'dzin par byed do //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang rgyu med par mtshungs pas da ltar ba rnams 'bras bu lnga 'dzin par byed do // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because they are similar in being the equivalent immediately preceding condition and in being without cause, present states hold five effects.

original: da ltar ba nyid 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because the present itself is about to cease, it is called ‚Äúthat which is in the process of ceasing.‚Äù

original: de ltar rgyu dang rkyen dag khyad par med do //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang rkyen dag khyad par med do //
translated: Thus, there is no difference between cause and condition.

original: rgyu'i dngos po med par sa bon gyi chos dag yod pa ma yin pas gang du skye ba nyid rgyur kun tu gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po med par sa bon gyi chos dag yod pa ma yin pas gang du skye ba nyid rgyur kun tu gnas so //
translated: Since the state of being a cause does not exist without the state of being a seed, that which is in the process of arising is posited as the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na mi skye ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa ma 'ongs pa thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi skye ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa ma 'ongs pa thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then all future states, with the exception of those phenomena that are unarisen, would be homogeneous causes.

original: sngon nyid du skye ba'i gnas skabs rnams skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon nyid du skye ba'i gnas skabs rnams skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not definite that states that are in the process of arising in the past are homogeneous causes.

original: der ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: der ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Just as that is so, it should be stated here as well.

original: ji ltar de nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma @270b yin no zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar de nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma @270b yin no zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Just as it is said that it is never not a cause, so too here it should be said that it is never not an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: ji ltar 'dir gal te chos ma skyes pa yin na'o zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du der yang gal te chos ma skyes par 'gyur na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gal te chos ma skyes pa yin na'o zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du der yang gal te chos ma skyes par 'gyur na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as here it is said, ‚ÄúIf the phenomenon is not yet arisen,‚Äù so too there it should be said, ‚ÄúIf the phenomenon is not yet arisen.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'dir bstan bcos byed pa mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir bstan bcos byed pa mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus here the treatise writer is not skilled in composition.üîΩSince it is said that it is never not an equivalent immediately preceding condition, it is not possible to say that it is not an equivalent immediately preceding condition in the context of the final moment.

original: gang gi phyir nam yang ma yin no zhes smras pas tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas nas go skabs ma phye ba yin pas gal te chos de la skyes par gyur na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin no zhes bya bas tha ma'i gnas
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam yang ma yin no zhes smras pas tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas nas go skabs ma phye ba yin pas gal te chos de la skyes par gyur na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin no zhes bya bas tha ma'i gnas
translated: If that phenomenon has arisen, it is not an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: skabs kyi dbang du byas nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs kyi dbang du byas nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore it should be said that it is not an equivalent immediately preceding condition in the context of the final moment.

original: nam yang ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam yang ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not that it is never not an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: de lta bas na snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe former‚Äù and so on refers to the coemergent cause, the concomitant cause, and the cause of karmic maturation.

original: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for those‚Äù means that the afflicted view of the self is the effect of the cause of the afflicted view of the self,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the afflicted view of the self is the cause of the effect of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'di ni 'dir ma 'ongs pa la skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i khungs yin no //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden ba ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir ma 'ongs pa la skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i khungs yin no // 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden ba ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the source for the statement that the homogeneous cause exists in the future.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúexcept for the future afflicted view of the self and the truth of suffering that is concomitant with it‚Äù indicates that the future afflicted view of the self is established.

original: gang las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: gang las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe afflicted view of the self that is the cause of the afflicted view of the self‚Äù means that the afflicted view of the self is the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba /
translated: It is not posited as a concomitant cause.

original: tshogs pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The other afflicted view of the self does not exist in that assembly because it is unobscured neutral states.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin ba'i rgyu ni mi srid la /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin ba'i rgyu ni mi srid la /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is impossible because it is not the cause of karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na bzhed pas lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na bzhed pas lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is asserted here that it is a homogeneous cause alone.

original: des na lan snga ma kho na legs pa yin no zhes brjod bar mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na lan snga ma kho na legs pa yin no zhes brjod bar mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore the former response is better.üîΩThis is not to be said, because it is stated that future afflicted view of the self is concomitant with it.

original: 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The extensive explanation of action is as follows.

original: de skad du 'don pa'i khyad par gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu spangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de skad du 'don pa'i khyad par gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu spangs par 'gyur la /
translated: The distinction in the reading of the text would abandon the homogeneous cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnyed par @271a * //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnyed par @271a * //
translated: and coemergent and concomitant causes are obtained.

original: 'gyur ro // don gyis ni de ltar go bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // don gyis ni de ltar go bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is to be understood in this way.

original: gal te rab tu grags pa'i phyir 'don pa gzhan du bya ba ma yin no snyam pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: gal te rab tu grags pa'i phyir 'don pa gzhan du bya ba ma yin no snyam pa'i sems ni /
translated: If you think that the order of the text should not be changed because it is well known,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi rim pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes don gyis na de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi rim pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes don gyis na de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: the meaning is to be understood in this way: because there is no sequence of earlier and later in the future, it is impossible for a nonarisen state to be a homogeneous cause or omnipresent cause.

original: bzhi tshan du nges pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi tshan du nges pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourfold division is definite.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi rgyu yin pa nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi rgyu yin pa nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Any phenomenon that is the cause of any phenomenon is never not a cause.

original: dus gsum dag tu yang rgyu nyid de 'bras bu dang rten dang dmigs bar yang brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: dus gsum dag tu yang rgyu nyid de 'bras bu dang rten dang dmigs bar yang brjod par bya'o ;
translated: It is a cause in the three times, and it is also called a result, a support, and an object.

original: / de'i phyir rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la sogs pa ltar gnas skabs thams cad du nges pa kho na yin pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la sogs pa ltar gnas skabs thams cad du nges pa kho na yin pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, causes are definitely fixed in all circumstances, like effects and so on. Thus, future homogeneous causes exist.

original: 'dir rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Here, the cause is the concomitant cause, etc.

original: 'dir thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni chos 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni chos 'dus byas sam /
translated: Here, the term all refers to conditioned phenomena or

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: mind and mental factors.

original: thams cad la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Not all have a ripened effect,

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: therefore they are not causes of ripening.

original: bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir byed rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir byed rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: And because they operate without distinction, they are not active causes.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no sequence of earlier and later in the future, they are not homogeneous causes or omnipresent causes.

original: chos thams cad la yod pa'i phyir skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i bras bu dag kho na yongs su gzung gi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la yod pa'i phyir skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i bras bu dag kho na yongs su gzung gi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Because they exist for all phenomena, only the active and dominant results are included, but not the others.

original: chos thams cad la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist for all phenomena.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yin par khas mi len pa la yang nyes pa de yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas bar smos so //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yin par khas mi len pa la yang nyes pa de yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas bar smos so //
translated: The error also applies to the assertion that future states are homogeneous causes,

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyud ltar ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyud ltar ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: because if they are homogeneous causes only when they are present,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin na de lta na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las yin par gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin na de lta na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las yin par gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would become homogeneous causes when they are not homogeneous causes.

original: de'i phyir dus thams cad kyi tshe yod ba nyid du dam bca' ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus thams cad kyi tshe yod ba nyid du dam bca' ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it contradicts the assertion that they exist at all times.

original: gnas skabs la ni 'dod pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnas skabs la ni 'dod pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThey are homogeneous only when they are present.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rdzas thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nyid du dam 'cha'i gnas skabs rnams ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdzas thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nyid du dam 'cha'i gnas skabs rnams ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med par ston to //
translated: This shows that there is no contradiction, since the state of having existed is asserted for all substances, but not for the states.

original: chos ni tshogs pa'i dbang gis gnas @271b skabs gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos ni tshogs pa'i dbang gis gnas @271b skabs gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
translated: A dharma endures due to the power of the assemblage.

original: med pa ni chos gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: med pa ni chos gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that a nonexistent transforms into another dharma.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the assemblage has only a state as its effect.

original: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: Since it does not have a substance as its effect, this error does not exist.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If it were like the cause of karmic maturation, etc.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba la skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba la skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would happen? What error would occur?

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it were like the cause of karmic maturation, it would be future.

original: bstan bcos las de yang smos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las de yang smos par 'gyur na /
translated: It would be mentioned in the treatise.

original: smos pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smos pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not mentioned.

original: de las ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de las ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: From that, it is said that future roots of virtue are homogeneous causes of future roots of virtue.

original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs par rtogs na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs par rtogs na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if future homogeneous causes are realized, it would contradict the treatise.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'dis ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba spong ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'dis ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba spong ngo //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: The past is able to yield results.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin par nus pa ni da ltar ba yin zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin par nus pa ni da ltar ba yin zhing /
translated: The present is able to hold results.üîΩThe future is not able to yield results or hold results.

original: 'ga' zhig 'byin pa yang yin na ma 'ongs pa de ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin par byed nus pa ma yin pas bstan bcos las ma smos kyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'byin pa yang yin na ma 'ongs pa de ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin par byed nus pa ma yin pas bstan bcos las ma smos kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned in the treatise.

original: med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not because it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is not so.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ma smos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ma smos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that future states are not mentioned because they cannot produce or hold results.

original: 'o na ci zhe na med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: What is it? It is because they do not exist.

original: 'di ji ltar shes shen na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes shen na /
translated: How is this known?

original: de'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe homogeneous cause is a cause that produces results similar to itself.‚Äù

original: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dra ba yin la /
translated: Homogeneous means cause and effect are similar.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yang /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yang /
translated: The homogeneous cause is also called the cause of similar lot.

original: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i zhes 'byung ba des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na de ni ma 'ongs pa la rigs pa ma yin te snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i zhes 'byung ba des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na de ni ma 'ongs pa la rigs pa ma yin te snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is said to have a result, it is not logical that it exists in the future, because prior and subsequent states do not exist in the future.

original: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal ba'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu nyid rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal ba'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu nyid rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that they are reciprocal results because it follows that they would be reciprocal causes and effects.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ltar skye ba ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun bar 'gyur ba mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ltar skye ba ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun bar 'gyur ba mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it untenable that future states are the homogeneous cause of future states?

original: ji ltar 'das pa da ltar byung ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'dras bu ma yin pa bzhin dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa da ltar byung ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'dras bu ma yin pa bzhin dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the homogeneous cause and the effect of service, which are not past and present, and cause and effect are not prior and subsequent states.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu snga na rgyu don med par thal ba'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag @272a * //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu snga na rgyu don med par thal ba'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag @272a * //
translated: If the effect precedes the cause, it follows that the cause would be purposeless.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And cause and effect are different in nature.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid de'i 'bras bu las tha dad de /üîΩrnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid de'i 'bras bu las tha dad de / rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
translated: The effect of the ripening cause is different from that cause,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe cause of ripening is only nonvirtue and contaminated virtue.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang rang gi rgyu las mtshan nyid tha dad de ;
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang rang gi rgyu las mtshan nyid tha dad de ;
translated: The effect of the ripening cause is also different in nature from its cause,

original: rnam smin lung dum bstan zhes so //
analyzed: rnam smin lung dum bstan zhes so //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe ripening is neutral.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'dir snga phyi med cing phan tshun 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir snga phyi med cing phan tshun 'bras bu med do //
translated: Therefore, in this case, there is no priority or posteriority and no mutual effect.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dag ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin tha dad pas tha dad pa ma yin no//'o na ci zhe na dus snga phyir 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dag ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin tha dad pas tha dad pa ma yin no//'o na ci zhe na dus snga phyir 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Coemergent causes and homogeneous causes are not different in the sense of being different substantial entities, but they are different in the sense of being different isolates.

original: de'i phyir snga phyi med na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga phyi med na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they were not sequential, they would be homogeneous causes of each other.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not karmic maturation causes of each other.

original: gnas skabs las rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas skabs las rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are distinguished by their states.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa dang / da ltar ba'i gnas skabs kho na yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa dang / da ltar ba'i gnas skabs kho na yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: Homogeneous causes are definitely sequential and are homogeneous causes in the past and present states, but not in the future state.

original: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na zhes mtshan nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na zhes mtshan nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: Karmic maturation causes are definitely distinguished by their characteristics, because they are nonvirtuous and contaminated virtuous states.

original: mtshan nyid kyang dus gsum du 'khrul ba med pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi bzlog go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang dus gsum du 'khrul ba med pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi bzlog go //
translated: Also, since it is not mistaken regarding the three times, it does not stop future states.

original: sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du //
analyzed: sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du //
translated: The path of the nine levels

original: mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
analyzed: mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
translated: is homogeneous and superior.

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: This is extensively stated.

original: sa dgu la brten nas rtogs pa'i phyir sa dgu'i zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sa dgu la brten nas rtogs pa'i phyir sa dgu'i zhes brjod do //
translated: The path of the nine levels is called the path of the nine levels because it is realized in dependence on the nine levels.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam de ni sas bsdus pas lam yang sa tha dad par mtshungs bzhin dus dgu'i lam kho na phan tshun skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam de ni sas bsdus pas lam yang sa tha dad par mtshungs bzhin dus dgu'i lam kho na phan tshun skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Since that contaminated path is subsumed by the levels, the path of the nine levels is homogeneous sabhƒÅga and superior visabhƒÅga cause of the path of the nine levels alone, but it is not a homogeneous cause of contaminated states.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: de'i phyir rgyu smras pa ni 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu smras pa ni 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The reason is stated: It is a guest in those levels.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pas ma bsdus pas sa dag glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pas ma bsdus pas sa dag glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: Since it is not subsumed by the desire, form and formless realms like contaminated states, it is a guest in those levels.

original: sa dgu pa la brten nas 'thob pa'i phyir sa dgu la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dgu pa la brten nas 'thob pa'i phyir sa dgu la zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ninth stage because it is obtained in dependence on the ninth stage.

original: yang ji ltar sa de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin par shes she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin par shes she na /
translated: How are they classified in those stages?

original: de'i phyir sa de pa'i srid pa bdag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa de pa'i srid pa bdag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the existence of those stages is not appropriated by the self,

original: sred pas bdag gir byas pas yongs @272b su bcad pas khams dang sa rnams yongs su gcod pa yin la bdag gir byas pa yang dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa yin na /
analyzed: sred pas bdag gir byas pas yongs @272b su bcad pas khams dang sa rnams yongs su gcod pa yin la bdag gir byas pa yang dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa yin na /
translated: because they are defined by the realms and stages that are defined by the appropriation of existence by craving, and because appropriation increases through the focal object and concomitance.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas pa ma yin te de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas pa ma yin te de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But uncontaminated states are not appropriated by the craving of the desire, form, and formless realms because they are antidotes to that craving.

original: 'o na ci ltar lam don du gnyer bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar lam don du gnyer bar byed ce na /
translated: How then do they strive for the path?

original: de ni chos la 'dun pa dge ba zhig yin te /üîΩ'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni chos la 'dun pa dge ba zhig yin te / 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
translated: That is a virtuous aspiration for Dharma.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not attachment because it is abandoned.

original: de ltar lam glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ris mthun pa gzhan gyis pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du thal ba yin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar lam glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ris mthun pa gzhan gyis pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du thal ba yin kyang /
translated: Thus, because the path is adventitious, it is the homogeneous cause of other states of similar type.

original: mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But it is the cause of the equal and superior.üîΩThis is stated because it is the cause of the equal and superior but not the inferior.

original: gong dang 'og dang rang gis pa mnyam pa dang khyad par can gnyis kyi yin gyi /üîΩchung ngu'i ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gong dang 'og dang rang gis pa mnyam pa dang khyad par can gnyis kyi yin gyi / chung ngu'i ni ma yin no // 'di lta ste / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The equal and superior are the same and higher levels, respectively.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni lan cig kho na skye'i yang dang yang du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni lan cig kho na skye'i yang dang yang du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: For example, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises only once and not again and again.

original: de'i phyir de nyid ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIt is the cause of future states of its type.‚Äù

original: de lta yang dbang po rtul po'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni dbang po rtul po dang / rnon po'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni dbang po rnon po'i lam gyis bsdus pa kho na'i yin no ;
analyzed: de lta yang dbang po rtul po'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni dbang po rtul po dang / rnon po'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni dbang po rnon po'i lam gyis bsdus pa kho na'i yin no ;
translated: The path subsumed by dull faculty is subsumed by dull faculty alone and the path subsumed by sharp faculty is subsumed by sharp faculty alone.

original: / gang las rgyu ma tshang ba las 'bras bur mi 'gyur ba ji srid mi skye ba shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: / gang las rgyu ma tshang ba las 'bras bur mi 'gyur ba ji srid mi skye ba shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The result of the path is not incomplete due to the incompleteness of its cause, since it is not generated until the cause is complete.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i mjug thogs kyi sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i mjug thogs kyi sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is a homogeneous cause of future subsequent knowledge.

original: de la dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa rnams ni phyi ma ma yin pa dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa kho na'i 'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa rnams ni phyi ma ma yin pa dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa kho na'i 'o //
translated: That subsumed by dull faculty is subsumed by dull faculty alone, not by sharp faculty.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i ni rnam pa gnyis te dbang po rnon pos bsdus ba nyid dang mjug thogs kyi ma 'ongs pa yang dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i ni rnam pa gnyis te dbang po rnon pos bsdus ba nyid dang mjug thogs kyi ma 'ongs pa yang dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa kho na'i yin no //
translated: Future subsequent knowledge is of two types: subsumed by sharp faculty and subsumed by dull faculty.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gag ba dang lam rnams la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gag ba dang lam rnams la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams so //
translated: So too, the receptivity and knowledge of the subsequent class of the truth of suffering, and the receptivity and knowledge of the truths of origin, cessation, and path.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la yang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la yang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: The uninterrupted and liberated paths of the path of cultivation should be extensively described.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la ni zad pa shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag go //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la ni zad pa shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag go //
translated: On the path of no-more-learning, there is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: mi skye ba shes pa ni mi skye ba shes pa kho na'i @273a * //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa ni mi skye ba shes pa kho na'i @273a * //
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is only the knowledge of non-arising.

original: yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
translated: It is not of any other.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason for that is stated: because there is no other superior one.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mnyam mo //
translated: The receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering is equal to the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: dbang po 'ga' zhig las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: dbang po 'ga' zhig las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: It is superior to some faculties.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa bzhin mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa bzhin mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is like the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness, etc.

original: rgyus byas pa las byung ba'i sgo nas ni dbang po 'ga' zhig las kyang khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: rgyus byas pa las byung ba'i sgo nas ni dbang po 'ga' zhig las kyang khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: It is also distinguished from certain controlling faculties by the fact that it is produced by a cause.

original: mi skye ba shes pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa rgyus rgyas ba las byung ba'i sgo nas khyad par du 'phags pa med do //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa rgyus rgyas ba las byung ba'i sgo nas khyad par du 'phags pa med do //
translated: There is no cognition other than the cognition of non-arising which is distinguished from it by the fact that it is produced by a cause.

original: gang zhig de'i rgyu nyid yongs su mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: gang zhig de'i rgyu nyid yongs su mi rtogs she na /
translated: What is the cause of the cognition of non-arising?

original: mi skye ba shes pa las mi skye ba shes par gyur pa ni rab tu gyur ba'i phyir dang / rgyus rgyus pa las byung ba'i sgo nas dang dbang po'i sgo nas kyang khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa las mi skye ba shes par gyur pa ni rab tu gyur ba'i phyir dang / rgyus rgyus pa las byung ba'i sgo nas dang dbang po'i sgo nas kyang khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: The cognition of non-arising is distinguished from the cognition of non-arising by the fact that it is produced by a cause, by the fact that it is produced by a cause and by the fact that it is distinguished from certain controlling faculties.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma 'ongs pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa khyad par can gyi yin pa nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar gyis yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma 'ongs pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa khyad par can gyi yin pa nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar gyis yin no //
translated: In the same way, future cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness is distinguished from future cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness, etc. up to the cognition of non-arising.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness.

original: rgyu las sngar ram 'bras bu dman pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu las sngar ram 'bras bu dman pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for a cause to be prior to its effect or for a cause to be inferior to its effect.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the other paths.üîΩThe path of cultivation and the path of no-more-learning are superior to the path of insight, because the cause is more advanced.üîΩThe path of insight is the cause of the path of cultivation and the path of no-more-learning.

original: mthong ba'i lam las bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag dang / bsgom pa'i lam las kyang mi slob pa'i lam ni rgyus rgyas pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags so //üîΩmthong ba'i lam ni mnyam pa'i ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag dang / bsgom pa'i lam las kyang mi slob pa'i lam ni rgyus rgyas pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags so // mthong ba'i lam ni mnyam pa'i ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is the cause of the path of no-more-learning.üîΩThe path of no-more-learning is the cause of the path of cultivation and the path of no-more-learning.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam mo ;üîΩ/ mnyam dang khyad par can gyi rgyu ni bzhi pa rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam mo ; / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi rgyu ni bzhi pa rnams kyang ste /
translated: The path of insight is the cause of the path of cultivation and the path of no-more-learning.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis mnyam dang khyad par can gnyis nyid do //üîΩmthong ba'i lam gyis ni ma yin te dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis mnyam dang khyad par can gnyis nyid do // mthong ba'i lam gyis ni ma yin te dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of cultivation is the cause of the path of cultivation and the path of no-more-learning.üîΩThe path of no-more-learning is the cause of the path of no-more-learning.üîΩThe path of insight is not the cause of the path of insight, because it is not superior to it.üîΩThe path of cultivation is not the cause of the path of insight, because it is inferior to it.

original: mi slob pa'i lam ni mnyam pa'i phyir mi slob pa'i lam kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam ni mnyam pa'i phyir mi slob pa'i lam kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is not the cause of the path of cultivation, because it is inferior to it.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi ma yin te dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi ma yin te dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the path of insight or cultivation, because they are inferior.

original: de ltar thun mong gi dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar thun mong gi dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa bshad de /
translated: Thus, the path of insight, etc. are explained in terms of the common characteristic.

original: skad cig tha dad pas dbang po tha dad pa yan lag tu byas te /
analyzed: skad cig tha dad pas dbang po tha dad pa yan lag tu byas te /
translated: The different faculties are considered to be different moments,

original: dbang po re re ba dang rgyu'i sgo nas kyang khyad par du 'gyur pa nyid ma dpyad de //
analyzed: dbang po re re ba dang rgyu'i sgo nas kyang khyad par du 'gyur pa nyid ma dpyad de //
translated: and the differences in the path are not analyzed in terms of the individual faculties or the cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the path of the dull faculty is inferior in terms of the result.üîΩIn brief, when the path is inferior in terms of the faculty, it is also inferior in terms of the cause.

original: 'di ni mdor @273b bsdus na dbang po'i sgo nas khyad par du gyur pa na rgyus rgyas pa'am mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //üîΩdbang po'i sgo nas dman pa dang rgyus rgyas pa'i ma yin no //üîΩdbang po'i sgo nas dman pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor @273b bsdus na dbang po'i sgo nas khyad par du gyur pa na rgyus rgyas pa'am mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro // dbang po'i sgo nas dman pa dang rgyus rgyas pa'i ma yin no // dbang po'i sgo nas dman pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: When the path is superior in terms of the faculty, it is also superior in terms of the cause.üîΩThe path is not inferior in terms of the cause, but superior in terms of the faculty.üîΩThe path is not inferior in terms of the faculty, but superior in terms of the cause.

original: dbang po'i sgo nas dman pa dang khyad par can gyis yang rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas dman pa dang khyad par can gyis yang rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The path is not inferior in terms of the faculty, nor superior in terms of the cause.

original: dbang po las dman pa'i zhes sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po las dman pa'i zhes sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The faculties are inferior in the lower stages, as previously explained.

original: sa 'og ma dman pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: sa 'og ma dman pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is asked because the lower stages are inferior.

original: yang ji ltar sa gong ma pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa gong ma pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: How is the path of the higher stages?

original: de la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i sa gong ma ba'i lam ni sa 'og ma pa'i dad bas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: de la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i sa gong ma ba'i lam ni sa 'og ma pa'i dad bas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang mnyam ste /
translated: The path of the higher stages of the stage of one who follows faith is equal to the path of one who follows faith of the lower stages,

original: gnyi ga yang dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are of dull faculty.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni khyad par can ta dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni khyad par can ta dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of one who follows reality is superior, because it is of sharp faculty.

original: de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang ni //
translated: Similarly, the path of one who follows reality of the higher stages

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba sa 'og ma pa mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba sa 'og ma pa mnyam pa yin te /
translated: is equal to the path of one who follows reality of the lower stages,

original: gnyi ga yang dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are of sharp faculty.

original: de bzhin du dbang po'i sgo nas sa gong ma pa'i dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po'i sgo nas sa gong ma pa'i dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni /
translated: Similarly, the path of one who follows faith and the path of one who follows reality of the higher stages, from the standpoint of the faculties,

original: sa 'og ma pa'i dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang sbyor ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang sbyor ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The paths of seeing and meditation of the higher realms are respectively equal and superior to the paths of seeing and meditation of the lower realms.üîΩThe paths of seeing and meditation of the higher realms are respectively equal and superior to the paths of seeing and meditation of the lower realms.üîΩThe paths of seeing and meditation of the higher realms are respectively equal and superior to the paths of seeing and meditation of the lower realms.

original: de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dbang po rtul po dang rnon pos bsdus pa dag ni sa 'og ma pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i dbye bas tha dad paüîΩrnams dang dbang po'i sgo nas mnyam pa dang khyad par can yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas kyang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dbang po rtul po dang rnon pos bsdus pa dag ni sa 'og ma pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i dbye bas tha dad pa rnams dang dbang po'i sgo nas mnyam pa dang khyad par can yin pa yang brjod par bya'o // de bzhin du rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas kyang yin te /
