original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste de dag ni phyis skyes mod kyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste de dag ni phyis skyes mod kyi /
translated: For example, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the truth of suffering and so on are not the cause of all that is coemergent with them.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob babs  dman pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob babs  dman pa kho na yin no //
translated: They are later-arisen, but they are only inferior to the obtainment of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gong ma gong ma dang lhan cig skyes pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gong ma gong ma dang lhan cig skyes pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of all that is coemergent with the higher moments.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam thams cad la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam thams cad la rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for all ƒÅrya paths.

original: 'dir yang 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Here it is taught:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa rnams chos mang po yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa rnams chos mang po yin mod kyi /
translated: Those who obtain perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the truth of suffering are many dharmas.

original: skal ba mnyam pa ni rgyus rgyas pa las byung ba'i phyir rgyus ches cher rgyas pa de lta na yang dman pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa ni rgyus rgyas pa las byung ba'i phyir rgyus ches cher rgyas pa de lta na yang dman pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: But they are inferior because their homogeneity is greatly expanded by cause.

original: de lta na 'o na rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can nyid du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can nyid du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then one should not say that they are special from the perspective of being expanded by cause.

original: rgyus ches cher rgyas pa nyid ni khyad par du 'phags pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyus ches cher rgyas pa nyid ni khyad par du 'phags pa nyid de /
translated: The special cause is the cause that is superior.

original: k'a sh'a di ti /
analyzed: k'a sh'a di ti /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´ya

original: thob pa rnams ni chos kyi dbang gis bzhag ge //
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni chos kyi dbang gis bzhag ge //
translated: Obtainment is posited by the power of the dharma.

original: chos shes pa'i bzod pa yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med par skye bas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dman pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i bzod pa yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med par skye bas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dman pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Since perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering also arises without a homogeneous cause, it is not inferior to Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de'i thob pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa las dman pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i skal ba mnyam @277a * //üîΩba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i thob pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa las dman pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i skal ba mnyam @277a * // ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is not a homogeneous cause of the obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because it is inferior.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba ma 'ongs pa yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma 'ongs pa las dman ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba ma 'ongs pa yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma 'ongs pa las dman ba ma yin no //
translated: Also future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is not inferior to future Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de lta na ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho na'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de lta na ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho na'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: In that case, future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is a homogeneous cause of future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering alone.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness is not the acquiescence of the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness, nor is it the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'bras bu aan ba si ta 'byin par nus te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'bras bu aan ba si ta 'byin par nus te /
translated: This homogeneous cause is capable of producing its effect, the effect of equal outflow,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa so sor bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa so sor bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: but not like the ripening cause, which is defined as producing its effect.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'bras bu la nye bar mi sbyor ba na dgra bcom pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'bras bu la nye bar mi sbyor ba na dgra bcom pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: When the noble ones enter into nirvƒÅ·πáa without a remainder of aggregates, they do not project a homogeneous cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod pas nges par de 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod pas nges par de 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: The homogeneous cause does not necessarily produce its effect,

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig yod kyang gegs kyis dus gzhan nam 'bras bu gtan mi skye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig yod kyang gegs kyis dus gzhan nam 'bras bu gtan mi skye ba yang yod do //
translated: because even though a homogeneous cause exists, its effect is sometimes obstructed and does not arise at a different time, or it never arises.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to /
translated: The homogeneous cause has been explained.

original: // / mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: The concomitant cause is the mind and mental factors.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚Äúthe concomitant cause is only mind and mental factors‚Äù is for the sake of exclusion.

original: rnam pa gzhan du nges par gzung ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa bkag ba mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du nges par gzung ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa bkag ba mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not for the word ‚Äúonly,‚Äù it would follow that the concomitant cause would not be asserted to be the coemergent cause and so on of mind and mental factors.

original: de lta na ni dus dang rgyu tha dad pa las skyes ba rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩ'o na ni dmigs pa gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na ni dus dang rgyu tha dad pa las skyes ba rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // 'o na ni dmigs pa gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that case, it would follow that those generated from different times and different causes would be concomitant causes.

original: de lta na dus dang rgyud tha dad pa la skyes ba rnams rnam pa tha dad pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na dus dang rgyud tha dad pa la skyes ba rnams rnam pa tha dad pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yin no //
translated: In that case, those generated from different times and different continua would be concomitant causes because they would have different aspects and different focal objects.

original: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang dus tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang sngar smras pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang dus tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang sngar smras pa'o //
translated: This is what was said earlier.

original: 'di ltar dus dang rgyu tha dad pa las skyes ba ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa tha dad pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar dus dang rgyu tha dad pa las skyes ba ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa tha dad pa dag go //
translated: Thus, those that arise from a cause and time that are different are those that have the same aspect and object, and those that have different aspects and objects.

original: de la rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag ces bya ba smos pas ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa bkag go //
analyzed: de la rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag ces bya ba smos pas ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa bkag go //
translated: By saying ‚Äúthose that have the same aspect and object,‚Äù he refutes those that have different aspects and objects.

original: cig shos ni ma bkag pas thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma bkag pas thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the other is not refuted, that consequence is unacceptable.

original: @277b 'o na ni dus gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @277b 'o na ni dus gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: But they are simultaneous.

original: de lta na yang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes shing dus tha mi dad pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes shing dus tha mi dad pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it would follow that those that arise from different continua and are not different in time would also be the same.

original: mang po rnams zla ba tshes ba la sogs ba la lta ba dag gi lta bu rgyud tha dad ba las skyes pa /
analyzed: mang po rnams zla ba tshes ba la sogs ba la lta ba dag gi lta bu rgyud tha dad ba las skyes pa /
translated: For example, many people who have different continua see the moon and so on.

original: dus gcig cing rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig cing rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would follow that those that are simultaneous, of the same aspect, and of the same object would also be homogeneous.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par de dag gis ni gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba de lta bas na rten mtshungs can rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par de dag gis ni gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba de lta bas na rten mtshungs can rnams so //
translated: Since these distinctions would lead to undesirable consequences, they are homogeneous only in the sense of having the same basis.

original: rgyud tha dad pa rnams kyang rigs kyi sgo nas rten mig la sogs pa mtshungs pa can yin pas de las khyad du bya ba'i phyir mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa rnams kyang rigs kyi sgo nas rten mig la sogs pa mtshungs pa can yin pas de las khyad du bya ba'i phyir mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since even those of different continua are homogeneous in the sense of having the same type of basis, such as the eye, he says, ‚Äúhomogeneous‚Äù means ‚Äúnondifferent.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni skad cig ma'i dbang du byas nas mtshungs pa nyid du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni skad cig ma'i dbang du byas nas mtshungs pa nyid du 'dod kyi /
translated: This shows that they are homogeneous in terms of momentariness.

original: rigs kyi dbang du byas nas ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang du byas nas ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: They are not homogeneous in terms of type.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: That is why he says, ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: rten mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la 'di skad cig gcig gis rten mtshungs pa dang / yang rnam pa gcig gis rten mtshungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar shes bar bya /
analyzed: rten mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la 'di skad cig gcig gis rten mtshungs pa dang / yang rnam pa gcig gis rten mtshungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar shes bar bya /
translated: then why does the s≈´tra itself not explain it?üîΩIf you say that it is explained in the Abhidharma,üîΩthen why does the Abhidharma itself not explain it?

original: gal te de rnams rnam par bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rnams rnam par bshad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is explained in the commentary,üîΩthen why does the commentary itself not explain it?

original: sngar mdo nyid du /üîΩmtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang / sems byung zhes mtshungs ldan gsungs pa'i phyir 'di nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sngar mdo nyid du / mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang / sems byung zhes mtshungs ldan gsungs pa'i phyir 'di nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: If you say that it is explained in the subcommentary,

original: dus dang rgyud tha dad du skyes pa rnams la mtshungs par ldan pa yod ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dus dang rgyud tha dad du skyes pa rnams la mtshungs par ldan pa yod ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then why does the subcommentary itself not explain it?üîΩIf you say that it is explained in the commentary on the subcommentary,üîΩthen why does the commentary on the subcommentary itself not explain it?

original: rten mtshungs pa zhes bya ba gang dag gi rten kho na mtshungs shing tha dad pa yang ma yin pa de dag rten mtshungs rnams so //
analyzed: rten mtshungs pa zhes bya ba gang dag gi rten kho na mtshungs shing tha dad pa yang ma yin pa de dag rten mtshungs rnams so //
translated: If you say that it is explained in the commentary on the commentary,üîΩthen why does the commentary on the commentary itself not explain it?

original: rnam pa smos ni rdzas kyi sgo nas tha dad pa yang ste /
analyzed: rnam pa smos ni rdzas kyi sgo nas tha dad pa yang ste /
translated: If you say that it is explained in the commentary on the commentary on the commentary,üîΩthen why does the commentary on the commentary on the commentary itself not explain it?üîΩIf you say that it is explained in the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary,üîΩthen why does the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary itself not explain it?üîΩIf you say that it is explained in the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary,üîΩthen why does the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary itself not explain it?üîΩIf you say that it is explained in the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary,

original: 'di rnams kyi rten yin pas rnam pa yongs su mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rten yin pas rnam pa yongs su mi gzung ngo //
translated: then why does the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary on the commentary itself not explain it?

original: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dge dang // sems byung zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid de yang khyad par can med bar khyad par bzhag par mi nus pas rten mtshungs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dge dang // sems byung zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid de yang khyad par can med bar khyad par bzhag par mi nus pas rten mtshungs zhes brjod do //
translated: Since it is not possible to posit a distinction without a distinction, it is called the same support.

original: rigs mtshungs pa ni rdzas mnyam par 'dzin pa so sor 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mtshungs pa ni rdzas mnyam par 'dzin pa so sor 'jog pa ste /
translated: The same type is posited as the homogeneous cause.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The concomitant cause is mind and mental factors.

original: 'dir yang khyad par ni rten mtshungs pa nyid kyis rtogs bar bya'i rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang khyad par ni rten mtshungs pa nyid kyis rtogs bar bya'i rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, the distinction is understood by the same support, not by other aspects.

original: yang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces khong na yod pa'i dri ba gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩmtshungs par ldan @278a * //
analyzed: yang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces khong na yod pa'i dri ba gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir / mtshungs par ldan @278a * //
translated: Again, in order to determine the question that is implied, what is the difference between the concomitant cause and the co-originated cause?

original: pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The concomitant cause is also the co-originated cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni /
translated: The co-originated cause is

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod de /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod de /
translated: There is form that is not a concomitant cause.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs dang / skye ba la sogs pa dag dang 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs dang / skye ba la sogs pa dag dang 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
translated: This refers to form that is derived from the elements and is concomitant with mind, as well as to birth, etc., and the great elements.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa kho na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa kho na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Whatever is a concomitant cause is also a co-existent cause.

original: de la rdzas khyad par med pas 'dri ba ni yang don gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdzas khyad par med pas 'dri ba ni yang don gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since there is no distinction in substance, the question is asked, ‚ÄúBy what meaning is it called co-existent cause?‚Äù

original: phan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúBy the meaning of mutual result.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'gron po rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba de bzhin du ;üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gron po rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba de bzhin du ; sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'dod la /
translated: Just as travelers proceed on the road by the power of each other,üîΩso too, mind and mental factors arise by the power of each other, and therefore they are asserted to be mutual results.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid kyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid kyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'dod do //
translated: And by being mutual results, they are asserted to be co-existent causes.

original: mtshungs pa lngas zhes bya ba ni rten dang / dmigs dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa lngas zhes bya ba ni rten dang / dmigs dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
translated: The five ways in which they are similar are in terms of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par 'jug pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par 'jug pa'i don gyis te /
translated: The meaning of association is the meaning of similar occurrence.

original: ji ltar 'gron po phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba de dag zas dang / btung ba dang / khrus dang / mal dang / stan la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar spyod pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da lta ba'i dus su 'ong ba gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par mi ldan pas 'di
analyzed: ji ltar 'gron po phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba de dag zas dang / btung ba dang / khrus dang / mal dang / stan la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar spyod pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da lta ba'i dus su 'ong ba gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par mi ldan pas 'di
translated: Just as travelers on a road go by the power of each other, and they are similar in their use of food, drink, bathing, beds, seats, and so on, so too mind and mental factors, even though there is no single entity that comes from the future to the present, all are associated because if one is not present, all are not present.

original: ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin te de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin te de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is their causal nature because they exist when that exists.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: dngos bo mi ldan pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa'i don gyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang phan tshun 'bras bu bskyed pas rab tu phye ba'am /
analyzed: dngos bo mi ldan pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa'i don gyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang phan tshun 'bras bu bskyed pas rab tu phye ba'am /
translated: Because there is no non-possession of a thing, co-existent cause is distinguished by the meaning of the effect of the same outcome, or by the generation of mutual effects.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang dmigs pa gcig par sbyor bas rab tu phye ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang dmigs pa gcig par sbyor bas rab tu phye ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Or, co-existent cause is distinguished by the application of the same object.

original: mtshungs par ldan ba'i rgyu bshad zin to /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan ba'i rgyu bshad zin to /
translated: The co-existent cause has been explained.

original: // / kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //üîΩrnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can // rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The pervasive is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa smos pa ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa smos pa ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù is mentioned in order to distinguish it from the homogeneous cause.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi yin gyi 'di ni nyon mongs @278b pa can kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi yin gyi 'di ni nyon mongs @278b pa can kho na'i yin no //
translated: That is, the pervasive cause is of afflicted and unafflicted states, but this is only of afflicted states.

original: de lta yin na gzhan gyi sa pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / phyis skyes pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa yang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan gyi sa pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / phyis skyes pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa yang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the cause of universal occurrence would be the past and future, and that which arises later and that which arises simultaneously.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi zhes khyad par gyi tshig med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi zhes khyad par gyi tshig med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the word ‚Äúdefiled‚Äù is not a qualifying word,

original: rang sa kun 'gro snga zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩ'di skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rang gi ris smos pa ni ma byas te /
analyzed: rang sa kun 'gro snga zhes bya ba smos so // 'di skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rang gi ris smos pa ni ma byas te /
translated: the root text states, ‚Äúthe universal cause of its level is prior.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúits level‚Äù is not stated in the same way as the homogeneous cause because the universal cause is distinguished from the homogeneous cause by the fact that it is the common cause of afflicted entities.üîΩThose are also called ‚Äúpervasive‚Äù because they are the cause of the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi thun mong pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag kyang 'og nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi thun mong pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro // de dag kyang 'og nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Those are also called ‚Äúpervasive‚Äù because they are the cause of the afflicted view of the self and so on.üîΩThe root text states,

original: de dag kyang /üîΩsdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba /
analyzed: de dag kyang / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba /
translated: Those are also called ‚Äúpervasive‚ÄùüîΩBecause they are objects to be abandoned by seeingüîΩThe truths of suffering and origin.

original: lta dang de bzhin the tshom med //üîΩgang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
analyzed: lta dang de bzhin the tshom med // gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
translated: They are the afflicted view of the self,üîΩand likewise doubt,

original: ma rig gang yin kun tu 'gro //
analyzed: ma rig gang yin kun tu 'gro //
translated: and whatever ignorance is not mixed with them.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The root text states,

original: dngos po ris lnga po thams cad kyang dmigs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po ris lnga po thams cad kyang dmigs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: All five types of objects are its object field.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas na kun tu 'gro ba rnams so ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas na kun tu 'gro ba rnams so ;
translated: It is a universal cause because it is the cause of all the other afflicted entities.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is established as a homogeneous cause separately from a universal cause because it is the common cause of afflicted entities.

original: ris gzhan dag gi yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: ris gzhan dag gi yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid du rtogs par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand also of other types‚Äù indicates that it is the common cause of afflicted entities.

original: de la kun 'byung dang ; 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ris mthun gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de la kun 'byung dang ; 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ris mthun gzhan yin la /
translated: The entities abandoned by seeing the truths of origin, cessation, and path, and those abandoned by the path of cultivation, are the homogeneous cause of the afflicted entities of the same type that are abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du gang dag kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba las gzhan pa de dag kyang ris gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba las gzhan pa de dag kyang ris gzhan yin no //
translated: So too, those other than those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are different types.

original: de'i phyir ris gzhan pa de dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ris gzhan pa de dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the cause of those other types.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gi ris pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gi ris pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they are also the cause of those of its own type.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu sngar skyes pa ni ris lnga char gyi nyon mongs pa can ma skyes pa yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu sngar skyes pa ni ris lnga char gyi nyon mongs pa can ma skyes pa yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: The pervasive cause that arose previously holds the unarisen afflicted states of the five types as its homogeneous and dominant results.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi mthun ni zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi mthun ni zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe homogeneous cause is the pervasive cause.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no //
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúAll afflicted states have the view of the transitory collection as their root.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: They arise from the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun 'byung ba can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun 'byung ba can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are generated by the view of the transitory collection.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: lhan cig 'byung @279a * //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung @279a * //
translated: CoemergentüîΩ

original: ba'i rgyu'i phyogs gcig dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu'i phyogs gcig ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba'i rgyu'i phyogs gcig dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu'i phyogs gcig ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause are, respectively, the one part of the co-existent cause and the one part of the associated cause and the one part of the homogeneous cause and the one part of the pervasive cause.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: They explain this as follows:

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is a pervasive cause is also a homogeneous cause.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: he tu sam bhe da pra sam g'a d'a sam bhinna pra k'a r'a shtsa he ta ba:/
analyzed: he tu sam bhe da pra sam g'a d'a sam bhinna pra k'a r'a shtsa he ta ba:/
translated: Hetu-sambheda-prakara·πáa-ƒÅdƒÅsa-sambhinna-prakƒÅra≈õca hetubhi·∏•.

original: sa tya pi dra bya sam bhe de /
analyzed: sa tya pi dra bya sam bhe de /
translated: Satya-pi dravya-sambhede

original: 'di ltar rang gi rigs kyi sred pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dag phan tshun rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid yin kyang skal pa mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag la bye brag yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rigs kyi sred pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dag phan tshun rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid yin kyang skal pa mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag la bye brag yod do //
translated: Thus, craving and the afflicted view of self of the same class are mutually co-existent causes, but there is a difference between them as homogeneous causes and pervasive causes.

original: sred pa mtha' dag migs ba'i yul yin pa'i (rgyu 'chol ba thal ba'i phyir ma 'dres rnam pa rnams kyang rgyu rnams yod kyang rdzas 'chol pa la/) phyir a'atm'a bhi ni be sha: sred pa rab tu 'jig cing the tshom du byed cing srid pa nyid 'jig tshogs
analyzed: sred pa mtha' dag migs ba'i yul yin pa'i (rgyu 'chol ba thal ba'i phyir ma 'dres rnam pa rnams kyang rgyu rnams yod kyang rdzas 'chol pa la/) phyir a'atm'a bhi ni be sha: sred pa rab tu 'jig cing the tshom du byed cing srid pa nyid 'jig tshogs
translated: because craving is the object of the view of the transitory collection, and because the causes of the various aspects would be mixed up if the causes were to exist.

original: la lta ba mtha' dag gi dmigs pa'i yul yin pas brtan por byed pa la bdag tu lta ba dang the tshom du byed do //
analyzed: la lta ba mtha' dag gi dmigs pa'i yul yin pas brtan por byed pa la bdag tu lta ba dang the tshom du byed do //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the object of all craving, doubt, and the view of the transitory collection.

original: des na kun tu 'gro ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / (bdag mngon par zhugs) nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba shin tu spangs par gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na kun tu 'gro ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / (bdag mngon par zhugs) nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba shin tu spangs par gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the pervasive negative tendencies are the objects of all the afflictions, and they are the cause of the increase of the afflictions.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu spang ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu spang ba'i phyir la /
translated: The noble ones abandon the pervasive negative tendencies as the cause.

original: spang ba yang rgyu'i dngos por mi srid do snyam du 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: spang ba yang rgyu'i dngos por mi srid do snyam du 'dri ba ni /
translated: But it is not possible for the abandonment to be the cause.

original: ci 'phags pa'i gang zag gi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: ci 'phags pa'i gang zag gi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni rgyun tu zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni rgyun tu zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: The term ‚Äúperson‚Äù refers to the noble ones, such as stream enterers, once returners, and nonreturners.

original: de dag la nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that they engage in afflicted states.

original: kha che ba rnams na re /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re /
translated: The Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: All afflicted states are the cause of afflicted states.

original: de dag ni spangs zin pa'i 'phags pa'i gnas skabs ni rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni spangs zin pa'i 'phags pa'i gnas skabs ni rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that those that have already been abandoned in the state of an ƒÅrya become the cause of afflicted states.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de dag ni so so skye bo'i gnas skabs kho nar rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni so so skye bo'i gnas skabs kho nar rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: They are established as the cause of afflicted states only in the state of an ordinary being.

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni nam yang de'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bas de dag ni spangs kyang /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni nam yang de'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bas de dag ni spangs kyang /
translated: That which is the cause of something is never not the cause of that.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid du bsnyad do //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid du bsnyad do //
translated: They are called the cause of afflicted phenomena.

original: 'dir kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i khungs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i khungs ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the source for the assertion that the cause of universal occurrence is the common cause of afflicted phenomena.

original: 'dir 'phags pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa'am /
translated: Here, the term afflicted phenomena is not qualified as either the phenomena of noble beings or the phenomena of ordinary beings.

original: so so skye bo'i nyon mongs @279b pa can zhes bya bar khyad par du ma byas ba de'i phyir na 'phags pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: so so skye bo'i nyon mongs @279b pa can zhes bya bar khyad par du ma byas ba de'i phyir na 'phags pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the cause of universal occurrence is the common cause of afflicted phenomena of both noble beings and ordinary beings.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes khyad par med pa yin yang kun tu 'gro ba rnams kho na gzung ngo //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes khyad par med pa yin yang kun tu 'gro ba rnams kho na gzung ngo //
translated: Although the cause of elimination by the path of seeing is not specified, only the causes of universal occurrence are included.üîΩSimilarly, although the cause of karmic maturation is not specified, it is the cause of nonvirtuous phenomena, not the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.

original: de bzhin du rnam par smin pas khyad par med par brjod du zin kyang mi dge pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par smin pas khyad par med par brjod du zin kyang mi dge pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.üîΩThe cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral phenomena.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The cause of neutral phenomena is the cause of neutral

original: 'dir yang mi dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba 'di khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mi dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba 'di khungs yin no //
translated: Here too, the source is ‚Äúnonvirtuous phenomena.‚Äù

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis te ;
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis te ;
translated: Neutral phenomena are the two views of the perishable composite and extreme views.

original: de dag kyang khyad par med par mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan pas 'phags pa'i mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang khyad par med par mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan pas 'phags pa'i mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: Since they are taught to be the cause of nonvirtuous phenomena without distinction, it is certain that nonvirtuous phenomena of ƒÅryas arise from the cause of the view of the perishable composite and extreme view.üîΩOther neutral phenomena, excluding active cause, act as causes of virtuous phenomena through other causes.

original: gzhan lung ma bstan ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni byed rgyu ma gtogs par rgyu gzhan gyis dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid byed de byed rgyu nyid kyang lung ma bstan gyi chos rnams n'a ne bhyo b'a nyi sha ya:lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas
analyzed: gzhan lung ma bstan ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni byed rgyu ma gtogs par rgyu gzhan gyis dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid byed de byed rgyu nyid kyang lung ma bstan gyi chos rnams n'a ne bhyo b'a nyi sha ya:lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas
translated: Active cause is a cause of neutral phenomena alone.

original: rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term other neutral phenomena refers toüîΩcompounded neutral phenomena.

original: 'dus byas smos pa ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas smos pa ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term conditioned refers to space and nonanalytical cessation.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams kyi ji ltar srid pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams kyi ji ltar srid pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Undeclared states and the states that are undeclared are the homogeneous cause, the concomitant cause, the pervasive cause, and the cause of karmic maturation of the states that are undeclared.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no /üîΩsdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba la /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba la /
translated: They are not the pervasive cause.üîΩThere is the truth of suffering that is caused by the afflicted view of the self.üîΩThere is the truth of suffering that is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'dir rgyas par zhes bya ba smos pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rgyas par zhes bya ba smos pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: The term and so on refers to the afflicted view of the self and so on.üîΩThe term and so on refers to the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyus yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyus yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a cause of the afflicted view of the self that is not the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: There is a cause of the afflicted view of the self that is the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin la /
translated: There is a cause of the afflicted view of the self that is not the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa yod do //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin @280a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa yod do // 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin @280a * //
translated: There is a cause of the afflicted view of the self that is the afflicted view of the self.

original: la ; 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: la ; 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a cause of the afflicted view of the self that is not the afflicted view of the self?üîΩThe first possibility is past and present negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and the truth of suffering that is concomitant with them,

original: de la mu dang po ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das ba dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun tu 'gro ba 'das pa dang /
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das ba dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun tu 'gro ba 'das pa dang /
translated: except for the omnipresent negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that are past and present.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang /
translated: and future afflicted view of the self and the truth of suffering that is concomitant with it,üîΩand the phenomena of birth, aging, enduring and impermanence that are concomitant with that afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dang zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dang zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di 'phen pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: ma gtogs pa dag las gzhan pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa dag las gzhan pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those other than those that are excluded?

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang /
translated: Those that are future and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, those that are future and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and those that are future and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that are pervasive.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad kho na ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad kho na ste /
translated: All objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path and by the path of meditation are objects abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: They are results of the truth of suffering that are caused by the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin na'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin na'o //
translated: But they are not causes of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩHere, the source for the third possibility is the Abhidharmapitaka, which states:üîΩAll afflicted phenomena of ƒÅryas are caused by the pervasive states.

original: de la 'dir gsum pa'i khungs 'phags pa'i gang zag gi yang nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu can no zhes bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams khyad par du ma byas te /
analyzed: de la 'dir gsum pa'i khungs 'phags pa'i gang zag gi yang nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu can no zhes bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams khyad par du ma byas te /
translated: This does not distinguish objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It teaches that they are caused by the afflicted view of the self.

original: / gal te 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu can yin na /
analyzed: / gal te 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu can yin na /
translated: If afflicted phenomena of ƒÅryas are caused by the pervasive states,üîΩthen how should the explanation of the Sa·πÖghabhadra be interpreted?

original: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa 'di ji ltar drang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar ston to //
analyzed: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa 'di ji ltar drang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar ston to //
translated: This shows that it contradicts the treatise.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na'o //
translated: If even the afflicted phenomena of ƒÅryas arise from the omnipresent cause,üîΩthen why does the s≈´tra not say, ‚ÄúThe afflicted view of the self and so on arise from the omnipresent cause and also from the cause of karmic maturation‚Äù?

original: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir na /
translated: The intention of the questioner is that since the s≈´tra ascertains that ‚Äúnonvirtue arises from nonvirtue,‚Äù

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no snyam ba'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no snyam ba'o //
translated: it does not arise from a neutral cause.

original: yod de 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems pa @280b de'i rgyu ni mi dge ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yod de 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems pa @280b de'i rgyu ni mi dge ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: There is, because the mind of an ƒÅrya person free from attachment to the desire realm and so on is not only the cause of nonvirtue.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i bdag nyid can lung du ma bstan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i bdag nyid can lung du ma bstan pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also neutral, which is to say it is the self view and extreme view.

original: de ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can nyid kyang yin mod kyang /
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can nyid kyang yin mod kyang /
translated: That is the cause of nonvirtue and neutral states.

original: de ni rgyu ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But that is stated from the perspective of not abandoning its cause.

original: de'i rgyu lung du ma bstan pa yang spang ba yin no //üîΩmthong bas spang bar bya ba yongs su gtugs te spang ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu lung du ma bstan pa yang spang ba yin no // mthong bas spang bar bya ba yongs su gtugs te spang ba'i phyir la /
translated: and also the neutral cause of that is abandoned.üîΩBecause the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are completely abandoned,

original: mthong ba'i lam las yongs su nyams pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las yongs su nyams pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because there is no regression from the path of seeing.

original: de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skye ba yin te /
translated: It arises from improper mental attention.

original: de'i phyir mi dge ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dge ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said with the intention that nonvirtuous states such as attachment that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation have not been abandoned.

original: de ji ltar ma spangs she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma spangs she na /
translated: How have they not been abandoned?

original: de spangs pa las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de spangs pa las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one can regress from their abandonment.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs bar ldan pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i rgyu mi dge ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs bas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs bar ldan pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i rgyu mi dge ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs bas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since this is said with the intention that nonvirtuous states subsumed by the coemergent cause and the concomitant cause are the cause, there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu bshad zin to /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu bshad zin to /
translated: The universal cause has been explained.

original: // / rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: // / rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is nonvirtue, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges bar gzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges bar gzung ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is only those, i.e., the three times.

original: de dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that they are only the cause of karmic maturation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith outflows‚Äù is stated to exclude those without outflows.

original: mi dge ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas de las khyad par du ma byas so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas de las khyad par du ma byas so //
translated: Since nonvirtue is only with outflows, it is not distinguished.

original: yang 'dir rgyu'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'dir rgyu'i don ci zhe na /

original: ji ltar las nye bar son pas sems can rnams las kyi rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar las nye bar son pas sems can rnams las kyi rnam par 'byed de /
translated: Just as it is said that ‚Äúsentient beings are distinguished by karma, since karma is present,‚Äù

original: sems can dman pa rnams la dman pa dang bzang po rnams la gya nom pa'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can dman pa rnams la dman pa dang bzang po rnams la gya nom pa'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: inferior sentient beings have inferior karma, and excellent sentient beings have excellent karma.

original: dang gi sgra ni rgyu tha dad kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad par shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni rgyu tha dad kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad par shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates that the cause is distinguished, but the effect is not distinguished.

original: nges par gzung ba ni thal bar gyur pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩkha cig ni thams cad rnam par smin pa zhes sems te /üîΩsnang ba rgya chen po can rnam par smin pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba ni thal bar gyur pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro // kha cig ni thams cad rnam par smin pa zhes sems te / snang ba rgya chen po can rnam par smin pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin a certain sense‚Äù is stated to refute the cause of karmic maturation that is a logical possibility.

original: sred pa'i rnam par smin pa tshor ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa'i rnam par smin pa tshor ba'o zhe na /
translated: Some think that everything is a karmic maturation because the s≈´tras state that ‚Äúthe karmic maturation of craving is feeling.‚Äù

original: tshig de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ma yin te /
translated: That statement is not a statement of the TathƒÅgata.

original: gang rnam par smin par 'gyur ba de thams cad kyi rgyu rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rnam par smin par 'gyur ba de thams cad kyi rgyu rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then the cause of everything that is a karmic maturation would be the cause of karmic maturation.

original: s'a m'a sta dya te ae te /
analyzed: s'a m'a sta dya te ae te /
translated: The Sanskrit sƒÅmastya means ‚Äútogether.‚Äù

original: @281a * // aoo ba mya t'a min no //
analyzed: @281a * // aoo ba mya t'a min no //
translated: The Sanskrit o·πÉ ƒÅ·∏• means ‚Äúnot so.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgra zhes bya ba gang las kyang 'di nyid rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gzhan ma yin zhes bya /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgra zhes bya ba gang las kyang 'di nyid rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gzhan ma yin zhes bya /
translated: The term ‚Äúkarmic maturation‚Äù is not used for anything other than this.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes te /
translated: Therefore the root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is a phenomenon that is a karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because this is the section on karmic maturation.

original: gzhan dag rnam par smin pa'i chos can 'di ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dri ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam par smin pa'i chos can 'di ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dri ba ni /
translated: In order to show that this is not the case, he asks:

original: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //üîΩji ltar sa bon rul ba dag ni mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir myu gu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /üîΩsred pas mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o // ji ltar sa bon rul ba dag ni mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir myu gu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir / sred pas mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Why is it said that neutral states are not karmic maturation?üîΩJust as rotten seeds, even though moistened, are not causes of sprouts because they are weak, so too neutral states, even though moistened by craving because they are weak, are not causes of karmic maturation.

original: yang ji ltar sa bon grung po chu dag gis mngon par ma brlan pa myu gu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa bon grung po chu dag gis mngon par ma brlan pa myu gu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as fresh seeds that are not moistened by water are not causes of sprouts, so too uncontaminated states, because they are virtuous, are not causes of karmic maturation.

original: grung yang sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: grung yang sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: and even though they are mature, they are not causes of karmic maturation because they are not moistened by craving.

original: gcig ni rang gi nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni rang gi nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: One is not a cause of karmic maturation because it is devoid of its own potency.

original: cig shos ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The other is not a cause of karmic maturation because the conditions that give rise to it are incomplete.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Non-associated formative factorsüîΩare not causes of karmic maturation because they are not concomitant.

original: rnam par smin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since karmic maturation is a phenomenon of the desire realm and so on,

original: gdon mi za bar 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: it must be concomitant with the desire realm and so on.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur mi rung ste /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur mi rung ste /
translated: But nonconcomitant states are not suitable as causes of karmic maturation

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no definite cause.

original: lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The remaining

original: rnam pa gnyis ka yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: are both.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyis grung po yin pa'i phyir /üîΩrang gi nus pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyis grung po yin pa'i phyir / rang gi nus pa dang ldan la /
translated: Because they are potent due to being virtuous or nonvirtuous,üîΩthey possess their own power.üîΩ

original: sred pas mngon par brlan pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pas mngon par brlan pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is moistened by craving, it possesses the condition of the dominant condition.üîΩIt is said that it is suitable for both,

original: gnyis ka ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: and this has already been explained.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes tshig bsdu na ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes tshig bsdu na ni /
translated: If the statement ‚ÄúThe cause of karmic maturation is karmic maturation‚Äù is a summary statement,

original: rgyu'i sgra mi mngon par byas pas mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //üîΩyang na rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no zhes tshig bsdu na yang 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las la rnam par smin @281b par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra mi mngon par byas pas mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo // yang na rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no zhes tshig bsdu na yang 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las la rnam par smin @281b par 'gyur bas na /
translated: then the term ‚Äúcause‚Äù is elided, and it is not contradictory to say that the eye is derived from karmic maturation.üîΩOr if the statement ‚ÄúThe cause of karmic maturation is karmic maturation‚Äù is a summary statement,

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: then karma that has reached the time of its result is called karmic maturation because it matures.

original: de lta na las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta na las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus it is not contradictory to say that it is the karmic maturation of karma.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa yin pas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa yin pas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'i /
translated: The result is the karmic maturation, therefore it is called the karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur bas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the karmic maturation itself.

original: mi 'dra bar smin ba ni zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'dra bar smin ba ni zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The result of karmic maturation is dissimilar to its cause.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ni mi dge ba dang dge ba thag pa dang bcas pa dag yin la 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ni mi dge ba dang dge ba thag pa dang bcas pa dag yin la 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The cause is nonvirtue and virtue that is contaminated, but the result is neutral, since it is dissimilar to its cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams la mi 'dra bar rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams la mi 'dra bar rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: The result of karmic maturation does not exist for coemergent, concomitant, homogeneous, and omnipresent causes.

original: byed pa'i rgyu la ni 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba gnyi ga ci rigs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu la ni 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba gnyi ga ci rigs pa'o //
translated: The result of karmic maturation exists for the active cause, but it is either similar or dissimilar to its cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bshad pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bshad pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation should be explained in the desire realm as one aggregate, etc.

original: thob pa rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir na phung po gcig go //
analyzed: thob pa rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir na phung po gcig go //
translated: Obtainment and the arising, etc. of those are subsumed by the aggregate of formation, therefore they are one aggregate.

analyzed: thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pas 'bras bu gcig go //
translated: The result of obtainment is also the result of the arising, etc. of those, therefore they are one result.

analyzed: thob pa rnams ni thob ba dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu tha dad kyi /

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni ma yin te /

analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang / gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: phung po gnyis la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po gnyis la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two aggregates are the cause of karmic maturation,

original: lus dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no //

translated: Their birth, etc., are the formations aggregate.üîΩThe single homogeneous cause is the single cause that is the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe single cause that is the homogeneous cause is the single cause that is the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe single cause that is the homogeneous cause is the single cause that is the homogeneous cause.

analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro // phung po gsum pa ni khams gsum ka na yang med de /

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus @282a * //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus @282a * //
translated: The single cause that is the homogeneous cause is the single cause that is the homogeneous cause.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: The single cause that is the homogeneous cause is the single

original: 'dod pa'i khams na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems med pas rjes su 'jug pa'i sems gzugs mi srid pa'i phyir phung po lnga po ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems med pas rjes su 'jug pa'i sems gzugs mi srid pa'i phyir phung po lnga po ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no thought in equipoise in the realm of desire, a subsequent thought of the form realm is impossible. Therefore, the five aggregates do not exist there.

original: phung po bzhi po bzhi char gyi yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig kho na'i yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: phung po bzhi po bzhi char gyi yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig kho na'i yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: The ripened effect of the four aggregates is the same for all four, but not for the others.

original: / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not co-existent causes.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag gi de'i skad cig dang de'i kun slong gi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'bras bu gcig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag gi de'i skad cig dang de'i kun slong gi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'bras bu gcig go zhes zer ro //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na phung po lnga yang yod pa de'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa med pa'i phyir gzhan nyid do //
translated: In the desire realm, the five aggregates are not co-existent causes of each other, because they are different.

original: gang gi phyir lus dang ngag gi las rnam par smin pa las gzhan pa dang / de'i kun nas slong ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma re re ba dag kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus dang ngag gi las rnam par smin pa las gzhan pa dang / de'i kun nas slong ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma re re ba dag kho na'o //
translated: because bodily and vocal actions are other than their ripened effect, and the mind and mental factors that instigate them are momentary.

original: re zhig rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag 'bras bu tha dad de /
analyzed: re zhig rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag 'bras bu tha dad de /
translated: First, the informative and noninformative actions are different effects.

original: rnam par rig byed kyi ni rdul phra rab rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi ni rdul phra rab rnams so //
translated: The effect of the informative action is the atoms.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i srog chags gsod pa la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i srog chags gsod pa la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams so //
translated: The effect of the noninformative action is the substance of killing and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The effect of the mind and mental factors has already been explained.

original: 'dod pa'i khams rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po lnga pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po lnga pa med do //
translated: There is no five-aggregate ripened effect in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In the form realm, the five aggregates are the ripened effect of the five aggregates.

original: thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Obtaining, along with birth and so on, and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, along with birth and so on, are the ripened effects of the five aggregates.

original: thob pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gcig yin la /
analyzed: thob pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gcig yin la /
translated: The two meditative attainments of obtainment and nonperception, and their birth and so on are subsumed by the formation aggregate, so they are one aggregate.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi gnyis 'bras bu tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi gnyis 'bras bu tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa yin no //
translated: Since the characteristics and the basis of those characteristics are not different results, they are one result.

original: phung po gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second aggregate is

original: bsam gtan dang po kho na'i rnam par rig byed dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po kho na'i rnam par rig byed dge ba yin gyi /
translated: virtuous indicative form of the first absorption alone.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag gi ni ma yin te /üîΩde'i sa pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag gi ni ma yin te / de'i sa pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: It is not of the second absorption and so on,

original: sa 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kho na der mngon du byed pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kho na der mngon du byed pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: because it is not associated with investigation and analysis of its level and because it is not karmic maturation since it manifests only the unobscured neutral states of lower levels.

original: rnam par rig byed ni @282b gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni @282b gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: Indicative form is the form aggregate.

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa dag ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
