analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa dag ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: Therefore birth and so on are the formation aggregate.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúnot in meditative equipoise,‚ÄùüîΩ

original: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i phung po bzhi pa'o //üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i phung po bzhi pa'o // mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four aggregates are called not in meditative equipoise.

original: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga pa'o //üîΩgzugs med pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga pa'o // gzugs med pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The five aggregates are called in meditative equipoise.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is only one or four aggregates.

original: de na gzugs thams cad med pas phung po gcig pa 'am bzhi pa yin gyi phung po gnyis pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de na gzugs thams cad med pas phung po gcig pa 'am bzhi pa yin gyi phung po gnyis pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the formless realm, there is only one aggregate or four aggregates, because all form is absent there.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu de ni rnam pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu de ni rnam pa dgu yin te /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is ninefold.

original: khams gsum na rim bzhin du rnam par gsum dang / bzhi dang / gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi rnam par smin pa'i chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: khams gsum na rim bzhin du rnam par gsum dang / bzhi dang / gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi rnam par smin pa'i chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It is threefold in the desire realm, fourfold in the form realm and twofold in the formless realm.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is ninefold because it is threefold in the desire realm, fourfold in the form realm and twofold in the formless realm.

original: kha cig na re ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu kho na yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu kho na yin la /
translated: Some say: The single base of phenomena that is the result of karmic maturation is the homogeneous collection of beings and the faculty of life force, because they are the result of karma alone.

original: gzhan dag na re gdon mi za bar 'phen par byed pa'i yin pa kho nar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gdon mi za bar 'phen par byed pa'i yin pa kho nar ma zad kyi /
translated: Others say: It is not only the projecting cause,

original: rdzogs par byed pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs par byed pa'i yang yin te /
translated: but also the completing cause.

original: de bas na srog gi dbang po gang gi rnam par smin pa yin pa de'i ni ris mthun pa dang / de'i skye bal sogs pa yang yin pas de'i rnam par smin pa ni chos kyi skye mched kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na srog gi dbang po gang gi rnam par smin pa yin pa de'i ni ris mthun pa dang / de'i skye bal sogs pa yang yin pas de'i rnam par smin pa ni chos kyi skye mched kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since the life force is the karmic maturation of that birth existence and so on, its karmic maturation is the phenomena element alone.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kun tu spyod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i srog gi dbang po mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kun tu spyod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i srog gi dbang po mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Others say: The life force that is the domain of activity of virtuous and afflicted minds that arise in the formless realm is asserted to be the phenomena element.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na ni gnas skabs thams cad du skye mched gzhan dang gzhan yang yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na ni gnas skabs thams cad du skye mched gzhan dang gzhan yang yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: In the desire and form realms, other sense bases exist in all states.

original: gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Those who possess the mental base possess two.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: Consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: Feeling, etc., and their origination, etc., are the entity faculty.

original: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same is true of the faculty of tangibility.

original: reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The faculty of tangibility is the four great elements and the entity faculty.

original: de'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The origination, etc., of the latter are included in the entity faculty.

original: 'dir reg bya'i skye mched ni sems can du bgrang ba la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir reg bya'i skye mched ni sems can du bgrang ba la rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the faculty of tangibility should be understood as that which is counted as a sentient being.

original: gang gi phyir lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i gsum ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i gsum ste /
translated: The three faculties are the faculty of touch and the faculties of feeling.

original: lus kyi skye mched ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin la /
translated: The faculty of touch is derived from the four great elements.

original: de yang 'byung ba la bltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba la bltos pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is dependent on the great elements.

original: @283a * // lus kyi skye mched ni reg bya'i skye mched 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can la mi ltos pa mi srid do //
analyzed: @283a * // lus kyi skye mched ni reg bya'i skye mched 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can la mi ltos pa mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible that the faculty of touch does not depend on the great elements that are the nature of tangibility.

original: de'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The origination, etc., of these are the sense sphere of factors.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs kyi skye mched kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs kyi skye mched kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the sense sphere of visible form is also included.

original: gzhan dag na re lus kyi skye mched ni de la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir dang 'byung bab ni tshan la brten pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus kyi skye mched ni de la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir dang 'byung bab ni tshan la brten pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the sense sphere of body is not included because it is not confused about that, and the sense sphere of sound is not included because it is based on the great elements.

original: gang gi gzugs dang dri dang ro'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro /
analyzed: gang gi gzugs dang dri dang ro'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro /
translated: The same is true for those who have the sense spheres of smell, taste, and tangible objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams las ni gang rung ba zhig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams las ni gang rung ba zhig go //
translated: Among visible form, etc., any one of them is included.

original: de dag gi rten 'byung ba chen po dag ni reg bya'i skye mched do //
analyzed: de dag gi rten 'byung ba chen po dag ni reg bya'i skye mched do //
translated: The great elements that are their support are the sense sphere of tangible objects.

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: Their origination, etc., are the sense sphere of factors.

original: mig ni lus la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: mig ni lus la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir na /
translated: The eye is not confused about the body, and origination, etc., are not confused about the characteristics.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa mig gi skye mched yin pa'i phyir de'i skye mched bzhi yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa mig gi skye mched yin pa'i phyir de'i skye mched bzhi yin no //
translated: The four sense-spheres of the eye, etc. are the ripened effect of the action of one who has the intention of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting.

original: gzhan dag ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The sense-sphere of visible form is also the ripened effect of action.üîΩThe other masters say: No, because the sense-sphere of visible form is not confused, like the sense-sphere of visual consciousness.

original: gzhan dag ni skye mched gcig bzhin du mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan la brten pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni skye mched gcig bzhin du mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan la brten pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The sense-sphere of visible form is not the ripened effect of action, for it is not included in the four fundamental material elements which are the basis of the sense-sphere of visual consciousness.

original: de lta na lus kyi skye mched la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na lus kyi skye mched la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The same holds for the sense-spheres of sound, etc.

original: de ni ma yin te mig gi skye mched ni lus kyi skye mched la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi rna ba dang sna dang lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te mig gi skye mched ni lus kyi skye mched la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro // gang gi rna ba dang sna dang lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sense-sphere of the body is the ripened effect of action.üîΩThe sense-spheres of the ear, nose and tongue are also the ripened effect of action.

original: de dag gi tshul yang mig gi dbang po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de dag gi tshul yang mig gi dbang po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The sense-spheres of sound, odor and taste are also the ripened effect of action.

original: de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang ; lus kyi skye mched la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang ; lus kyi skye mched la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also called sense bases because they are based on the great elements, because they possess origination, etc., and because they function in dependence on the physical sense faculties.

original: skye mched bcu gcig ni rnam par smin pa yin la /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gcig ni rnam par smin pa yin la /
translated: Eleven sense bases are karmic maturation.

original: sgra ni ma gtogs te de rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang las 'ga' zhig gi rnam par smin pa skye mched gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgra ni ma gtogs te de rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // yang las 'ga' zhig gi rnam par smin pa skye mched gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
translated: Sound is excluded because it is not karmic maturation.üîΩWhat is the reason that the karmic maturation of some karma is the maturation of one sense base,

original: 'ga' zhig gis bcu gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis bcu gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: while that of other karma is the maturation of eleven sense bases?

original: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs pa dang sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs pa dang sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause the result of karma is various and not various.‚Äù

original: phyi'i sa bon ltar nang gi las kyi sa bon yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i sa bon ltar nang gi las kyi sa bon yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The internal seed of karma should be viewed like an external seed.

original: 'di ltar padma'i sa bon rnams rtsa ba dang / myu @283b gu dang lo ma dang sdong bu dang ge sar dang ze'u 'bru dang lte ba sna tshogs yin pa de bzhin du nas dang grol sogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar padma'i sa bon rnams rtsa ba dang / myu @283b gu dang lo ma dang sdong bu dang ge sar dang ze'u 'bru dang lte ba sna tshogs yin pa de bzhin du nas dang grol sogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the seeds of the lotus are various, i.e., the root, the sprout, the leaf, the stem, the stamen, the pistil, and the pericarp, but this is not the case for barley, wheat, etc.

original: las dus gcig pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: las dus gcig pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Karma that is simultaneous with its retribution, etc.

original: las 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no //üîΩlas dus gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no // las dus gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The retribution of past karma is past, present, and future.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Karma that is simultaneous with its retribution is not future.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras ba ni /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur bar 'ong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur bar 'ong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is possible that the effect would be without a cause.

original: bzlog ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlog ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The opposite is not possible.

original: las skad cig ma du ma'i rnam par smin pa'i skad cig gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: las skad cig ma du ma'i rnam par smin pa'i skad cig gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: The retribution of a single moment of karma is not a single moment of retribution.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect would be too small in comparison with the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa ma yin te /
translated: The ripened effect does not ripen together with the action,

original: lhan cig skyes pa la ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gnyis byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa la ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gnyis byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two causes, the co-existent cause and the associated cause, are not admitted for that which arises simultaneously.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi 'dra bar smin pa la bltos te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi 'dra bar smin pa la bltos te /
translated: The ripened cause is a cause that produces an effect that is dissimilar to itself.

original: rnam par gzhag na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag na /
translated: If you admit that the ripened cause is a cause that produces an effect that is dissimilar to itself,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshogs pas bsdus pa ni mi 'dra bar smin pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshogs pas bsdus pa ni mi 'dra bar smin pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: then the collection of wholesome and unwholesome factors would not be a cause that produces an effect that is dissimilar to itself.

original: mig la sogs pa ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: The eye, etc., are the ripened effect of action, and therefore are morally non-defined.

original: sems kyang de'i rjes su 'jug go //üîΩmjug thogs su yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyang de'i rjes su 'jug go // mjug thogs su yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is also non-defined when it is in a state of absorption.üîΩThe ripened effect is not the effect of the immediately preceding condition.

original: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa ma yin te zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa ma yin te zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The ripened effect is not the effect of the immediately preceding condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is drawn out by the immediately preceding condition.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs bde ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyis drangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs bde ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyis drangs pa yin gyi /
translated: The moment that follows the cause of karmic maturation is drawn out by the immediately preceding condition,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not drawn out by the cause of karmic maturation itself.

original: de mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because virtue and nonvirtue arise after it.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the cause of karmic maturation‚Äù means

original: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa ni de lhan cig tu smin pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa ni de lhan cig tu smin pa ma yin zhing /
translated: that karmic maturation does not ripen simultaneously with it,

original: mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
translated: nor does it ripen immediately after it.

original: rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin bdag dus yongs su chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin bdag dus yongs su chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it arises from the special transformation of the continuum and because the time of karmic maturation is definite.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the result of karmic maturation.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las skyes pa med pa'i phyir dang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i 'bras bu ma @284a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las skyes pa med pa'i phyir dang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i 'bras bu ma @284a * //
translated: Other than that, they do not arise from the special transformation of the mindstream and they are not results that last as long as samsara.üîΩ

original: yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin par thal ba med do //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin par thal ba med do //
translated: Other causes are not results of karmic maturation because they do not arise from the special transformation of the karmic cause and they are not results that last for as long as samsara.

original: 'di dag gi dus nges pa don gyis ni bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba la /üîΩlhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dus nges pa don gyis ni bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba la / lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad do //
translated: Although the time of these causes is explained by implication,üîΩthe time of the coemergent cause is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.üîΩThe time of the homogeneous cause is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.üîΩThe time of the omnipresent cause is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.üîΩThe time of the cause of karmic maturation is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.üîΩThe time of the concomitant cause is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.üîΩThe time of the cause of natural outflow is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.

original: sngar skyes rnams zhes brjod pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do //üîΩsems dang sems byung rten mtshungs rnams zhes bye brag med par brjod pa dus gsum pa yin no zhes bshad do //üîΩkun 'gro lnga zhes brjod pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do ;
analyzed: sngar skyes rnams zhes brjod pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do //üîΩsems dang sems byung rten mtshungs rnams zhes bye brag med par brjod pa dus gsum pa yin no zhes bshad do //üîΩkun 'gro lnga zhes brjod pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do ;
translated: The time of the cause of the result of separation is not explained by implication because it is not mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.

original: / mi dge ba dang dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa ma yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: / mi dge ba dang dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa ma yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since it is stated without distinction that only nonvirtuous and virtuous contaminated states are results of conscious effort, it is implicitly explained that they are not of the three times.

original: rang las gzhan ba byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bye brag med par brjod pas byed rgyu dus gsum pa dang / dus las rnam par grol ba yin par don gyis bshad do //
analyzed: rang las gzhan ba byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bye brag med par brjod pas byed rgyu dus gsum pa dang / dus las rnam par grol ba yin par don gyis bshad do //
translated: Since it is stated without distinction that the active cause is a cause other than itself, it is implicitly explained that the active cause is of the three times and is not free from time.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here the reason is stated:

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is endowed with a result that is a natural outflow.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa med do //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa med do //
translated: But the future does not exist.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since a cause and its result operate in mutual dependence, the question is asked:

original: rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: What is the result of those causes?

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThe conditioned and the disintegrated are results.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma gtogs pa /
translated: Except for space and nonanalytical cessation,üîΩall conditioned states are results.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gzhan thams cad ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gzhan thams cad ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all other conditioned and unconditioned states are results.

original: nam mkha' bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin la /
translated: Space is not a result because it is not an object of activity and it is not obtained.

original: rkyen ma tshang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: cessation not due to deliberation is not a result because it is obtained due to the incompleteness of conditions.üîΩThe treatise mentions it because it is to be established. The treatise states:

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ltar lam gyis thob pa ma yin te de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos smos pa ni bstan bcos las 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ltar lam gyis thob pa ma yin te de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos smos pa ni bstan bcos las 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: What are the resultant dharmas?

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then there would be no cause without a result

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu 'am /üîΩrgyu med pa'i 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu 'am / rgyu med pa'i 'bras bu med de /
translated: or a result without a cause,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a cause and a result are mutually dependent.

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas @284b rgyu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas @284b rgyu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, because unconditioned states are causes, they would also be results of those of which they are causes.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And because they are results, they would also be causes of those of which they are results.

original: mi 'gyur te 'di ltar 'dus byas kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te 'di ltar 'dus byas kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: They do not, because conditioned states alone are results and causes.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mtshungs bzhin du 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mtshungs bzhin du 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod kyi /
translated: Although they are similar in being things that are results and causes, conditioned states alone are results and causes.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: Unconditioned states are not. What is the reason for that?

original: de la rag las pa'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung bas rgyu gsungs te /
analyzed: de la rag las pa'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung bas rgyu gsungs te /
translated: The reason is stated: because a cause that depends on it is impossible.

original: 'byung ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid de /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid de /
translated: The six types of causes are impossible because they are incompatible with emergence.

original: 'di la rgyu rnam pa drug med la /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu rnam pa drug med la /
translated: The six types of causes do not exist for unconditioned states.

original: 'di la 'bras bu yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu yang med de /
translated: Nor do results exist for them,

original: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are unconditioned and because emergence is incompatible with them.

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi rig brgyas par brjod par bya ste /üîΩde la byed rgyu'i rgyu yang mi srid de /üîΩde ni skye bzhin ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor bzhag na 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi rig brgyas par brjod par bya ste / de la byed rgyu'i rgyu yang mi srid de / de ni skye bzhin ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor bzhag na 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: The characteristics of cause and effect should be extensively explained.üîΩA non-compounded entity cannot be a homogeneous cause, because it does not possess the state of having arisen.

original: / skye ba dang ldan pa phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang mi srid do //
analyzed: / skye ba dang ldan pa phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang mi srid do //
translated: A non-compounded entity cannot be a co-originated cause, because it does not possess the state of mutual causality.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sngar skyes pa med pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sngar skyes pa med pas skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yang mi srid do //
translated: A non-compounded entity cannot be a prior equivalent immediately antecedent condition, because it does not possess the state of having arisen.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: A non-compounded entity cannot be a concomitant cause, because it is not by nature mind or mental factors.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: A non-compounded entity cannot be a pervasive cause, because it is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing suffering and so on.

original: 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang mi srid de /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is impossible for it,

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not associated with it and because it is permanent.

original: gzhan yang rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the cause of karmic maturation is indeterminate,

original: bral ba ni dge ba yin pas 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: bral ba ni dge ba yin pas 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: but separation is virtuous. Therefore, it has no cause of karmic maturation.

original: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the six types of causes are impossible, unconditioned states are not results.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir yang 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir yang 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med do zhes ston to //
translated: It is also taught that unconditioned states have no result because the five types of results are impossible.

original: 'di ltar 'dus ma byas la bdag po'i 'bras bu ni mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus ma byas la bdag po'i 'bras bu ni mi srid de /
translated: Thus, the dominant result is impossible for unconditioned states.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The dominant result

original: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
analyzed: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
translated: is not a prior state.üîΩThe conditioned is the dominant result

original: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: of the conditioned alone.

original: zhes lhan cig 'byung ba dang phyis 'byung bar 'dod na /
analyzed: zhes lhan cig 'byung ba dang phyis 'byung bar 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that the dominant result is either coemergent or arises later,

original: de ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it does not possess arising.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang mi srid de /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang mi srid de /
translated: The result of natural outflow is also impossible.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩ@285a * // zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o // @285a * // zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: The effect resembling the cause is like the cause.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the unconditioned does not arise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'ang mi srid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'ang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, the effect of human action is also impossible.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir skyes bu'i rtsal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir skyes bu'i rtsal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unconditioned does not arise, it is devoid of the power of human action.

original: 'di rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable that the unconditioned is the effect of a ripening.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag ba dang bcas pas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag ba dang bcas pas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect of a ripening is produced by nonvirtue and virtue that is contaminated.

original: lam gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir na 'di la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang mi srid de /
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir na 'di la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang mi srid de /
translated: The effect of freedom is also impossible for the unconditioned, because it is not the nature of a path.

original: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That is the effect of the uninterrupted paths.

original: gzhan yang dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu med de /
translated: Moreover, the unconditioned does not have an effect because it does not have the power to hold or produce an effect, since it is free from time.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lnga ni da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //üîΩzhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lnga ni da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin // zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Five are the present cause of the effect.

original: yang na rgyu rnam pa lnga dang chos mi mthun pas 'dus ma byas la rgyu rnam pa lnga mi srid pas so //
analyzed: yang na rgyu rnam pa lnga dang chos mi mthun pas 'dus ma byas la rgyu rnam pa lnga mi srid pas so //
translated: Or else, because it is contrary to the five causes, the unconditioned cannot be a cause of five kinds.

original: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Why is it called the path?

original: de ni dngos po 'byung ba la byed pa dang bral ba kho na yin par 'dod do snyam pa na 'dri ba'i bsam ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po 'byung ba la byed pa dang bral ba kho na yin par 'dod do snyam pa na 'dri ba'i bsam ba'o //
translated: The idea is that it is only the activity of the arising of a thing that is accepted.

original: 'di ltar de ni skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way, it is the nature of that which does not hinder the arising of that which is in the process of arising.

original: gang zhig skye bzhin pa gang zhig la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i byed rgyu'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig skye bzhin pa gang zhig la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i byed rgyu'i rgyu yin na /
translated: That which is the nature of not hindering the arising of that which is in the process of arising is the active cause of that.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But the unconditioned is not endowed with arising.

original: de'i phyir lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the active cause of this path.

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
translated: The conditioned and the disassociated are the effect of the active cause.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir bral pa 'bras bu'i ngo bor grags pas de'i phyir de ni de gang gi'am zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir bral pa 'bras bu'i ngo bor grags pas de'i phyir de ni de gang gi'am zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, since separation is renowned as the nature of the result, therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThat is the result of what?‚Äù

original: gal te lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod na'o //
translated: If you do not assert that it is the active cause of this path,

original: yang na de'i rgyur mi 'dod na ji ltar de 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na de'i rgyur mi 'dod na ji ltar de 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: then how could it be the result of that?

original: de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni lam gyi 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni lam gyi 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúThat is the result of what?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is the result of the path.‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba de'i lan ni de'i stobs kyis thob ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba de'i lan ni de'i stobs kyis thob ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste / gang gi phyir /
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúHow is it the result?‚Äù is ‚ÄúBecause it is obtained by the power of that.‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas lam gyi stobs kyis 'thob pa de'i phyir 'dus ma byas lam gyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas lam gyi stobs kyis 'thob pa de'i phyir 'dus ma byas lam gyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Because the unconditioned is obtained by the power of the path, therefore the unconditioned is the result of the path.

original: de ltar na lam byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus the path is not the active cause.

original: 'o na ni de lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir lam de 'thob pa de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni de lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir lam de 'thob pa de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: But if that is so, then since it arises by the power of the path, only the obtainment of that path is its result, because it is capable of that.

original: bral ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin te de la nus pa @285b med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin te de la nus pa @285b med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Disconnection is not the result of the path, because it is not capable of that.

original: thob pa yang 'dod pa ma yin nam zhes na /
analyzed: thob pa yang 'dod pa ma yin nam zhes na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt obtainment also not asserted?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu de bskyed pa dang bral bas bral ba'i 'bras bu nyid 'dir mi 'dod kyang gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu de bskyed pa dang bral bas bral ba'i 'bras bu nyid 'dir mi 'dod kyang gdags par bya'o //
translated: The result of conscious effort and the dominant result are generated by that, but disconnection is not asserted to be a result that is generated.

original: yang na lam mya ngan las 'das pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir thob pa kho na 'bras bur brjod do //
analyzed: yang na lam mya ngan las 'das pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir thob pa kho na 'bras bur brjod do //
translated: Or else, obtainment alone is called the result of the path because the path does not act on nirvana and because it is not the result of the path in its entirety.

original: yang thob pa 'bras bu nyid du byed pa'i phyir ma yin gyi mya ngan las 'das pa la yang nus pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir thob pa la yang nus pa gzhan la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: yang thob pa 'bras bu nyid du byed pa'i phyir ma yin gyi mya ngan las 'das pa la yang nus pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir thob pa la yang nus pa gzhan la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Also, in order to demonstrate that even nirvana has the ability to act, although it does not act as the result of obtainment, he says, ‚ÄúObtainment has the ability to act with regard to another.‚Äù

original: thob pa la ni byed pa bo nyid kyis nus pa yin te /
analyzed: thob pa la ni byed pa bo nyid kyis nus pa yin te /
translated: Obtainment has the ability to act as the agent itself.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kha cig dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kha cig dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Some homogeneous causes are coemergent causes.

original: bral ba la ni thob par byed pa nyid kyis nus pa yin te lam med par ni bral ba mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: bral ba la ni thob par byed pa nyid kyis nus pa yin te lam med par ni bral ba mi 'thob bo //
translated: Obtainment has the ability to act as the agent that causes separation, because without the path, separation is not obtained.

original: de lta bas na re zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, as it is said,

original: rgyu rnams ni dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir lam ni ji ltar yang bral ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi bral pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir lam ni ji ltar yang bral ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi bral pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: since causes are the reason for the arising of things, the path is not in any way the cause of separation. Separation is its result.

original: yang mya ngan las 'das pa rgyu med pa 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang mya ngan las 'das pa rgyu med pa 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can nirvana be a result without a cause?

original: 'jig rten na mngon par 'dod pa'i don nus pas thob pa dag la 'bras bu zhes grags la /üîΩmrityu shya n'a ma ba ra:ru sha:syann'artha: tasm'anna sarb'a bhimata:purush'artho //
analyzed: 'jig rten na mngon par 'dod pa'i don nus pas thob pa dag la 'bras bu zhes grags la / mrityu shya n'a ma ba ra:ru sha:syann'artha: tasm'anna sarb'a bhimata:purush'artho //
translated: Nirvana is the result of the path, because it is attained through the power of the arya path.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang 'phags pa'i lam gyi nus pas 'thob pas de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la rgyu med pa nyid ni de thob par bya ba 'phags pa'i lam rgyu drug po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang 'phags pa'i lam gyi nus pas 'thob pas de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la rgyu med pa nyid ni de thob par bya ba 'phags pa'i lam rgyu drug po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not causeless, because the arya path is the cause of attaining it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ('chi ba rang ming ngam zhes bya ba gzhan /üîΩskyes bu / 'gyur /üîΩdon ma yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ('chi ba rang ming ngam zhes bya ba gzhan / skyes bu / 'gyur / don ma yin /
translated: Nirvana is the object of a person, because it is the object of a person, since it is the object of a person who is an arya.

original: de'i phyir ma yin /üîΩthams cad mngon par 'dod /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin / thams cad mngon par 'dod /
translated: It is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.

original: skyes bu'i don/) kho na yid la bzhag nas lam bsgom pa la 'jug gi / de'i thob pa yid la bzhag nas ni ma yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir de nyid gtsor lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi de'i thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don/) kho na yid la bzhag nas lam bsgom pa la 'jug gi / de'i thob pa yid la bzhag nas ni ma yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir de nyid gtsor lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi de'i thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the object of a person, because it is not the object of a person who is not an arya.üîΩIt

original: lam na de 'thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam na de 'thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not enter the path in order to obtain it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pa kho na dge sbyong gi 'bras bur gsungs kyi lam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pa kho na dge sbyong gi 'bras bur gsungs kyi lam ni ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, the BhagavƒÅn said that only abandonment is the fruit of virtue, not the path.

original: yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If the dominant result does not exist, then what is the extensive explanation?

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /üîΩbyed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di la bdag @286a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te / byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di la bdag @286a * //
translated: This is how it is explained.

original: po'i 'bras bu khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: po'i 'bras bu khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Since it is the active cause, the dominant result should be accepted.

original: de khas mi lan na byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de khas mi lan na byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: If it is not accepted, it contradicts the acceptance that it is the active cause.

original: 'gal ba med de skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: There is no contradiction, because it is the active cause by the nature of not obstructing arising.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba la 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba la 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is certain that past and present states give rise to and hold results,

original: ma 'ongs pa ltar dus dang bral ba la de'i nus pa med pas 'di la 'bras bu mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ltar dus dang bral ba la de'i nus pa med pas 'di la 'bras bu mi 'dod do //
translated: it is not asserted that future states have results, because they do not have the power to do so, like the present.

original: 'di la 'bras bu yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It is not that it exists as an effect.üîΩThe five that are mentioned in the Abhidharma

original: lnga po de ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: lnga po de ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: are the present and the past.üîΩThe two that are mentioned in the AbhidharmaüîΩare the present and the future.üîΩThe five that are mentioned in the Abhidharma are the present, the past, the future, the nonarisen, and the unconditioned.

original: gnyis ni 'byin bar byed pa yin //üîΩzhes dus kyis bsdus ba don la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa bshad na /üîΩ'dus ma byas la ni da ltar byung ba nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ni 'byin bar byed pa yin // zhes dus kyis bsdus ba don la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa bshad na / 'dus ma byas la ni da ltar byung ba nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: The two that are mentioned in the Abhidharma are the present and the future.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa mi srid la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa mi srid la /
translated: Since the present does not exist in the unconditioned, it is impossible for it to be an effect that is maintained.

original: 'das pa da ltar byung ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do //
analyzed: 'das pa da ltar byung ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do //
translated: Since the past does not exist in the present, it is impossible for it to be an effect that is generated.

original: de'i phyir 'di la dngos kyi rtogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag med kyi /üîΩ'on kyang btags pa'i rtogs pas rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid du bsnyad do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la dngos kyi rtogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag med kyi / 'on kyang btags pa'i rtogs pas rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid du bsnyad do ;
translated: Therefore, in reality, cause and effect do not exist in the unconditioned.üîΩHowever, they are said to exist nominally.

original: / rgyu ma yin no zhes ni rnam grangs kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rgyu ma yin no zhes ni rnam grangs kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not a cause‚Äù is stated by implication.

original: don gyis gsungs kyi sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyis gsungs kyi sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is stated, not the words.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes 'dir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen ma lus par smos pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang khyad par med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu rtag pa med do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes 'dir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen ma lus par smos pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang khyad par med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu rtag pa med do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the causes and conditions of form and so on are mentioned without exception here, and because they are established as impermanent without distinction, it is said that there is no permanent cause.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes zer ba ni chos mngon pa ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes zer ba ni chos mngon pa ba ste /
translated: The Abhidharmikas say, If that is so,

original: byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: not only would it not be the active cause,

original: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'ang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'ang mi 'gyur te /
translated: it would also not be the objective condition of consciousness.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams bye brag med par mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams bye brag med par mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because causes and conditions are established as impermanent without distinction.

original: mdo sde ba na re skyed ba'i zhes bkar ba'i phyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdo sde ba na re skyed ba'i zhes bkar ba'i phyir 'gyur te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say, It is not so, because it is specified as that which generates.

original: gang dag rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: gang dag rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tsam yin la /
translated: Those that are merely the objective domain of consciousness

original: skyed bar byed ba ma yin pa de dag rtag pa nyid ni mi dgag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyed bar byed ba ma yin pa de dag rtag pa nyid ni mi dgag go zhes zer ro //
translated: but do not generate it are not refuted as permanent.

original: gzhan dag na re dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par shes pa'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid 'gag ba la byed pa'i rgyu da ltar ba ma yin te rnam par shes pa smos pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par shes pa'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid 'gag ba la byed pa'i rgyu da ltar ba ma yin te rnam par shes pa smos pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The present cause is not the cause of cessation, because it is not the generating cause of the object condition of consciousness.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rgyu rnams kyang de kho na ltar yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rgyu rnams kyang de kho na ltar yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Causes are just like that.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu rnams thams cad ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes @286b zer ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu rnams thams cad ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes @286b zer ro //
translated: It has already been explained that not all active causes are generating causes.

original: rkyen ni bzhi po zhes bya ba'i mdo sde las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po zhes bya ba'i mdo sde las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
translated: The sutra that states, ‚ÄúThere are four conditions,‚Äù declares that the object condition is a condition.

original: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni mdo las kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni mdo las kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: But the sutra does not declare that it is an unobstructed cause.

original: yang na mdo las 'dus ma byas dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: yang na mdo las 'dus ma byas dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
translated: Or else, the sutra declares that unconditioned states are object conditions.

original: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ste /
translated: But it does not declare that they are unobstructed causes.

original: de'i phyir mdo las 'dus ma byas rgyu'i dngos por mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las 'dus ma byas rgyu'i dngos por mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore unconditioned states are not established as things that are causes.

original: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub na zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the sutras have mostly disappeared.

original: rtsa ba'i bsdu ba nyams pa sems la bzhag nas de skad du smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsdu ba nyams pa sems la bzhag nas de skad du smras pa yin no //
translated: They say this, thinking that the root collection has declined.üîΩEven if the sutras have disappeared, they are known from other sutras, because they are not prohibited.

original: mdo nub kyang bkag ba'i phyir mdo gzhan las ma gsungs par shes la ma bkag kyang mdo ma lus par rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes bya bar rtogs par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo nub kyang bkag ba'i phyir mdo gzhan las ma gsungs par shes la ma bkag kyang mdo ma lus par rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes bya bar rtogs par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But if they have not disappeared, it is possible to understand that they are not mentioned because they are not included in the sutras without exception, but not otherwise.

original: de lta bas na ma bkag pa'i phyir dang rtsa ba'i bsdu ba nyams pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma bkag pa'i phyir dang rtsa ba'i bsdu ba nyams pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be ascertained that they are not mentioned because they are not prohibited or because the root collection has declined.

original: gzhan dag na re skyed par byed pa'i zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus ma byas rgyu nyid dang rkyen nyid du mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skyed par byed pa'i zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus ma byas rgyu nyid dang rkyen nyid du mtshon pa yin te /
translated: Others say: Because it says ‚Äúthat which generates,‚Äù the unconditioned is indicated here by the Bhagavan as a cause and a condition.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di skad du gzugs kyi rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di skad du gzugs kyi rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: Otherwise, it would say, ‚ÄúThe causes and conditions of form are impermanent.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyur gyur pa yod cing rkyen du gyur pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyur gyur pa yod cing rkyen du gyur pa yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, unconditioned factors exist as causes and as conditions,

original: 'ga' zhig skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but they do not produce anything.

original: rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of causes:üîΩthe productive cause and the nonobstructive cause.

original: skyed par byed pa dang / 'gal bar mi byed pa'o zhes 'di ni byed rgyu'i rgyu bsal bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang / 'gal bar mi byed pa'o zhes 'di ni byed rgyu'i rgyu bsal bar bshad zin to //
translated: This is the explanation of the efficient cause.

original: yang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: What is this disjunction?

original: rab tu grags pa'i don gyis ma grags pa'i don nges par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i don gyis ma grags pa'i don nges par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the well-known meaning of a word determines the unknown meaning of a word,

original: 'dir gnyis ka yang don ma grags pa yin pas phan tshun brten par 'gyur te rta dang bres bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis ka yang don ma grags pa yin pas phan tshun brten par 'gyur te rta dang bres bzhin no //
translated: then here both meanings are unknown, and so they are mutually dependent, like the words ‚Äúhorse‚Äù and ‚Äútether.‚Äù

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that not only is analytical cessation not substantially existent,

original: 'dus ma byas thams cad rdzas su med do zhes zer ro //üîΩgzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dag las dngos po gzhan yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas thams cad rdzas su med do zhes zer ro // gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la / ji ltar gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dag las dngos po gzhan yin zhing /
translated: but all unconditioned things are not substantially existent.üîΩLike form, feeling, etc.üîΩJust as form is a different substantial entity from feeling, etc.,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas sam phan tshun @287a * //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas sam phan tshun @287a * //
translated: and feeling, etc., are different substantial entities from form, so too unconditioned things are not different substantial entities from conditioned things or from each other.

original: las dngos po gzhan ma yin te de'i phyir rdzas su med do //
analyzed: las dngos po gzhan ma yin te de'i phyir rdzas su med do //
translated: Therefore, they are not substantially existent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na reg bya med ba tsam ni nam mkha' yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na reg bya med ba tsam ni nam mkha' yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: But space is merely the absence of obstructive contact.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dngos po gzhan dang gzhan dgag par bya ba'i phyir te reg bya snga na med pa'am zhig nas med pa la nam mkha' zhes bya bar gdags so //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dngos po gzhan dang gzhan dgag par bya ba'i phyir te reg bya snga na med pa'am zhig nas med pa la nam mkha' zhes bya bar gdags so //
translated: The word merely is used to refute other substantial entities. Space is designated as the absence of obstructive contact, either prior to the existence of contact or subsequent to its destruction.

original: 'di ltar mun pa'i nang dag na zhes bya bas ni de gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa'i nang dag na zhes bya bas ni de gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúin the dark‚Äù establishes the context.

original: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba la ma phrad na'o zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba la ma phrad na'o zhes 'dzer to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf not found‚Äù means if not contacted.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni gtan tshigs ma bstan par 'dus ma byas rdzas su med do zhes sgrub par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni gtan tshigs ma bstan par 'dus ma byas rdzas su med do zhes sgrub par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says: ‚ÄúWithout stating a reason, it is not possible to prove that unconditioned states do not substantially exist.‚Äù

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa rnams 'gags nas rkyen gzhan ma tshang bas kyang mi skye bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa rnams 'gags nas rkyen gzhan ma tshang bas kyang mi skye bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since negative tendencies and the arising of arising have ceased and other conditions are incomplete, they do not arise. Therefore the root text says, ‚Äúdue to the power of analysis.‚Äù

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba gzhan mi skye ba'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba gzhan mi skye ba'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonarising of other negative tendencies and the arising of arising is called analytical cessation.

original: de'i phyir de lta na phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore it is taught that the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa with and without remainder is analytical cessation.

original: 'di ltar bden pa gnyis 'gags pa ni so sor brtags ba'i 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa gnyis 'gags pa ni so sor brtags ba'i 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cessation of the two truths is analytical cessation.

original: de la phra rgyas ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin la skye ba sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //üîΩ'dir nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sa bon phra rgyas da ltar ba de 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob pas nyon mongs pa phra rgyas 'dod chags la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa mi skye
analyzed: de la phra rgyas ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin la skye ba sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o // 'dir nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sa bon phra rgyas da ltar ba de 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob pas nyon mongs pa phra rgyas 'dod chags la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa mi skye
translated: In this regard, the truth of origination is the proclivity, and birth is the truth of suffering.

original: ba ni sa bon med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: ba ni sa bon med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Here, the cessation of the proclivity, the seed of the defilement of attachment, etc., is the cessation of the defilement, because, by the power of analysis, the proclivity of attachment, etc., is prevented from arising in the future, since one has obtained a basis that is incompatible with the arising of the defilement.

original: de bzhin du skye ba da ltar ba 'gags pa dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs nyid kyis yang srid pa'i skye bar mtshams mi sbyor zhing mi skye ba ni skye ba 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba da ltar ba 'gags pa dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs nyid kyis yang srid pa'i skye bar mtshams mi sbyor zhing mi skye ba ni skye ba 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the cessation of birth is the non-arising of birth, since, by the power of analysis, one does not link up with, i.e., is not born into, a subsequent existence, when the present birth has ceased.

original: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen zas la sogs pa ma tshang bas bar mdor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen zas la sogs pa ma tshang bas bar mdor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no //
translated: For example, when the remaining homogeneous collection of aggregates does not arise due to the absence of conditions such as food, this is nonanalytical cessation.

original: sde ba gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sde ba gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la /
translated: Other schools say:

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rten skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir bskyed ba dang rjes su mthun pas na phra rgyas rnams mi skye ba la shes rab kyi nus pa yod @287b de de'i phyir
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rten skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir bskyed ba dang rjes su mthun pas na phra rgyas rnams mi skye ba la shes rab kyi nus pa yod @287b de de'i phyir
translated: Since negative tendencies are associated with the support that is the arising of affliction, they are compatible with the arising of affliction. Therefore, wisdom has the power to prevent the arising of negative tendencies.

original: de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is analytical cessation.

original: sdug bsngal mi skye ba gang yin pa de la ni shes rab kyi byed pa med pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye ba gang yin pa de la ni shes rab kyi byed pa med pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin te /
translated: Since wisdom does not function in the nonarising of suffering, it is not analytical cessation.

original: de ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ma tshang bas thob pas 'dir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ma tshang bas thob pas 'dir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not a cessation due to deliberation, because it is obtained through the incompleteness of the causes of the origination of suffering.

original: de yang so sor brtags pa med par zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal mi skye ba de yang ste /
analyzed: de yang so sor brtags pa med par zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal mi skye ba de yang ste /
translated: It is also not without deliberation, because the non-origination of suffering is

original: rgyu ma tshang pa ni so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa med bar mi 'grub pas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang pa ni so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa med bar mi 'grub pas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
translated: not established without deliberation, because the incompleteness of the causes is preceded by deliberation. Therefore it is only a cessation due to deliberation.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab med par 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab med par 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it ceases by its own nature means because it ceases without wisdom.

original: de lta na ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni mi rtag pas 'gog pa kho na yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgegs ma byas pa rnams skye ba la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni mi rtag pas 'gog pa kho na yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro // gegs ma byas pa rnams skye ba la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that case, it would be said that cessation due to deliberation is only cessation by impermanence.üîΩWith regard to those that do not obstruct arising,

original: gang dag la skye ba la gegs ma byas pa yod pas na skye ba la gegs ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag la skye ba la gegs ma byas pa yod pas na skye ba la gegs ma byas pa ste /
translated: those that do not obstruct arising are those that do not obstruct the arising of other things.

original: de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas nus pa yin no //
translated: The thing that obstructs their arising is the power of analytical cessation.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen la bltos te res 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba las shes rab kyis skyes pas de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po yin gyi ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen la bltos te res 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba las shes rab kyis skyes pas de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po yin gyi ;
translated: Since they arise sometimes in dependence on causes and conditions, and since they do not arise when wisdom arises, wisdom is the thing that obstructs their arising.

original: shes rab kyis mi skye ba snga nas yod pa ma yin pa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis mi skye ba snga nas yod pa ma yin pa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Wisdom does not cause the nonarising of things that did not previously exist.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi rtag pa nyid med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi rtag pa nyid med la /
translated: Therefore, analytical cessation does not have impermanence.

original: de la shes rab kyis nus pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyis nus pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that wisdom is not powerful with regard to it.

original: gal te mi skye ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mi skye ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: If nonarising alone is nirvana,

original: chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi ltar rdzas gzhan zhig ma yin na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi ltar rdzas gzhan zhig ma yin na /
translated: and not a different substance as the Abhidharma masters say,üîΩthen how do you interpret the sutra passage that states:

original: de lta na 'o na 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal dag skyes zin pa nyid kyis mi skye ba med pa'i phyir mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar drang /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal dag skyes zin pa nyid kyis mi skye ba med pa'i phyir mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar drang /
translated: ‚ÄúThe suffering that has already arisen and has not yet ceased is not nonexistent.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su gyur par khas blangs par 'di drang bar mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su gyur par khas blangs par 'di drang bar mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: But it cannot be interpreted to mean that nirvana is a substance.

original: dbang po lnga ni dad pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni dad pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The five faculties are faith, etc.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe abandonment of the defilements that have it as their object‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal la ni rang gi ngo bos spangs pa yod pa ma yin zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni rang gi ngo bos spangs pa yod pa ma yin zhes ston par byed do //
translated: means that there is no abandonment of suffering by its intrinsic nature.

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags zhes bya ba la / 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe abandonment of desire and lust‚ÄùüîΩmeans that there is no abandonment of desire by its intrinsic nature.üîΩDesire is the wish for something,

original: 'dod chags ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: and lust is attachment.

original: de ltar @288a * //
analyzed: de ltar @288a * //
translated: Thus,

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal spangs pa yin yang mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod par btags pa med bzhin du dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal spangs bar rung ngo //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal spangs pa yin yang mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod par btags pa med bzhin du dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal spangs bar rung ngo //
translated: although suffering is abandoned by the abandonment of the defilements that have it as their object, nirvana is not a substance.

original: ji ltar zhe na so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it so? Because the afflictions that focus on past, future, and present suffering do not arise at all due to the power of analytical discrimination.

original: der yang zhes bya ba'i ni 'don pa'i bye brag la'o //üîΩtshul ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa kho nas de spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba'i ni 'don pa'i bye brag la'o // tshul ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa kho nas de spangs pa yin te /
translated: Here also, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates a difference in the order of presentation.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the only way it can be, because the past, future, and present afflictions that focus on that object are abandoned by the power of analytical discrimination, because the proclivities that focus on the afflictions of the past, future, and present do not arise at all.
