original: yang na dgos pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i bye brag nyid la slar yang dgongs pa 'chad pa'o //üîΩskye ba snga ma la 'byung ba ni tsho rabs snga ma'o //
analyzed: yang na dgos pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i bye brag nyid la slar yang dgongs pa 'chad pa'o // skye ba snga ma la 'byung ba ni tsho rabs snga ma'o //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúhere also‚Äù indicates a different purpose, which is to explain the intention again.üîΩThat which occurs in a previous birth is past.

original: skye ba 'di la byung ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la byung ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
translated: That which occurs in this birth is present.

original: ji ltar bshad na 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa skad cig ma yin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad na 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa skad cig ma yin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How is it explained? The momentariness of the afflictions that have occurred in the past and are occurring in the present is eliminated.

original: 'di nyid la shes byed ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la shes byed ni /
translated: Here is the proof:

original: ji ltar sred pa rnam par spyod pa dag la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar sred pa rnam par spyod pa dag la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as in the case of those who are practicing to eliminate craving.‚Äù

original: sred pa rnam par spyod pa dag ni the tshom za bar 'gyur ba dag ste /
analyzed: sred pa rnam par spyod pa dag ni the tshom za bar 'gyur ba dag ste /
translated: Those who are practicing to eliminate craving are those who are in doubt,

original: g-yo bar gyur pa dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yo bar gyur pa dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: who are wavering, is the meaning.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma gcig gi dbang du mdzad nas yin par ni mi rung zhes 'das pa dang / da ltar ba'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma gcig gi dbang du mdzad nas yin par ni mi rung zhes 'das pa dang / da ltar ba'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: It is not appropriate to take this in terms of a single moment in the past and future, so it should be understood that it is stated in terms of past and present lives.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshe rabs snga ma pa dang ; tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mtha' dag dang sbyar gyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshe rabs snga ma pa dang ; tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mtha' dag dang sbyar gyi //
translated: In the same way, here too, it is applied to the entire continuum of afflictions in past and present lives,

original: skad cig ma gcig dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig dang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to a single moment.

original: sred pa rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad po de dag ni dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sred pa rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad po de dag ni dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, if I-making exists, then the thought ‚ÄòI am like this‚Äô arises,

original: nga 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the thought ‚ÄòI am like that,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI am not like that,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI am good,‚Äô and the thought ‚ÄòI am bad‚Äô arise.

original: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The thought ‚ÄòI will be‚Äô arises,

original: de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur @288b ro ;
analyzed: de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur @288b ro ;
translated: the thought ‚ÄòI will not be,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI will be like this,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI will be like that,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI will not be like that,‚Äô

original: / de la gyur cig snyam par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: / de la gyur cig snyam par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: the thought ‚ÄòI will come to be,‚ÄôüîΩand the thought ‚ÄòI will not come to be‚Äô arise.

original: de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / 'gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / 'gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang /
translated: The thought May it be like this and the thought May it be like that, the thought May it not be like this, the thought Wouldn't it be nice if it were like this, the thought Wouldn't it be nice if it were like that,

original: de 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the thought Wouldn't it be nice if it were not like this, and the thought Wouldn't it be nice if it were not like that arise.

original: de dag gi khyad par ni 'og tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par ni 'og tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: The differences among them will be explained later.

original: nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma pa dang tshe 'di pa pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma pa dang tshe 'di pa pas so //
translated: The phrase by these two afflictions refers to those of former lives and those of this life.

original: rgyud 'di la zhes bya ba da ltar byung ba la'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di la zhes bya ba da ltar byung ba la'o //
translated: The phrase in this continuum refers to the present.

original: sa bon gyi dngos po ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po ni nus pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the form of seeds means in the form of potentialities.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang rgyud nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa bskyed par nus par byas pa des 'di la sa bon gyi dngos po gzhag la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang rgyud nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa bskyed par nus par byas pa des 'di la sa bon gyi dngos po gzhag la zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the two afflictions are said to be the state of seeds because they have the ability to generate future afflictions in the mindstream.

original: sa bon gyi dngos po de spangs pas tshe rabs snga ma ba dang / tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa gnyis po de yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po de spangs pas tshe rabs snga ma ba dang / tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa gnyis po de yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: The seeds of the two afflictions of past lives and this life are abandoned by abandoning that state of seeds.

original: ji srid du des bzhag pa'i sa bon gnas pa de srid du ni nyon mongs pa 'gags kyang spangs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji srid du des bzhag pa'i sa bon gnas pa de srid du ni nyon mongs pa 'gags kyang spangs pa ma yin la /
translated: As long as the seeds established by that state of seeds remain, the afflictions are stopped but not abandoned.

original: des bzhag pa'i sa bon gyi dngos po spangs na ni de yang spangs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des bzhag pa'i sa bon gyi dngos po spangs na ni de yang spangs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When the state of seeds established by that is abandoned, it is also said to be abandoned.

original: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is said that ‚Äúkarmic maturation is exhausted.‚Äù

original: las sngar 'gags kyang ji srid du des bzhag pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma zad ba de srid du zad do zhes mi bya ba la /
analyzed: las sngar 'gags kyang ji srid du des bzhag pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma zad ba de srid du zad do zhes mi bya ba la /
translated: Even though the karma has ceased earlier, as long as the result of karmic maturation established by that has not been exhausted, it is not said to be exhausted.

original: de zad na ni las de zad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de zad na ni las de zad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: When that is exhausted, that karma is said to be exhausted.

original: des bzhag pa'i sa bon med pas ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ji ltar spangs she na /
analyzed: des bzhag pa'i sa bon med pas ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ji ltar spangs she na /
translated: Since the seed that is established by that is not present, how does one abandon future suffering or affliction?

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i ji ltar sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i ji ltar sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúHow is future suffering or affliction abandoned?‚Äù

original: sa bon skye ba mi srid cing /
analyzed: sa bon skye ba mi srid cing /
translated: The seed is impossible to arise,

original: bon med pa'i phyir gtan mi skye ba la /
analyzed: bon med pa'i phyir gtan mi skye ba la /
translated: and because the seed does not exist, it is utterly non-arisen.

original: sa bon med pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kho nas yin te /
analyzed: sa bon med pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kho nas yin te /
translated: The nonexistence of the seed is due to the power of analytical cessation alone.

original: de ltar na dus gsum gyi sdug bsngal la ma nyon mongs pa spangs par bzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na dus gsum gyi sdug bsngal la ma nyon mongs pa spangs par bzhag go //
translated: Thus, suffering and affliction of the three times are posited as abandoned.

original: 'gog pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i da ltar ba ste de ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i da ltar ba ste de ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the present, which is directed toward cessation, is immediately destroyed.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag khyad par med par thal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag khyad par med par thal ba'i phyir /
translated: The master Samghabhadra says: It follows that the distinction between analytical cessation and nonanalytical cessation would not exist.

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,üîΩbecause the two cessations are distinguished in terms of whether or not they are attained through exertion.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir @289a * //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir @289a * //
translated: because the power of discernment causes the conditions to be incomplete.

original: dang ; aa kri totbatti pra ti bandha n'a mutpa tti pra ti bandha da nu tp'a da: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dang ; aa kri totbatti pra ti bandha n'a mutpa tti pra ti bandha da nu tp'a da: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The cessation that is due to discernment is called pratisamkhyƒÅnirodha.üîΩOr else, the cessation that is due to discernment is so called because the seed is incomplete; the cessation that is not due to discernment is so called because the conditions are incomplete.üîΩThe cessation that is due to discernment is the cessation of that which is to be discerned, i.e., of that which is defiled.

original: yang na sa bon ma tshang ba'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod do //
analyzed: yang na sa bon ma tshang ba'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod do //
translated: The cessation that is not due to discernment is the cessation of that which is not to be discerned, i.e., of that which is not defiled, such as the cessation of the unconditioned and of conditioned factors that are not capable of being produced.üîΩThe cessation that is due to discernment is the cessation of that which is to be discerned, i.e., of that which is defiled.

original: so sor brtags pa'i (ma byas pa skye ba gegs /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i (ma byas pa skye ba gegs /
translated: The cessation that is not due to discernment is the cessation of that which is not to be discerned, i.e., of that which is not defiled, such as the cessation of the unconditioned and of conditioned factors that are not capable of being produced.

original: skye ba'i gegs /
analyzed: skye ba'i gegs /
translated: The cessation that is due to discernment is the cessation of that which is to be discerned, i.e., of that which is defiled.

original: mi skye ba/) stobs kyis rkyen ni ma tshang bas sam skye ba med ba la ni khyad par phra mo yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde ni da ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: mi skye ba/) stobs kyis rkyen ni ma tshang bas sam skye ba med ba la ni khyad par phra mo yang yod pa ma yin no // de ni da ltar ma yin te /
translated: The cessation that is not due to discernment is the cessation of that which is not to be discerned, i.e., of that which is not defiled, such as the cessation of the unconditioned and of conditioned factors that are not capable of being produced.üîΩThe cessation that is due to discernment is the cessation of that which is to be discerned, i.e., of that which is defiled.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa med kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin tha dad pa'i tha snyad ma 'chol bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa med kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin tha dad pa'i tha snyad ma 'chol bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The cessation that is not due to discernment is the cessation of that which is not to be discerned, i.e., of that which is not defiled, such as the cessation of the unconditioned and of conditioned factors that are not capable of being produced.üîΩThe cessation that is due to discernment is the cessation of that which is to be discerned, i.e., of that which is defiled.üîΩThe cessation that is not due to discernment is the cessation of that which is not to be discerned, i.e., of that which is not defiled, such as the cessation of the unconditioned and of conditioned factors that are not capable of being produced.üîΩThe cessation that is due to discernment is the cessation of that which is to be discerned, i.e., of that which is def

original: bum pa dang snam bu ni nam yang bum pa dang snam bu ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba ni nam yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu ni nam yang bum pa dang snam bu ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba ni nam yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: A pot and a cloth are never not a pot and a cloth. In the same way, here, the non-arising due to the incompleteness of the conditions is never called analytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis mi skye bas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis mi skye bas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called cessation due to the power of analysis because it is the non-arising due to the power of analysis.

original: gang yang dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pas rab tu phye ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pas rab tu phye ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bshad do //
translated: That which is distinguished by the cessation of suffering in the three times is explained as cessation due to analysis.

original: 'du byed ma 'ongs pa mi skye bas rab tu phye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ma 'ongs pa mi skye bas rab tu phye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-arising of future formations distinguished by non-arising is called cessation not due to analysis.

original: chos mngon pa las ma 'chol bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las ma 'chol bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is established without being asked in the Abhidharma.

original: 'di la yang lan ni bshad zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la yang lan ni bshad zin pa nyid do //
translated: The answer to this has already been explained.

original: 'gags zin pa dang 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs ba ni 'bad pa don dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gags zin pa dang 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs ba ni 'bad pa don dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: It is thought that what has already ceased and what is about to cease would not be pointless efforts.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin spangs par mi 'dod na 'o na ci de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin spangs par mi 'dod na 'o na ci de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs she na /
translated: If you do not assert that the nature of suffering is abandoned, then what is abandoned is the affliction that has that as its object.

original: de yang ma 'ongs pa ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa las 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang ma 'ongs pa ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa las 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, future suffering is asserted to be that which is an obstruction to the arising of the affliction that has that as its object.

original: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa las rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa las rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The nonarising of affliction is not a different type from analytical and nonanalytical cessation.

original: de la dmigs par byas pa'i thob pa yongs su rtogs pa las kyang mi rigs te bkag pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de la dmigs par byas pa'i thob pa yongs su rtogs pa las kyang mi rigs te bkag pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is also illogical that the obtainment of that which is taken as its object is fully understood, because that has been refuted.

original: / gang bshad pa /
analyzed: / gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained that

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i dus su 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa med de spangs pa'i phyir 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i dus su 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa med de spangs pa'i phyir 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: at the time of abandoning affliction, suffering that is past or present and the affliction that has that as its object do not exist because they have been abandoned. This is called the abandonment of past and present suffering.

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba smos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba smos pa ci zhe na /
translated: Why is present suffering mentioned?

original: nyon mongs pa @289b spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa @289b spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the abandonment of the defilements.

original: 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pas de la bzhag pa'i sa bon spangs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pas de la bzhag pa'i sa bon spangs pa ci zhe na /
translated: But if the past and future do not exist, how can the seeds be abandoned?

original: sa bon spangs pa ni lam gyi stobs kyis gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon spangs pa ni lam gyi stobs kyis gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the seeds is the transformation of the basis by the power of the path.

original: gang yang ma 'ongs pa nam mkha'i me tog dang mtshungs pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i 'jug pa med pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: gang yang ma 'ongs pa nam mkha'i me tog dang mtshungs pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i 'jug pa med pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: And it is explained that the future defilements do not occur, because they are like sky-flowers.

original: de la gzhan 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa sdug bsngal la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhan 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa sdug bsngal la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the past and future suffering that is referred to?

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa gang yin pa las sdug bsngal spangs par brjod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa gang yin pa las sdug bsngal spangs par brjod kyi /
translated: It is said that the abandonment of suffering is the abandonment of the defilements.

original: ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa nyid ni ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa nyid ni ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is not said that the future is referred to.

original: 'o na ci sa bon yod pas de la dmigs pa skye zhe na /üîΩji srid 'di skye ba srid pa de srid 'di ma spangs la /
analyzed: 'o na ci sa bon yod pas de la dmigs pa skye zhe na / ji srid 'di skye ba srid pa de srid 'di ma spangs la /
translated: But if the seeds exist, how can the object be abandoned?üîΩAs long as the seed is not abandoned, the object is not abandoned, because it is produced by that seed.

original: de ma spangs pa'i phyir de la dmigs kyang spangs par mi brjod do //
analyzed: de ma spangs pa'i phyir de la dmigs kyang spangs par mi brjod do //
translated: And as long as the object is not abandoned, the object-perception is not abandoned, because it is produced by that object.

original: gang gi tshe 'di gnas gyur pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gnas gyur pas /
translated: But when the basis is transformed,

original: sa bon spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe gtan mi skye ba'i phyir spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe gtan mi skye ba'i phyir spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the seed is abandoned, it is said to be abandoned because it will never arise again.

original: de spangs pa'i phyir de la dmigs kyang sdug bsngal spangs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir de la dmigs kyang sdug bsngal spangs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Even though one focuses on it, it is said that suffering is abandoned because it is abandoned.

original: gang bshad pa ma 'ongs pa nyid med pa'i phyir de ji ltar mi skye bar rung zhe na /
analyzed: gang bshad pa ma 'ongs pa nyid med pa'i phyir de ji ltar mi skye bar rung zhe na /
translated: If the future does not exist, how can it be said that it does not arise?

original: dngos po snga ma can gyi phyir med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po snga ma can gyi phyir med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be nonexistent because it does not have a prior entity.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gang yod ba ni rgyu las 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang yod ba ni rgyu las 'gyur bas /
translated: If it exists, it would arise from a cause.

original: de sems la bzhag nas ma 'ongs pa mi skye bar brjod do //
analyzed: de sems la bzhag nas ma 'ongs pa mi skye bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the future does not arise because it is not present.

original: dngos po snga ma can gyi phyir med pa zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po snga ma can gyi phyir med pa zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that something is nonexistent because it does not have a prior entity.

original: de lta na zhig pa ni gcig la gcig med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na zhig pa ni gcig la gcig med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, destruction would be the mere absence of something in relation to something else.

original: gtan med pa dang snga na med pa dag ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di la nges pa med do //
analyzed: gtan med pa dang snga na med pa dag ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di la nges pa med do //
translated: It is not certain that something is nonexistent because it is not present, nor because it is not past.

original: 'di nges par khas blang bar bya na ma skyes pa nyid mi skye ba yin gyi skye ba ni ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid la yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dngos po yin pa las dus su gtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nges par khas blang bar bya na ma skyes pa nyid mi skye ba yin gyi skye ba ni ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid la yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dngos po yin pa las dus su gtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you definitely accept this, then since that which is not yet arisen is not arising, it follows that that which exists in the future would have the nature of arising and disintegrating and would be included in time.

original: gang yang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i dbang po lnga rnams spang ba'i phyir 'jug pa zhes bshad pa rab tu zhen pas ma brjod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal spong ba don du gnyer ba'i gdul bya rnams la de ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i dbang po lnga rnams spang ba'i phyir 'jug pa zhes bshad pa rab tu zhen pas ma brjod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal spong ba don du gnyer ba'i gdul bya rnams la de ltar gsungs te /
translated: Also, it is said that the five different sense faculties are engaged in order to abandon their objects, but this is not stated because of attachment, because disciples who seek to abandon suffering are taught in this way.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa spong ba dgag pa bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa spong ba dgag pa bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not that the abandonment of afflictions is refuted.

original: dper na thogs pa la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang ste /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'ching ba la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang yang yang kun tu rgyu ba'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pas gzugs la sogs pa @290a * //
analyzed: dper na thogs pa la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang ste / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'ching ba la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang yang yang kun tu rgyu ba'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pas gzugs la sogs pa @290a * //
translated: For example, the objects of obstruction and so on are also explained as abandoned.

original: spangs pa zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Because they are free from attachment to the objects of form and so on, and because they abandon attachment that is the desire to repeatedly engage in them, form and so on are explained as abandoned.

original: de spong ba la gus par sbyar ba'i phyir yin gyi /üîΩ'di gzhan rnams spang ba la gzugs la sogs pa ma spangs pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de spong ba la gus par sbyar ba'i phyir yin gyi / 'di gzhan rnams spang ba la gzugs la sogs pa ma spangs pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It is so called because it is applied to the elimination of that.üîΩBut it should be understood that it is not called ‚Äúnon-elimination of form, etc.‚Äù because the other is not eliminated.üîΩ

original: 'gog pa de rnams kyi mchog tu bshad do zhes bya ste /üîΩrtag pa'i phyir 'dus byas dag pas mchog yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa de rnams kyi mchog tu bshad do zhes bya ste / rtag pa'i phyir 'dus byas dag pas mchog yin la /
translated: It is not that form and so on are not abandoned in other paths, but it is said that the path of seeing is the supreme of all paths because it is the supreme of all paths that abandon the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe supreme of all cessations is nirvanaüîΩbecause it is permanent.üîΩThe supreme of all virtuous unconditioned states is nirvana

original: dge ba 'dus ma byas dag pas mchog yin par bshad /üîΩde ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi mchog kyang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo dang 'gal lo //üîΩ'di ltar dngos po med pa ni mtshan nyid med pas chos nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba 'dus ma byas dag pas mchog yin par bshad / de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi mchog kyang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo dang 'gal lo // 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni mtshan nyid med pas chos nyid ma yin la /
translated: because it is virtuous.üîΩThus nirvana is the supreme of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena and it is also a nonthing.

original: brjod du med pa ni brjod du med pa dag pas mchog nyid kyang ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni brjod du med pa dag pas mchog nyid kyang ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This contradicts the sutras, because a nonthing is not a reality because it has no characteristics and because it is not supreme among inexpressible states because it is not distinct from inexpressible states.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is called a phenomenon because it holds its own characteristics.

original: chos gzhan dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan du gyur pa cung zad cig yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan du gyur pa cung zad cig yin no //
translated: And it is superior to other phenomena because it is a different object.

original: 'dus ma byas ni med pa kho na'o zhes kyang mi smra ste des na mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni med pa kho na'o zhes kyang mi smra ste des na mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: We also do not say that unconditioned states do not exist at all, so there is no contradiction with the s≈´tras.

original: gal te yod la rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: gal te yod la rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa des na /
translated: If it exists but does not substantially exist,

original: de ji lta bu zhig yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: then how should it be described?

original: de ni kho bo cag gis ji skad du bshad pa de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag gis ji skad du bshad pa de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is just as we have explained it.

original: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin la /
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin la /
translated: Space is merely the absence of contact.

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis gzhan mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin zhing /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis gzhan mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin zhing /
translated: The nonarising of other negative tendencies and birth that has already arisen and ceased through the power of thorough analysis is analytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pas med pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang ba mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas med pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang ba mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Nonanalytical cessation is the nonarising of a nonexistent due to the incompleteness of conditions, as in the statement, ‚ÄúNonanalytical cessation is the nonarising of a nonexistent due to the incompleteness of conditions.‚Äù

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la yod ces bya zhe na /üîΩdper na sgra la snga na med pa yang yod /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la yod ces bya zhe na / dper na sgra la snga na med pa yang yod /
translated: How can it be said to exist in the nature of that which does not exist?

original: phyis med pa yang yod ces bya mod kyi /
analyzed: phyis med pa yang yod ces bya mod kyi /
translated: For example, it is said that sound exists prior to its occurrence and that it exists after it ceases.

original: 'on kyang dngos po med pa yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med pa yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: However, the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is not established as existent by the term ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig phrad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig phrad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a verbal prefix.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Unconditioned states should be viewed in the same way.

original: yod do zhes kyang bya ba la yod pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod do zhes kyang bya ba la yod pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúexists‚Äù is also used for that which does not exist.

original: ji ltar med pa rnams kyi mchog med pa yin par 'os zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni med pa yang kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung @290b ba'o ;
analyzed: ji ltar med pa rnams kyi mchog med pa yin par 'os zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni med pa yang kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung @290b ba'o ;
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúHow can nonexistence be the supreme nonexistence?‚Äù is ‚ÄúSome say that nonexistence is supreme.‚Äù

original: / de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: / de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang gnod pa thams cad dang gtan bral ba de ni zhes bya ba smos te nad med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gnod pa thams cad dang gtan bral ba de ni zhes bya ba smos te nad med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthat which is completely free from all harm,‚Äù like being free from illness.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bsngags pa thob pa 'os she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bsngags pa thob pa 'os she na /
translated: Why is it worthy of praise?

original: gdul bya rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to inspire interest in it among those to be trained.

original: gdul bya bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa rnams de la skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdul bya bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa rnams de la skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those to be trained who are attached to the self will be frightened by it.

original: nam mkha' ni thams cad med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni thams cad med pa ma yin te /
translated: Space is not completely nonexistent,

original: reg bya med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by the mere absence of contact.

original: so sor brtags pas ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ni gtan bral ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ni gtan bral ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although cessation not attained through deliberation is completely free,

original: gnod pa thams cad dang ni ma yin te skye ba dang mi ldan pa rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad dang ni ma yin te skye ba dang mi ldan pa rnams kho na'o //
translated: it is not from all harm, only from that which is not yet born.

original: de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is attained.

original: de ltar na gzhan dag pas de mchog yin pas bsngags pa thob bar 'os so //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan dag pas de mchog yin pas bsngags pa thob bar 'os so //
translated: Thus, it is worthy of praise because it is superior to the others.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ltar chos kyi tha snyad kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ltar chos kyi tha snyad kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why not accept that even though they do not exist by way of their own character, they are still the referents of terms, just as the past and future are?

original: 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: ji skad bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad ce na /
translated: How has it been explained?üîΩIn the statement, ‚ÄúIn order to induce trainees to enter into suchness.

original: gdul ba rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar te /
analyzed: gdul ba rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar te /
translated: In order to inspire those to be trained to aspire to that.üîΩ

original: brjod du med pa nyid yin yang snga na med pa la sogs pa ltar de dag phan tshun khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid yin yang snga na med pa la sogs pa ltar de dag phan tshun khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are inexpressible, they are still mutually distinct, like the past and future.

original: mi 'grub ste snga na med pa dang brjod du med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'grub ste snga na med pa dang brjod du med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is not established because ‚Äúinexpressible‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent previously‚Äù

original: zhig nas med pa dang gtan med pa dang gcig la gcig med pa rnams las gang yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa dang gtan med pa dang gcig la gcig med pa rnams las gang yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would be equivalent to any of the following: ‚Äúhaving been destroyed and not existing,‚Äù ‚Äúutterly nonexistent,‚Äù and ‚Äúmutually nonexistent.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du cig shos la yang brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du cig shos la yang brjod par bya'o ;
translated: The same should be said for the other two.

original: / slob dpon 'dus bzang na re rdzas dang btags par yod pa las gzhan pa'i yod pa'i rnam pa ma bshad pa'i phyir de ltar smras na mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa ma yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / slob dpon 'dus bzang na re rdzas dang btags par yod pa las gzhan pa'i yod pa'i rnam pa ma bshad pa'i phyir de ltar smras na mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa ma yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The master Samghabhadra says that if one speaks in that way, one accepts that nirvana does not exist, because it is not explained that nirvana is a kind of existence other than substantial existence and nominal existence.üîΩMoreover, the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is also used for what did not exist before and what will not exist later.
