analyzed: gang yang yod pa'i sgra ni snga na med pa dang phyis med pa la yang yod pas dpyad de / re zhig 'di ci zhe na gtan med pa nyid ni rnam pa gzhan dgag pa shes par byed pa'i don to // yod pa ni bcas pa'i sgra ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.

original: snga ma dang phyi mar yang rnam pa kha cig dgag pa las 'di dang 'di med do zhes sbyar ba de la cig shos la cig shos med pa ni dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar yang rnam pa kha cig dgag pa las 'di dang 'di med do zhes sbyar ba de la cig shos la cig shos med pa ni dngos po nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.

original: gtan med pa ni dngos po'i tha snyad do ;üîΩ/ ci ltar mi 'gal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gtan med pa ni dngos po'i tha snyad do ; / ci ltar mi 'gal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.

original: de yod pa gang la sdug bsngal gyi dngos po dgag pa med de /
analyzed: de yod pa gang la sdug bsngal gyi dngos po dgag pa med de /
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a term of inclusion, and the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is a term of exclusion.üîΩThe

original: 'di dang 'di med do zhes dpe bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di med do zhes dpe bstan par mi nus so //
translated: But it is impossible to demonstrate an example of this or that non-existence.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi sgra tsam ni gnyi ga la ji lta bar rung ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi sgra tsam ni gnyi ga la ji lta bar rung ste /
translated: The mere sound of conventional designation is suitable for both,

original: 'dus ma byas la btags par yod pa mi 'gal lo //üîΩgal @291a * //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la btags par yod pa mi 'gal lo // gal @291a * //
translated: and it is not contradictory to designate the unconditioned.

original: te btags pa nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: te btags pa nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is contradictory because there is no designation of appropriation,

original: 'di la ji skad bshad pa'i btags pa nye bar len pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di la ji skad bshad pa'i btags pa nye bar len pa yod de /
translated: then there is the appropriation of designation as has been explained.

original: dper na nags tshal gyi shing dang / dmag gi glang po dang rta la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nags tshal gyi shing dang / dmag gi glang po dang rta la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a forest of trees, or an army, or a herd of horses.

original: gang bshad pa'i sgra snga ma dang phyi ma khas blangs pa la dpe ma grub po zhe na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang bshad pa'i sgra snga ma dang phyi ma khas blangs pa la dpe ma grub po zhe na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If you say that the previous and subsequent sounds that have been explained are not established as examples because they are accepted, that is also unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gal te da ltar ba bzhin snga ma dang phyi ma las gzugs kyang yod na de ltar yod pa de'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa'i phyir ci las snga ma dang phyi ma zhes shes par mi byed /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba bzhin snga ma dang phyi ma las gzugs kyang yod na de ltar yod pa de'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa'i phyir ci las snga ma dang phyi ma zhes shes par mi byed /
translated: If form existed in the past and future as it does in the present, then since that existence would be its nature, it would be permanent. Therefore, how could it be known as past and future?

original: gal te byed pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa las so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists due to activity,

original: byed pa de yang rdzas sam btags pa ci zhig tu brjod par byed /
analyzed: byed pa de yang rdzas sam btags pa ci zhig tu brjod par byed /
translated: then is that activity said to be substantial or nominal?

original: gal te rdzas kyi sgo nas de ltar yod na snga ma dang phyi mar yang byed pa med par khas blang pa'i phyir rdzas kyi sgo nas dus thams cad du yod par khyas blangs pa la gnod do //
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi sgo nas de ltar yod na snga ma dang phyi mar yang byed pa med par khas blang pa'i phyir rdzas kyi sgo nas dus thams cad du yod par khyas blangs pa la gnod do //
translated: If it exists in that way substantially, then it is contradicted that you accept that it exists substantially at all times, because you accept that it does not exist in the past and future.

original: rdzas su yod par mtshungs pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa la dus thams cad du yod la byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rdzas su yod par mtshungs pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa la dus thams cad du yod la byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Even if it is similar in existing substantially, it is only your own idea that form and so on exist at all times but activity does not.

original: ci ste btags pa tsam du yod na de ltar na nyung dur yod pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: ci ste btags pa tsam du yod na de ltar na nyung dur yod pa zhes brjod de /
translated: But if it exists as a mere nominal reality, then it is said to exist in a lesser way,

original: da ltar ba yang don dam pa'i sgo nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba yang don dam pa'i sgo nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present exists in an ultimate sense.

original: da ni dus thams cad du yod na snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ci ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: da ni dus thams cad du yod na snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ci ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: Now, if it exists at all times, how is the presentation of past and future established?

original: 'on kyang byed pa med pa dang don gzhan med pas btags par yod pa de lta na yang yod pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi byed pa yang rtag pa'i byed pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang byed pa med pa dang don gzhan med pas btags par yod pa de lta na yang yod pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi byed pa yang rtag pa'i byed pa bzhin nam /
translated: However, since it is not a function and is not another object, it is imputedly existent.üîΩBut since it is not different from existence, its function is like the function of permanence.

original: dngos po yang mi rtag pa zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang mi rtag pa zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But since it is not without activity and is not a different object, it is nominally existent. But in that case, it would follow that the activity of the intrinsic reality of an entity is like the activity of a permanent entity, or that the entity is impermanent.

original: de ltar na gnyi ga ltar yang snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir dus gsum med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga ltar yang snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir dus gsum med do //
translated: Thus, since there is no convention of ‚Äúprior‚Äù and ‚Äúposterior,‚Äù the three times do not exist.

original: gang bshad pa yod pa ni zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de yang mi rigs te ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgal te da ltar ba nyid snga ma dang phyi mar yang yod pa ni kho na'i sgra yis 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang bshad pa yod pa ni zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de yang mi rigs te ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te da ltar ba nyid snga ma dang phyi mar yang yod pa ni kho na'i sgra yis 'grub bo //
translated: But that is illogical. Why?üîΩIf the present itself exists in the prior and posterior, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù establishes that.

original: de ltar yod pa da ltar ba nyid ltar sgra yang dgag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa da ltar ba nyid ltar sgra yang dgag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it exists in that way, then the present would be negated, just like sound.

original: da ltar ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin par byas pa de lta na yang 'das pa'i sgra gzhan la da lta ba yang gzhan la ma 'ongs pa yang gzhan no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin par byas pa de lta na yang 'das pa'i sgra gzhan la da lta ba yang gzhan la ma 'ongs pa yang gzhan no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is present, it is not different. But even so, it follows that the past is different from the present, and the present is different from the future.

original: gzhan ma yin pa la ni kho na'i sgra 'das pa ma yin ma 'ongs pa @291b ma yin da ltar 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa la ni kho na'i sgra 'das pa ma yin ma 'ongs pa @291b ma yin da ltar 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And if they are not different, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not appropriate, because it is not past, not future, and not present.

original: gcig la ma skyes pa dang skyes pa 'jig pa nyid dang ma skyes pa mi 'jig pa nyid kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig la ma skyes pa dang skyes pa 'jig pa nyid dang ma skyes pa mi 'jig pa nyid kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not possible for one thing to be both unborn and born, to perish and not to perish.

original: 'dir gzhan dang gzhan med pa mi rung bas de nyid der bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dang gzhan med pa mi rung bas de nyid der bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since it is not possible for it to be different or not different, it is refuted in that way.

original: de ltar de'i rang bzhin med pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i rang bzhin med pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that it does not exist in reality.

original: 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe noble truth of cessation would not exist‚Äù means

original: gang zhig ci yang ma yin pa de ni ji ltar de'i bden pa'am brdzun pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gang zhig ci yang ma yin pa de ni ji ltar de'i bden pa'am brdzun pa zhes bya /
translated: how could that which is nothing at all be a truth or a falsehood of that?

original: re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don 'di gang yin /
analyzed: re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don 'di gang yin /
translated: For now, what is the meaning of the truth of cessation?

original: ci rdzas kyi don yin nam 'on te phyin ci log pa'i don yin /
analyzed: ci rdzas kyi don yin nam 'on te phyin ci log pa'i don yin /
translated: Is it the meaning of substance or is it the meaning of the opposite?

original: gal te rdzas kyi don yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi don yin na ni /
translated: If it is the meaning of substance,

original: de lta na kun rdzob kyi bden pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na kun rdzob kyi bden pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that conventional truth would not exist,

original: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i don khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i don khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: because of that, one must assert that it is the meaning of the opposite.

original: de lta na sdug bsngal ltar sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang bden pa nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal ltar sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang bden pa nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: If that is so, then just as suffering is, so the cessation of suffering is not contradictory as a truth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúThe noble ones see the truth of cessation as the opposite of the truth of suffering,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal nyid du gzigs kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal nyid du gzigs kyi /
translated: Just as the noble ones see suffering as suffering,

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ma yin pas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par brjod pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal med pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar gzigs pa la sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ma yin pas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par brjod pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal med pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar gzigs pa la sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since it is not called pleasure, the noble ones see it as only having the characteristic of the absence of suffering, and it is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: ji ltar med pa ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir gsum pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir gsum pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is nonexistence, how can it be the third?

original: gnyis pa'i 'og tu mthong ba dang bstan pas na gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i 'og tu mthong ba dang bstan pas na gsum pa yin te /
translated: It is the third because it is seen and taught after the second.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gnyis pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'i 'og tu rang gi shes rab kyis mthong ba dang / ston pa'i tshe gzhan gnyis kyi 'og tu bstan pas gsum pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gnyis pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'i 'og tu rang gi shes rab kyis mthong ba dang / ston pa'i tshe gzhan gnyis kyi 'og tu bstan pas gsum pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one realizes the truths, one sees it with one‚Äôs own wisdom after the second truth of the origin of suffering, and when one teaches it, one teaches it after the other two.

original: yul med par shes pa med do //
analyzed: yul med par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no cognition without an object.

original: de spyod pa rnams la rtogs par byed ces bya ba ni cher 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de spyod pa rnams la rtogs par byed ces bya ba ni cher 'gal ba ste /
translated: It is a great contradiction to say that the noble ones realize it.

original: med pa zhes bya ba shes pa de ci la dmigs pa'o //üîΩgal te dngos po med na med ces bya bas dngos po kho na bkag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba shes pa de ci la dmigs pa'o // gal te dngos po med na med ces bya bas dngos po kho na bkag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the cognition called ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù?

original: dngos po bkag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po bkag pa mi rigs so //
translated: If you say that the cognition of nonexistence has an existent thing as its object, then it is not a cognition of nonexistence.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of nonexistence has a nonexistent thing as its object, then it is not a cognition of a nonexistent thing.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa ci ltar zhen dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa med do //üîΩde bzhin du gtso bo dang skyes bu dang dbang phyug la @292a * //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa ci ltar zhen dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa med do // de bzhin du gtso bo dang skyes bu dang dbang phyug la @292a * //
translated: If you say that the cognition of nonexistence has no object, then it is not a cognition.üîΩThe same argument applies to the cognitions that have pradhƒÅna, puru·π£a, ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: as their objects.üîΩWhat is the consequence?

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes bya'o //üîΩci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes bya'o // ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the fault?

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bskyang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bskyang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position is maintained, which is the good consequence.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes smras pa de'i lan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes smras pa de'i lan te /
translated: The fault is that it would be an unreal mental construction.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a fault to impute that which is not real.üîΩWhy?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam gyis 'di sgrub par mi nus so zhes rgyu dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam gyis 'di sgrub par mi nus so zhes rgyu dris pa'o //
translated: This is asking the reason why this cannot be established by mere words.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Like form, feeling, etc.

original: gang zhig dngos po yin pa de ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bos mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po yin pa de ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bos mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is a thing is, like form, feeling, etc., perceived by direct perception by virtue of its own nature.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yin na /
translated: Or, like the eye, etc., it is perceived by inference through its effect.

original: 'di la gnyis ga yang med pas 'dus ma byas dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba gzung ste 'di ni lan gcig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis ga yang med pas 'dus ma byas dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba gzung ste 'di ni lan gcig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: But since neither of these two is the case for unconditioned things, they are not things. This has been explained more than once.

original: dngos po che ge mo zhig gi zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po'i'o //
analyzed: dngos po che ge mo zhig gi zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome thing‚Äù refers to the thing that is desire, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nor dang / bdag po dang / yan lag dang / yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can gyi 'brel pa rnams la sogs pa rnams gzung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nor dang / bdag po dang / yan lag dang / yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can gyi 'brel pa rnams la sogs pa rnams gzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes such things as the relation between wealth and its owner, the relation between parts and a whole, and the relation between a quality and that which possesses the quality.

original: 'gog pa ni dngos po'i 'bras bu ma yin zhing rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni dngos po'i 'bras bu ma yin zhing rgyu ma yin la /
translated: cessation is not the effect of a thing, nor is it a cause.

original: nor dang bdag po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nor dang bdag po yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not wealth, nor is it an owner.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: bkag ba tsam du ni nga'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bkag ba tsam du ni nga'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúI am merely a cessation‚Äù

original: chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ste sgra dang mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ste sgra dang mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: is made from the perspective of the relation between a property and a property possessor, like the relation between sound and impermanence.

original: de ni de'i gnas skabs yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i gnas skabs yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: That is its state, but it is not another.

original: dngos po gzhan nyid yin na yang nyon mongs pa gang gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan nyid yin na yang nyon mongs pa gang gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Even if it were a different thing, the phrase ‚Äúwhose affliction‚Äù would not be appropriate.

original: 'dir sems gnyis la 'gog pa gnyis ba lta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sems gnyis la 'gog pa gnyis ba lta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the two cessations should be viewed as the two minds.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dang / lhan cig tu nyon mongs pa'i thob pa 'gal la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dang / lhan cig tu nyon mongs pa'i thob pa 'gal la /
translated: The uninterrupted path is incompatible with the obtainment of the affliction.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa 'thob po //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa 'thob po //
translated: The liberated path obtains analytical cessation.

original: nyon @292b mongs pa'i thob pa ma 'gags par ni bral ba'i thob pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: nyon @292b mongs pa'i thob pa ma 'gags par ni bral ba'i thob pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: The obtainment of freedom is not obtained without the cessation of the obtainment of the affliction.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa gang gi thob pa 'gags nas 'gog pa gang thob pa de ni de'i yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa gang gi thob pa 'gags nas 'gog pa gang thob pa de ni de'i yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: Thus, when the obtainment of any affliction ceases, the cessation that is obtained is that of that affliction.

original: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel ba med pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel ba med pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: Here, since there is no connection of cause and effect, etc.,

original: 'o na de 'thob bar nges pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na de 'thob bar nges pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause that definitely obtains it?‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa 'di'i thob pa chad pas 'gog pa 'di kho na 'thob kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di'i thob pa chad pas 'gog pa 'di kho na 'thob kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no cause whatsoever that definitely determines that this cessation is obtained by the cessation of the obtainment of this affliction and not any other.

original: sngar bshad pa'i 'brel pa rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i 'brel pa rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previously explained relationships are impossible.

original: yang na 'di ni 'dod chags kyi bral ba'i thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni 'dod chags kyi bral ba'i thob pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, this is the obtainment of freedom from attachment,

original: gzhan gyi bral ba'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bral ba'i ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the freedom from other.

original: zhes nges pa'i rgyu med de 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang lam la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes nges pa'i rgyu med de 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang lam la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no cause for ascertaining that, because the obtainment of attachment being severed is not the cause, and because there is no difference in the path.

original: che ge mo zhig gis med pa'o zhes dgag pa tsam du ni rung ngo zhes gang smras pa de la lung dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig gis med pa'o zhes dgag pa tsam du ni rung ngo zhes gang smras pa de la lung dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúIt is suitable to merely negate, ‚ÄòIt does not exist,‚Äô ‚Äù in order to demonstrate that this contradicts scripture,

original: mdo las mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mdo las mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the sutra states, ‚ÄúOne who attains nirvana in this life‚Äù and so on.

original: da ltar ba'i skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings kyi gnas skabs na yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings kyi gnas skabs na yin te /
translated: Attaining nirvana in the present life is the state of the dhƒÅtu with remainder.

original: des na med pa ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na med pa ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since what does not exist is inexpressible, how could it be attained?

original: de'i phyir mdo las thob par gsungs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las thob par gsungs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, we declare that nirvana exists, because it is said to be attained in the sutras.

original: med pa yin yang thob pa mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnyen po thob pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: med pa yin yang thob pa mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnyen po thob pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: To show that it is not contradictory for something to be attained even though it does not exist, he says, because the attainment of its antidote is attained.

original: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa dag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa dag ste /
translated: Afflictions and rebirth are afflictions and rebirth.

original: de dag gi skye ba ni nyon mongs pa yang srid pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba ni nyon mongs pa yang srid pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: Their arising is the arising of afflictions and rebirth.

original: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i nyon mongs pa yang srid de dag tu skye ba shin tu 'gal ba'i rten te de 'thob pa'i phyir slar yang nyon mongs pa skye ba'am skyed pa ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i nyon mongs pa yang srid de dag tu skye ba shin tu 'gal ba'i rten te de 'thob pa'i phyir slar yang nyon mongs pa skye ba'am skyed pa ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of nirvana is the attainment of the support that is the complete cessation of the arising of those afflictions and rebirth, because the arising of afflictions or the generation of afflictions does not occur again due to the attainment of the support that is the complete cessation of the arising of those afflictions and rebirth.

original: gnyen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The antidote is the uninterrupted path.

original: de thob pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Its attainment is its actualization.

original: 'di ltar de ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rten skye ba dang 'gal bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rten skye ba dang 'gal bas /
translated: Thus, it is the basis that is related to the seed of the affliction that is to be abandoned by that path, and it is incompatible with the arising of that basis.

original: de'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtogs pa'i rten skye bar 'gyur te lam gyis de bsgyur ba'i phyir @293a * //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtogs pa'i rten skye bar 'gyur te lam gyis de bsgyur ba'i phyir @293a * //
translated: Immediately after that, the basis that is the seed of the affliction arises, because the path transforms it.

original: ro ; / de ltar na gnyen pos nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten 'thob bo //
analyzed: ro ; / de ltar na gnyen pos nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten 'thob bo //
translated: Thus, the antidote obtains a basis that is incompatible with the arising of the affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob na yang skye ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob na yang skye ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: Even though one obtains a basis that is incompatible with the arising of all afflictions, the arising of the affliction does not occur.

original: de ltar na de skye ba 'byung ba dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de skye ba 'byung ba dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is incompatible with the occurrence of the arising of the affliction.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i sa bon mi 'gal na ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten mi 'thob la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i sa bon mi 'gal na ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten mi 'thob la /
translated: If the seed of the affliction were not incompatible, one would not obtain a basis that is incompatible with the arising of the affliction.

original: gnyen po ma skyes na ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon mi 'gag go //
analyzed: gnyen po ma skyes na ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon mi 'gag go //
translated: If the antidote did not arise, the seed of the affliction would not be stopped.

original: lung las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
analyzed: lung las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
translated: Also, from the scriptures, it says:

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di lta ste mi skye ba'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di lta ste mi skye ba'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example here is ‚Äúnon-arising,‚Äù because it is a synonym for non-production.

original: slob dpon gyis 'byung ba 'gag pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas 'byung ba med pa zhes khungs su bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'byung ba 'gag pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas 'byung ba med pa zhes khungs su bshad pa /
translated: The Master quotes ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù from the perspective of the mere cessation of arising.

original: de'i phyir 'di yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf this existed,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni mi 'byung bas khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos po nyid bstan gyi 'byung ba bkag pa tsam ni ma yin pas 'di na mya ngan las 'das pa mi skye ba tsam du shes par bya ba la khungs ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'byung bas khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos po nyid bstan gyi 'byung ba bkag pa tsam ni ma yin pas 'di na mya ngan las 'das pa mi skye ba tsam du shes par bya ba la khungs ma yin no zhe na /
translated: This teaches that the state of nirvana is a thing that is distinguished by non-arising, but it is not merely the negation of arising. Therefore, the Master says, this is not a source for understanding that nirvana is mere non-arising.

original: bdun pa 'di ni nus pa med par ba lta'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdun pa 'di ni nus pa med par ba lta'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The seventh, ‚ÄúThis is like the powerless,‚Äù is extensive.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to ‚Äúin order to accomplish the desired purpose.‚Äù

original: 'dir yin na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad pa yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yin na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad pa yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Here, ‚ÄúIf this existed, it would arise‚Äù is explained.

original: rten gyi don mi srid pas na gzhan du nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: rten gyi don mi srid pas na gzhan du nye bar bkod do //
translated: Since the meaning of ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is impossible, it is set forth elsewhere.

original: gang kho nas zhes bya ba ni lam gyis so //
analyzed: gang kho nas zhes bya ba ni lam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù refers to the path.

original: de thob par bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob bar ro //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTo attain that‚Äù is to attain nirvana.

original: de nyid yod dam zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: de nyid yod dam zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that exists‚Äù is to manifest.

original: thob na zhes bya ba ni rnyed na ste lam dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thob na zhes bya ba ni rnyed na ste lam dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf attained‚Äù is to be found, and is connected to the path.

original: sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa don med par brtags pa ci zhig bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa don med par brtags pa ci zhig bya zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou should wish for the non-occurrence of suffering‚Äù means what is the use of imagining another nirvana?

original: nges par spangs pa ni nges par bor ba ste /
analyzed: nges par spangs pa ni nges par bor ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDefinite abandonment‚Äù is definite rejection.

original: 'dir zhes pa phung po thams cad spangs pa ni spangs pa zhes bya bar 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa phung po thams cad spangs pa ni spangs pa zhes bya bar 'gal ba med do //
translated: Here, the abandonment of all aggregates is called ‚Äúabandonment,‚Äù so there is no contradiction.

original: de la yang bdun pa 'di ni nus pa med par blta'o zhes bya ba thams cad rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang bdun pa 'di ni nus pa med par blta'o zhes bya ba thams cad rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: And here, this seventh [line] should be seen as powerless. All should be stated extensively.

original: de'i sems kyis rnam par thal zhes bya ba phung po lhag ma med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: de'i sems kyis rnam par thal zhes bya ba phung po lhag ma med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts mind is liberated‚Äù means that at the time of nirvana, there are no remaining aggregates.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: chos mngon pa ba rnams ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa rnam pa gnyis su 'chad de /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ba rnams ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa rnam pa gnyis su 'chad de /
translated: Abhidharma masters explain the cessation of suffering in two ways:

original: sdug @293b bsngal las don gzhan ma yin pa dang sdug bsngal las don gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: sdug @293b bsngal las don gzhan ma yin pa dang sdug bsngal las don gzhan pa'o //
translated: cessation that is not a different object from suffering and cessation that is a different object from suffering.

original: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su nye bar bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One taught those two types according to the specific inclinations of disciples.

original: 'ga' zhig don gzhan ma yin pa ni ji ltar yod pa las ma skyes pa dang yod pa las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig don gzhan ma yin pa ni ji ltar yod pa las ma skyes pa dang yod pa las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some say that it is not a different object, as in ‚Äúnot arisen from existence, definitely emerging from existence,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir lung dang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung dang 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction with scripture.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mi rtag par bstan pa de yang dngos po nyid do zhes bya ba de la 'gal ba ci zhig / mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yang yod pa don gzhan du gyur pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mi rtag par bstan pa de yang dngos po nyid do zhes bya ba de la 'gal ba ci zhig / mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yang yod pa don gzhan du gyur pa /
translated: We reply: There is no fault, because nirvana is taught to be an existent that is a different object,

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de la dgongs pas skyon med do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de la dgongs pas skyon med do //
translated: because all formations have the nature of impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal las don gzhan ma yin pa 'gog pa zhes bya ba chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi khas blangs 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las don gzhan ma yin pa 'gog pa zhes bya ba chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi khas blangs 'gal ba ste /
translated: The assertion of the Abhidharma masters that cessation is not a different object from suffering contradicts their own tenets.

original: sdug bsngal las don gzhan ma yin pa sdug bsngal nyid sdug bsngal 'gog par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las don gzhan ma yin pa sdug bsngal nyid sdug bsngal 'gog par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that suffering itself, which is not a different object from suffering, is the cessation of suffering.

original: gang yang 'di ni don gzhan gyi 'gog pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir lung du gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di ni don gzhan gyi 'gog pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir lung du gsungs te /
translated: Also, this is stated in the scriptures in order to understand that cessation is a different object.

original: de yang yod pa'i sgra ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa la yang yod do zhes bya ba 'dis slar yang bshad do //
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i sgra ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa la yang yod do zhes bya ba 'dis slar yang bshad do //
translated: This is also explained again by the statement ‚ÄúThe word existent also refers to that which did not exist before and that which exists after being destroyed.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mi rtag par bstan pa de yang dngos po zhes bya ba 'dis ni sarba /üîΩma / li kri /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mi rtag par bstan pa de yang dngos po zhes bya ba 'dis ni sarba / ma / li kri /
translated: Also, nirvana is taught to be impermanent.üîΩThis is because the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúJust as a lamp goes out, so too nirvana is realized.‚Äù

original: tanna hi / dngos po'i ngo bo mi rtag pa nyid ni mar me lta bu ste res 'ga' med pas na bcom ldan 'das kyis mar me bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa yang rtogs zhes sems kyi rnam par thar pa gang yin pa rtag pa nyid kho nar bstan par 'gyurüîΩro // gzhan du bris pa gang yin pa (thams cad /
analyzed: tanna hi / dngos po'i ngo bo mi rtag pa nyid ni mar me lta bu ste res 'ga' med pas na bcom ldan 'das kyis mar me bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa yang rtogs zhes sems kyi rnam par thar pa gang yin pa rtag pa nyid kho nar bstan par 'gyur ro // gzhan du bris pa gang yin pa (thams cad /
translated: This teaches that the mind‚Äôs liberation is permanent.

original: mchog / byas/) de (ma yin/) nyid rnam par bshad pa 'di las bkag par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mchog / byas/) de (ma yin/) nyid rnam par bshad pa 'di las bkag par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that this refutes what is written elsewhere.

original: gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas dngos su ma bkag go //
analyzed: gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas dngos su ma bkag go //
translated: But fearing too lengthy a text, I have not refuted it here.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: mdo byed pa so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo byed pa so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: The s≈´tra author states the definition of nonanalytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pa dang bral ba kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang bral ba kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation that is not due to deliberation is the non-arising of factors due to the incompleteness of the conditions, without any deliberation whatsoever.

original: rkyen ma tshang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by incompleteness of conditions?

original: rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa dang nye bar ma gyur pa zhes gang bshad pa yin no //üîΩgang med pa ni dngos po skye ba'i gegs nus pa ma yin pas de'i rkyen ma tshang ba tsam @294a * //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa dang nye bar ma gyur pa zhes gang bshad pa yin no // gang med pa ni dngos po skye ba'i gegs nus pa ma yin pas de'i rkyen ma tshang ba tsam @294a * //
translated: The non-coalescence, the non-coming together of the conditions.üîΩThe absence of a factor is not capable of obstructing the arising of a factor.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the incompleteness of its conditions is not a non-deliberate cessation.

original: rkyen ma tshang ba las chos kha cig dmigs te gang nus pa las skye ba'i chos can yang mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba las chos kha cig dmigs te gang nus pa las skye ba'i chos can yang mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Some factors are perceived as arising from the incompleteness of conditions. Even though they are capable of arising, they do not arise.

original: de lta ma yin na rkyen ma tshang ba tsam las mi skye bar khas len par byed na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rkyen ma tshang ba tsam las mi skye bar khas len par byed na /
translated: If it were otherwise, one would admit that they do not arise from the incompleteness of conditions.

original: yang de'i rigs can gyi rkyen dang nye ba las chos de skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de'i rigs can gyi rkyen dang nye ba las chos de skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it follows that these factors would arise from the mere presence of the conditions of their own type.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rkyen ma tshang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rkyen ma tshang ba ma yin no //
translated: Cessation due to deliberation is not due to the incompleteness of conditions.

original: 'o na rkyen ma tshang ba las dngos po rnams mi skye ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rkyen ma tshang ba las dngos po rnams mi skye ba ci zhe na /
translated: But if it is not due to the incompleteness of conditions, how is it that things do not arise?

original: gang gi phyir rkyen la ni skye ba de med pa'i phyir de nyid kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen la ni skye ba de med pa'i phyir de nyid kho na ma yin te /
translated: Because the arising of that thing does not exist in the conditions, it is not due to that alone.

original: chos gzhan gyi dngos po mi skye ba bya ba ma mthong ba de'i phyir skye ba'i gegs kyi phyir rgyu med pa'i chos gzhan kun tu rtogs pas brtags nas chos gzhan skyed pa'i gegs nus pas rtag tu skye ba la gegs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gzhan gyi dngos po mi skye ba bya ba ma mthong ba de'i phyir skye ba'i gegs kyi phyir rgyu med pa'i chos gzhan kun tu rtogs pas brtags nas chos gzhan skyed pa'i gegs nus pas rtag tu skye ba la gegs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the arising of another thing is not seen, it is imagined that another thing is a cause that obstructs arising. But since it is not possible for another thing to obstruct the arising of another thing, it would follow that it would always obstruct arising.

original: 'o na ci de'i thob pa la rkyen ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ci yang yod pa ma yin na gang de'i thob brtag pa nyid du rtog par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci de'i thob pa la rkyen ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ci yang yod pa ma yin na gang de'i thob brtag pa nyid du rtog par mi byed ce na /
translated: But if the incompleteness of conditions does not exist at all in regard to the obtainment of that thing, why is it imagined that the obtainment of that thing is due to the incompleteness of conditions?

original: gang gi phyir rkyen ma tshang ba kho na ma yin te de'i thob pa'i rgyu 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen ma tshang ba kho na ma yin te de'i thob pa'i rgyu 'dod do //
translated: Because the incompleteness of conditions is not the cause of the obtainment of that thing.

original: gang la rkyen ma tshang ba rnams kho na la sems gnas pa so sor thob pas de nyid de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang la rkyen ma tshang ba rnams kho na la sems gnas pa so sor thob pas de nyid de'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the attainment of the stability of thought is the non-fulfillment of the conditions for the arising of thought.

original: de lta na 'o na rkyen ma tshang ba nyid las dngos po rnams mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rkyen ma tshang ba nyid las dngos po rnams mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then things do not arise from the non-fulfillment of conditions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa yongs su brtags pas gsungs pa yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa yongs su brtags pas gsungs pa yang ci zhe na /
translated: Why did the Lord declare that the attainment of non-analytical cessation is a fabrication?

original: 'di la yod pa ma yin pa 'dir mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la yod pa ma yin pa 'dir mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that what does not exist here does not exist there.

original: rgyu la yod pa ma yin pa 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu la yod pa ma yin pa 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that what does not exist in the cause does not exist in the effect.

original: gal te yang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa las ma byung ba'i dngos po rnams nyid brjod par bya na /
analyzed: gal te yang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa las ma byung ba'i dngos po rnams nyid brjod par bya na /
translated: If it is said that things that do not arise from non-analytical cessation should be mentioned,

original: 'di la yod pa'am ma thob pa 'dir mi 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: 'di la yod pa'am ma thob pa 'dir mi 'gyur zhes so //
translated: it is said that what exists here or is not attained here does not exist there.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained that

original: slar yang de'i rigs can gyi rkyen nye ba las chos de skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang de'i rigs can gyi rkyen nye ba las chos de skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that the dharma would arise again from the presence of conditions of the same type.

original: de yang mi rigs te de'i rigs can kho na'i 'bras bur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te de'i rigs can kho na'i 'bras bur 'gyur gyi /
translated: That also is illogical, because it would be the effect of only those conditions that are of the same type as the effect.

original: gang gi rkyen ma tshang ba de nyid kyis ni ma yin te de ni de'i rkyen gyi rigs can yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rkyen ma tshang ba de nyid kyis ni ma yin te de ni de'i rkyen gyi rigs can yin no //
translated: But it is not the effect of those conditions that are incomplete, because those are not of the same type as the conditions of the effect.

original: rkyen rnams kyis rkyen gzhan dang gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩde ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis rkyen gzhan dang gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na / de ni ma yin te /
translated: Don‚Äôt conditions generate other conditions?üîΩThat is not so, because conditions that possess an effect would again arise from those conditions.

original: rkyen rnams ni slar yang 'bras bu dang bcas pa yod pa gang las slar yang skye ba de'i rkyen du 'gyur ba de'i @294b phyir rkyen ma tshang ba las ma 'ongs pa na gtan mi skye ba so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes gnas so
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni slar yang 'bras bu dang bcas pa yod pa gang las slar yang skye ba de'i rkyen du 'gyur ba de'i @294b phyir rkyen ma tshang ba las ma 'ongs pa na gtan mi skye ba so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes gnas so
translated: Therefore, when conditions are incomplete, future nonarising is called nonanalytical cessation.

original: // gang yang gzhan las mang du bshad pa de yang rnam par bshad pa 'dis bkag par blta ste dngos su dgag pa ma byas so //
analyzed: // gang yang gzhan las mang du bshad pa de yang rnam par bshad pa 'dis bkag par blta ste dngos su dgag pa ma byas so //
translated: The other explanations should be refuted by this explanation, but they are not refuted directly.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Abhidharma states:

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: This is not the meaning of the s≈´tra.

original: dngos po med pa ni lus med pa dang rang gi ngo bo med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni lus med pa dang rang gi ngo bo med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-entity does not mean non-existence of body or non-existence of intrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dngos po'i sgra'i don du ma brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dngos po'i sgra'i don du ma brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is not stated to be the meaning of the term entity.

original: gal te 'di don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not the meaning, then what is it?

original: 'o na gang yin zhe na dngos po ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'o na gang yin zhe na dngos po ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Entity is of five kinds.

original: rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid dngos po'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid dngos po'o //
translated: Natural entity means intrinsic nature itself is entity.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as entity means just as object.

original: dmigs pa nyid dngos po yin pa 'di dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid dngos po yin pa 'di dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Object itself is entity, so this is objective entity.

original: ldan pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba la /üîΩldan pa'i dngos po ni ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba la / ldan pa'i dngos po ni ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Possessing entity meansüîΩpossessing entity is objective entity.üîΩCausal entity means

original: rgyu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid dngos po yin pa ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid dngos po yin pa ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
translated: cause itself is entity, so this is causal entity.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the term ‚Äúentity that is grasped,‚Äù

original: yongs su gzung ba 'am yongs su 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba 'am yongs su 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: an entity that is grasped or an entity that grasps is an entity that is grasped.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'dir bdag gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'dir bdag gir byed pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the act of making something one‚Äôs own.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rgyu dngos po'i sgrar gsungs kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rgyu dngos po'i sgrar gsungs kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states that the cause is an entity, but not its own nature.

original: gang gi phyir chos mngon pa las 'dus ma byas rnams rgyu med pa nyid du grub kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos mngon pa las 'dus ma byas rnams rgyu med pa nyid du grub kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This is because the Abhidharma demonstrates that unconditioned states are established as being without a cause, but not that they are without their own nature.

original: yang 'bras bu 'di dag las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu 'di dag las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Moreover, the root text states, ‚ÄúThese are the results of that.‚Äù

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgyu drug po de las rgyu gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgyu drug po de las rgyu gang gi zhe na /
translated: From among the six causes, they are results of which cause?

original: de la re zhig bral ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu gang gi yang ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la re zhig bral ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu gang gi yang ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: First, it is explained that the result of separation is not any cause.

original: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
analyzed: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
translated: The final result is the maturational result.

original: zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ste /üîΩrnam par smin pa las rnam par smin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ste / rnam par smin pa las rnam par smin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The result of natural outcome is from the maturational cause.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid rnam par smin pa dang @295a * //üîΩbcas pas so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid rnam par smin pa dang @295a * //üîΩbcas pas so //
translated: The maturational result is not from the maturational cause because virtue and nonvirtue have karmic maturation.

original: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'i yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bu kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te bdag po'i 'bras bu ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'i yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bu kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te bdag po'i 'bras bu ma bkag pa'i phyir ro // bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: but it is not held that karmic maturation is only a result, because it is not refuted that it is a dominant result.üîΩThe first is a dominant result.

original: 'di bdag po'i yin pa ni bdag po'i'o //
analyzed: 'di bdag po'i yin pa ni bdag po'i'o //
translated: The first is a dominant result of the second.

original: 'dir nges par gzung ba gnyis ka yang nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nges par gzung ba gnyis ka yang nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, both definite holdings should be definite holdings.

original: 'di ltar byed rgyu'i rgyu 'ga' zhig la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed rgyu'i rgyu 'ga' zhig la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yod la /
translated: Thus, for some causes of the active cause, there is also a result of conscious effort.

original: gzhan dag la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But for others, there is no dominant result.

original: de lta na ni 'o na bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya ba'i ngag 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya ba'i ngag 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that the statement, ‚ÄúThe first is a dominant result,‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag po'i 'bras bu ltar thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa ma yin na //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag po'i 'bras bu ltar thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa ma yin na //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.

original: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pa gang yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pa gang yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu las skyes pa'i dngos po yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang ngo //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu las skyes pa'i dngos po yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.

original: 'dis ni 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa byed rgyu byed pa po dang btang snyoms pa dang rnam pa gnyis ka la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod do zhes bya bar shes par bya bar 'gyur te /üîΩde skad du /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa byed rgyu byed pa po dang btang snyoms pa dang rnam pa gnyis ka la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod do zhes bya bar shes par bya bar 'gyur te / de skad du /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.

original: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //üîΩ'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni // 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the cause of the non-obstruction of that‚Äù means that it is the cause of the non-obstruction of that.

original: zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad do //

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod dgur mi 'jug pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis skyed pa yin yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te /üîΩrnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir la //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod dgur mi 'jug pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis skyed pa yin yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te / rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir la //
translated: The world receptacle is not a ripened effect because it is not generated by a specific action of sentient beings.üîΩThe world receptacle is not a ripened effect because it is not generated by a specific action of sentient beings.

original: sems can brjod ces @295b mtshan nyid byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can brjod ces @295b mtshan nyid byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world receptacle is not a ripened effect because it is not generated by a specific action of sentient beings.üîΩThe world receptacle is not a ripened effect because it is not generated by a specific action

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mi srid pa las ni byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mi srid pa las ni byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin no //
translated: The other causes are only active causes.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same method should be applied to the other causes.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi dge ba rnams ni bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //üîΩskal mnyam kun tu 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi dge ba rnams ni bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o // skal mnyam kun tu 'gro ba yi //
translated: The ripened effect of wholesome factors is agreeable experience; the ripened effect of unwholesome factors is disagreeable experience.

original: zhes bya ba la rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The effect of universal dominance is the effect of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩThe effect of universal dominance is the effect of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩThe effect of universal dominance is the effect of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun 'gro bdag kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi rgyu mthun pa kho na ni ma yin te /üîΩskyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gi yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskyes bu ba ni gnyis kyi yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun 'gro bdag kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi rgyu mthun pa kho na ni ma yin te / skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gi yin pa'i phyir ro // skyes bu ba ni gnyis kyi yin //
translated: The effect of universal dominance is the effect of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of two causes.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of two causes.

original: zhes bya ba la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na gnyis kyi yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na gnyis kyi yin te /
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of two causes.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho na la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho na la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because coexistent causes and concomitant causes possess activity only in relation to a homogeneous result.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gi der 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gi der 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: They are also dominant results of those causes.

original: de ni byed pa po'i ma yin pa'i yang 'dir brjod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni byed pa po'i ma yin pa'i yang 'dir brjod par mi 'dod do //
translated: But here the dominant result of a nonagent is not intended.üîΩThe term puru·π£akƒÅraphala is a compound word.

original: tshig le'ur byas pas sbyar ba'i phyir skyes bu pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo las mi gzhan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //üîΩskyes bu'i byed pa ni bya ba dang las dang bya rgyu dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba las don gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pas sbyar ba'i phyir skyes bu pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo las mi gzhan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // skyes bu'i byed pa ni bya ba dang las dang bya rgyu dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba las don gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The term puru·π£akƒÅra is explained in the VƒÅrttika as follows:üîΩPuru·π£akƒÅra is not different from action, karma, that which is to be done, and movement.

original: bya ba yang bya ba dang ldan pa dag las gzhan ma yin pas skyes bu nyid skyes bu'i byed pa yin par bshad cing /
analyzed: bya ba yang bya ba dang ldan pa dag las gzhan ma yin pas skyes bu nyid skyes bu'i byed pa yin par bshad cing /
translated: And action is not different from that which possesses action.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu par bshad do //
translated: Therefore puru·π£a itself is explained to be puru·π£akƒÅra and its result is puru·π£akƒÅraphala.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med pas skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med pas skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: If there is no person who is the inner agent, what is this so-called personal activity?

original: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'o //
translated: The activity of any dharma is its personal activity.

original: gal te de lta na chos kyi byed pa zhes brjod par bya'i skyes bu byed pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na chos kyi byed pa zhes brjod par bya'i skyes bu byed pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, it should be called the activity of a dharma, not the activity of a person.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa la skyes bu byed pa zhes grags pas de'i phyir 'dir yang skyes bu'i byed pa ni skyes bu'i byed pa dang 'dra bas skyes bu'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa la skyes bu byed pa zhes grags pas de'i phyir 'dir yang skyes bu'i byed pa ni skyes bu'i byed pa dang 'dra bas skyes bu'i byed pa'o //
translated: Personal activity is called personal activity because it is like the activity of a person who is known in the world.

original: phyi rol tu yongs su brtags pa'i skyes bu dper byas nas skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi rol tu yongs su brtags pa'i skyes bu dper byas nas skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The term personal activity is used as an analogy for an external imagined person,

original: dper na bya rog gi rkang pa dang 'dra ba la bya rog rkang dang / glang po che myos pa dang 'dra ba la glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bya rog gi rkang pa dang 'dra ba la bya rog rkang dang / glang po che myos pa dang 'dra ba la glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as crow‚Äôs feet and an intoxicated elephant are used as analogies.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: @296a * // skyes bu'i byed pa ni nus pa pa'i chos te /
analyzed: @296a * // skyes bu'i byed pa ni nus pa pa'i chos te /
translated: The activity of a person is the quality of potentiality.

original: byed pa gang yin pa'i skyes bu'i byed par sems so zhes zar ro //
analyzed: byed pa gang yin pa'i skyes bu'i byed par sems so zhes zar ro //
translated: Whatever is an activity is the activity of a person.

original: des ni skyes bu byed pa ni 'bras bu 'phen pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni skyes bu byed pa ni 'bras bu 'phen pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the activity of a person is the projection of a result.

original: de ltar na bar ma chad du skye ba dang dus gzhan du skye ba la yang skyes bu byed pa rung la /
analyzed: de ltar na bar ma chad du skye ba dang dus gzhan du skye ba la yang skyes bu byed pa rung la /
translated: Thus, the activity of a person is possible in the case of a result that arises without a break or in the case of a result that arises at another time,

original: lhan cig skye ba la ni ma yin no //üîΩlhan cig skye ba la thams cad gcig pa'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba la ni ma yin no // lhan cig skye ba la thams cad gcig pa'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: but not in the case of a result that arises simultaneously.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'bras bus rang bzhin mi skyed pa'i phyir dang ma spangs pa rnams 'bras bu 'phen na 'bras bu du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'bras bus rang bzhin mi skyed pa'i phyir dang ma spangs pa rnams 'bras bu 'phen na 'bras bu du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of a result that arises simultaneously, there is no activity of a person that is a result, because a nature does not produce a nature, and if that which has not been abandoned projects a result, it follows that there would be many results.

original: nus pa'i chos ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i chos ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
translated: The quality of potentiality is the state of being a cause.

original: rgyu'i dngos po'i gnas skabs kho nas 'bras bu 'phen no zhes bya ba 'dis khyad par mtshon par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po'i gnas skabs kho nas 'bras bu 'phen no zhes bya ba 'dis khyad par mtshon par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The state of being a cause is the projection of a result. This does not indicate a distinction.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga la yang thal bar 'gyur pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga la yang thal bar 'gyur pa mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, the consequence is the same for both.

original: ci gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Do they exist for others as well?

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu'i rnams la yang yod dam /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu'i rnams la yang yod dam /
translated: Do they exist for homogeneous, omnipresent, or maturational causes, or for enabling causes?

original: 'on te lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gnyis kho na'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gnyis kho na'i yin zhe na /
translated: Or do they exist only for coemergent and concomitant causes?

original: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: They exist for others as well.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa dag la yang ste /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa dag la yang ste /
translated: They exist for homogeneous causes and so on.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Homogeneous causes and omnipresent causes have an effect that arises immediately after them, which is the effect of conscious effort. They do not have a natural outflow effect.

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag kho na'i yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag kho na'i yin par brjod ce na /
translated: Why are the effects of conscious effort said to be the effects of coemergent and concomitant causes?

original: lhan cig dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba de ni de gnyis kho na'i yin gyi snga ma dag gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba de ni de gnyis kho na'i yin gyi snga ma dag gi ni ma yin te /
translated: Coemergent and immediately preceding causes are only the former two, not the latter two.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa rgyu dang 'dra ba dag tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa rgyu dang 'dra ba dag tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The result of natural outflow is established as similar to its cause.üîΩThe result of conscious effort is established as dissimilar to its cause.

original: rgyu mthun pa dang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gis ni 'dra ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa ni cig shos skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dag gi yin pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gis ni 'dra ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa ni cig shos skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dag gi yin pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the result of the homogeneous, dominant, and omnipresent causes.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thams cad la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thams cad la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The result of conscious effort is not the result of the homogeneous cause that immediately precedes it,

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ka ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag la ni gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ka ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag la ni gdon mi za'o //
translated: because the final moment of the arhat‚Äôs mind is untenable.üîΩThe result of conscious effort is definitely the result of coemergent and concomitant causes.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang kha cig la skyes bu byed pa'i @296b 'dras bu yod kyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang kha cig la skyes bu byed pa'i @296b 'dras bu yod kyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: The result of conscious effort is not the result of the active cause in all cases.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúwith the exception of the cause of karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'am de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'am de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin na /
translated: The dominant result is either simultaneous with or arises immediately after the activity of a being.

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The result of karmic maturation is not like that.

original: de ni rgyud la bltos pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni rgyud la bltos pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is dependent on a continuum,

original: de ma thag pa'am dus gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'am dus gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not simultaneous or immediately subsequent.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: de la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúwith the exception of the cause of karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhing la sogs pa'i bya ba mtshungs shing 'byor par mtshungs pa la kha cig la 'bru la sogs pa 'byor par gyur la kha cig gis ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhing la sogs pa'i bya ba mtshungs shing 'byor par mtshungs pa la kha cig la 'bru la sogs pa 'byor par gyur la kha cig gis ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the case of a field, etc., the activity is similar and the resources are similar, but some people obtain a harvest of grain, etc., and some do not.

original: gang zhig rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na de sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pa las ma yin zhes dper brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na de sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pa las ma yin zhes dper brjod do //
translated: Those who do not assert that the result of conscious effort is a result of karmic maturation give the following example: ‚ÄúIt is not from the impetus of a previous action.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, the effect of the dominant condition is not only coexistent and immediately preceding causes,

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'i skal ba yang yod pa yin no ;
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'i skal ba yang yod pa yin no ;
translated: but also the effect of the human action.

original: / de la dper brjod pa 'di la rnam par dpyad pa med do //
analyzed: / de la dper brjod pa 'di la rnam par dpyad pa med do //
translated: In this example, there is no analysis.

original: skal pa mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams kyis de ma thag tu skye ba skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur gsungs so //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams kyis de ma thag tu skye ba skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur gsungs so //
translated: The homogeneous cause and the universal cause are said to be the effect of the human action that arises immediately.

original: de nyid gcig pu skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ma yin gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bur yang rung ngo ;
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ma yin gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bur yang rung ngo ;
