translated: That is not only the effect of the human action, but also the effect of natural outcome and the effect of dominance.

original: / ji ltar de rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med pa de ltar skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'am bdag po'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: / ji ltar de rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med pa de ltar skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'am bdag po'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Just as it is the effect of natural outcome, it is also the effect of the human action and the effect of dominance.

original: de bzhin du cig shos la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du cig shos la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the other.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang de'i stobs kyis bskyed ba'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang de bskyed pa la gegs med pa'i ngo bor gnas pas bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste 'chol ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang de'i stobs kyis bskyed ba'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang de bskyed pa la gegs med pa'i ngo bor gnas pas bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste 'chol ba med do //
translated: The result that is similar to its cause is called the result of natural outflow because it is similar to its cause. The result that is produced by the power of that cause is called the result of conscious effort because it is generated by the power of that cause. The result that is the state of nondisruption of that cause is called the dominant result because it is the state of nondisruption of that cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa bshad zin to /
translated: The certainty of cause and result has been explained.

original: // / da ni 'bras bu rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: // / da ni 'bras bu rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the results should be stated.

original: de'i phyir rnam bar smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam bar smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is a ripened result?‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ripened result is a neutral phenomenon.

original: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin zhing /
translated: The ripened result is only a neutral phenomenon.

original: sems can du brjod pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa kho na sems can du brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can du brjod pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa kho na sems can du brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is definitely stated that it is only a sentient being, but it is not stated that only the ripened result is a sentient being.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir lung @297a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir lung @297a * //
translated: Therefore, in order to exclude that which arises from natural outflow and that which arises from enhancement, he says:

original: bstan phyis 'byung zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bstan phyis 'byung zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúsubsequent to declaration.‚Äù

original: lung bstan pa'i phyi nas 'byung bas na lung bstan phyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i phyi nas 'byung bas na lung bstan phyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises subsequent to declaration is subsequent to declaration.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin bar lta ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin bar lta ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He says ‚Äúundisclosed‚Äù in order to exclude the afflicted view of the self and the extreme view,

original: lta ba de gnyis ni sems can du ston pa dang / lung bstan phyis 'byung ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: lta ba de gnyis ni sems can du ston pa dang / lung bstan phyis 'byung ma yin mod kyi /
translated: because those two views are disclosed, and they are not subsequent to declaration.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin la rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin la rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not disclosed, but they are not subsequent to declaration, nor are they karmic maturation.

original: de lta na ni 'o na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rgyu can yang lung du bstan pa'i phyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rgyu can yang lung du bstan pa'i phyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang /
translated: If that were so, then the special meditative attainment of the special absorption that increases the great elements of the sense faculties would be a later element that is declared because it is a cause that arises later and it is unobscured neutral because it is not obstructed.üîΩ

original: sems can du brjod pa'i phyir rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can du brjod pa'i phyir rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then the special meditative attainment of the special absorption that increases the great elements of the sense faculties would be karmic maturation because it is a later arising that is the cause of the special absorption, it is unobscured neutral and it is called a sentient being.

original: de lta na rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dres par 'gyur ro zhe na 'dres pa med de /
analyzed: de lta na rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dres par 'gyur ro zhe na 'dres pa med de /
translated: If that is so, then the classifications of karmic maturation and enhancement would be mixed.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni sa tha dad pa nyid dam dus gcig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni sa tha dad pa nyid dam dus gcig pa ma yin na /
translated: There is no mixing because the cause and effect of karmic maturation are not on different levels or simultaneous.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa dang / bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa dag ni dus gcig pa dang sa tha dad pa nyid yin pas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las rnam par smin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba med mod ;
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa dang / bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa dag ni dus gcig pa dang sa tha dad pa nyid yin pas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las rnam par smin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba med mod ;
translated: and those who enter meditative attainment on special absorption have different levels, so it is not the case that the great elements that increase the faculties are necessarily karmic maturation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig de las dus phyi ma las 'byung zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig de las dus phyi ma las 'byung zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore the root text says, ‚ÄúThat which arises later from that is not its equivalent immediately preceding condition.‚Äù

original: de dang lhan cig tu ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta na 'o na sprul pa'i sems la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu ni ma yin no // de lta na 'o na sprul pa'i sems la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It does not arise simultaneously with it.

original: de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba las 'byung zhing /
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that the mind of emanation is also not an equivalent immediately preceding condition because it arises from a virtuous mind of meditative attainment.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang sems can du brjod pa yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang sems can du brjod pa yang yin no zhe na /
translated: It is unobscured neutral mind and it is also called a sentient being.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag tu ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag tu ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore the root text says, ‚ÄúIt is not its equivalent immediately preceding condition.‚Äù

original: de ma thag pa ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is drawn by the power of the equivalent immediately preceding condition, it is an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: sprul pa'i sems kyang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis de ma thag tu 'byung na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems kyang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis de ma thag tu 'byung na /
translated: Also, the mind of emanation arises immediately after the mind of meditative attainment.

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: But karmic maturation is not like that.

original: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Why is the meaning of ‚Äúnot revealing sentient beings‚Äù called ‚Äúnot revealing sentient beings‚Äù?

original: las las skyes pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du sems can du ston pa kho na rnam par smin pa yin la /
analyzed: las las skyes pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du sems can du ston pa kho na rnam par smin pa yin la /
translated: Although it is similar in being produced from karma, only that which reveals sentient beings is karmic maturation.

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: Why is it not that which does not reveal sentient beings?

original: de'i phyir thun mong @297b pa ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong @297b pa ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúbecause it is not shared,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Karmic maturation is not shared.

original: rgyud gang la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yod pa de kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar gzhan gyis myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gang la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yod pa de kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar gzhan gyis myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises only in the mindstream in which the cause of karmic maturation exists, it is not experienced by another, like that.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that another experiences the karmic maturation of karma committed by another.

original: de lta na ni ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud zos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud zos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, one would encounter the results of karma not committed and one's own karma would be wasted.üîΩWhy does one experience the dominant result of karma not committed by sentient beings?

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir myong zhe na thun mong gi las las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir myong zhe na thun mong gi las las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises from common karma.

original: de myangs na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud zos pa med do ;
analyzed: de myangs na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud zos pa med do ;
translated: If one experiences that, one does not encounter the results of karma not committed and one's own karma is not wasted.

original: / rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩre zhig skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu rgyu dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan par 'dra ba ni ris dang rang gis 'dra ba bltos pa yin pa gzung la /
analyzed: / rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o // zhes bya ba la / re zhig skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu rgyu dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan par 'dra ba ni ris dang rang gis 'dra ba bltos pa yin pa gzung la /
translated: Natural outflow is similar to its cause.üîΩThe result of natural outflow ni·π£yandaphala is similar to its cause.üîΩThe result of natural outflow of a virtuous or nonvirtuous or neutral cause is similar to its cause.üîΩThe result of natural outflow of a contaminated state is similar to its cause.

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dang skal ba mnyam pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dang skal ba mnyam pa yang ngo //
translated: The result of natural outflow of a contaminated state is similar to its cause.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu las ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu las ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the effect of natural outflow also an effect of uniform outflow?

original: gang gi phyir 'dra bar yod pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dra bar yod pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The effect of uniform outflow is similar to its cause.

original: rgyu gang yin pa dang mi 'dra ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa dang mi 'dra ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not similar to its cause.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'dras bu yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'dras bu yang de bzhin te /
translated: The effect of natural outflow is also like that.

original: 'di la skyon med pas mi 'dra ba yod pa ma yin yang rgyu mthun pa ni rang gi ris kyi nyon mongs pa can 'jug pa mtshungs pas 'di la mi 'dra ba skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur brjod do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: 'di la skyon med pas mi 'dra ba yod pa ma yin yang rgyu mthun pa ni rang gi ris kyi nyon mongs pa can 'jug pa mtshungs pas 'di la mi 'dra ba skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur brjod do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: There is no error here, for although there is nothing dissimilar to its cause, the effect of natural outflow is said to be dissimilar to its cause, since it is the homogeneous cause of afflicted states of its own level.

original: rang gi rdzas 'dra ba yang med de lhan cig skyes pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas 'dra ba yang med de lhan cig skyes pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of natural outflow is not similar to its cause in terms of substance, but it is similar in terms of its type.

original: de la tshor ba las tshor ba nyid 'bras bur rung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la tshor ba las tshor ba nyid 'bras bur rung ba yin te /
translated: For example, feeling is the effect of natural outflow of feeling, since it is suitable to be the effect of feeling.

original: rang gi rdzas 'dra ba yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes de nyid rgyu dang 'dra bar brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas 'dra ba yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes de nyid rgyu dang 'dra bar brjod do //
translated: The effect of natural outflow is similar to its cause in terms of substance, but it is said to be similar to its cause in terms of type.

original: 'di ltar de ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is similar to its cause in terms of realm and afflicted state.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rgyu'i nyon mongs pa can kho na yin no //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rnam pa las kyang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rgyu'i nyon mongs pa can kho na yin no // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rnam pa las kyang ni ma yin te /
translated: The result of the omnipresent cause that operates in the desire realm is only the afflicted cause that operates in the desire realm.

original: rnam pa lnga char yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa las kyang 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga char yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa las kyang 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is not similar to its cause in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is similar to its result in terms of realm, level, and afflicted state, and it is also similar to its result in terms of aspect.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.

original: de la kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhig sa dang nyon mongs pa can las yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /üîΩrnam pa las kyang 'dras bu dang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam @298a * //
analyzed: de la kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhig sa dang nyon mongs pa can las yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / rnam pa las kyang 'dras bu dang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam @298a * //
translated: The omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five aspects.

original: pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The omnipresent cause is not similar to its result in terms of aspect, because it is a cause of all five

original: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na'o //
translated: The non-pervasive is the homogeneous cause alone.

original: ris gzhan pa'i kun tu 'gro ba ni kun tu 'gro ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ris gzhan pa'i kun tu 'gro ba ni kun tu 'gro ba kho na'o //
translated: The pervasive of another class is the pervasive cause alone.

original: gnyis ka yin pa ni rang gi ris pa'i kun tu 'gro ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yin pa ni rang gi ris pa'i kun tu 'gro ba kho na'o //
translated: The one that is both is the pervasive of its own class.

original: de ltar na mu gsum pa la bsams nas /
analyzed: de ltar na mu gsum pa la bsams nas /
translated: Thus, considering the three alternatives,

original: gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said that that which is similar in type is accepted as the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe fourth is that which does not include those aspects.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum du bshad pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don te ;
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum du bshad pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don te ;
translated: The meaning is that it does not include the phenomena explained in the three alternatives.

original: / gang gi tshe dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyang mjug thogs su mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skye ba ni snga ma de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'am kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: / gang gi tshe dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyang mjug thogs su mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skye ba ni snga ma de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'am kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: When dissimilar characteristics arise immediately after the wholesome and so on, the former is not the homogeneous cause or pervasive cause of the latter.

original: bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
translated: The attainment of separation is the exhaustion by the mind.

original: thob ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: thob ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The attainment is the remainder of the words.

original: 'gog pa smos pa ni ma thob pa tsam bral ba nyid yin pa dgag par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa smos pa ni ma thob pa tsam bral ba nyid yin pa dgag par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mention of cessation is for the purpose of refuting the mere non-acquisition of that which is to be abandoned.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs brjod pa ste /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs brjod pa ste /
translated: Thus indicates the reason.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa shes rab kyis thob par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa shes rab kyis thob par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because cessation is to be attained by wisdom, therefore it is said that cessation is the result of disjunction, which is analytical cessation.

original: gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i 'bras bu skyes bu byed las skyes zhes bya ba la rgyu gang gi stobs kyis 'bras bu gang zhig skye ba de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i 'bras bu skyes bu byed las skyes zhes bya ba la rgyu gang gi stobs kyis 'bras bu gang zhig skye ba de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of conscious effort is that which arises by the power of which it arises.

original: dper na sa 'og ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na sa 'og ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, the higher perception of the divine eye and so on.

original: 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag sa tha dad pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag sa tha dad pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the cause and result are different levels, because they are contaminated and uncontaminated, and because they are virtuous and neutral.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
translated: It is a result of conscious effort alone, not a result that resembles its cause.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'dra ba dang rang gis pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'dra ba dang rang gis pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that it is similar to its cause and is a natural result.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan yang bsdu ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include other examples.

original: dper na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa las gzugs na spyod pa'i srid pa bar mdo'i skad cig ma dang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa las gzugs na spyod pa'i srid pa bar mdo'i skad cig ma dang po lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the first moment of the intermediate existence of the form realm arises from a virtuous or neutral mind at death in the desire realm.

original: skyes bu byed pas thob pa'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pas thob pa'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The result of conscious effort is the result of conscious effort.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis thob pas de yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na'o zhes @298b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis thob pas de yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na'o zhes @298b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the cessation resulting from deliberation is obtained by the power of deliberation, it is also a result of conscious effort alone.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cessation resulting from deliberation is a result of conscious effort.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhir sems par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhir sems par byed de /
translated: Others think that the result of conscious effort is of four types.

original: lhan cig pa dang bar ma chad pa dang / dus gzhan du skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhan cig pa dang bar ma chad pa dang / dus gzhan du skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams so //
translated: simultaneous, uninterrupted, arisen at another time, and not arisen.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni gang dag la cig car phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skyes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni gang dag la cig car phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skyes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Simultaneous arising is, for example, the simultaneous arising of two thoughts of the same type, or the simultaneous arising of thought and thoughtconcomitants.

original: bar ma chad skyes pa ni dper na 'jig rten chos mchog pa rnams la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa lta bu'o //üîΩdus gzhan du skyes pa ni /
analyzed: bar ma chad skyes pa ni dper na 'jig rten chos mchog pa rnams la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa lta bu'o // dus gzhan du skyes pa ni /
translated: Uninterrupted arising is, for example, the arising of the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness in the path of insight, immediately after the supreme mundane factors.

original: dper na zhing ba rnams kyi zhing las lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zhing ba rnams kyi zhing las lta bu'o //
translated: Arising at another time is, for example, the arising of the harvest at another time than the seed.

original: ma skyes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Not arisen is nirvƒÅ·πáa, for it does not arise.üîΩThe acquisition of the fruit of the path of insight is simultaneous with the path of insight.üîΩThe acquisition of the fruit of the path of cultivation is simultaneous with the path of cultivation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam de'i stobs kyis de'i thob pa skyes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam de'i stobs kyis de'i thob pa skyes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The acquisition of the fruit of the perfected being is simultaneous with the path of the perfected being.

original: ji ltar na 'dir gzung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dir gzung ba yin /
translated: How can one acquire that which is not arisen?

original: de ni skye ba ma yin no zhe na /üîΩnga'i nor skyes so zhes thob pa la yang skyes pa'i sgra brjod pa mthong ste /
analyzed: de ni skye ba ma yin no zhe na / nga'i nor skyes so zhes thob pa la yang skyes pa'i sgra brjod pa mthong ste /
translated: It is not arisen, but it is acquired.üîΩWe see that the word utpadyate is used with regard to acquisition: ‚ÄúMy wealth is increasing.‚Äù

original: bdag gis nor thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis nor thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: ‚ÄúI am acquiring wealth.‚Äù

original: de la bar chad med pa'i lam gang dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa de dag gis ni spangs pa de bral ba'i 'bras bu yin la /üîΩskyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: de la bar chad med pa'i lam gang dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa de dag gis ni spangs pa de bral ba'i 'bras bu yin la / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: The uninterrupted paths that abandon afflictions are the result of separation prahƒÅ·πáaphala and the result of conscious effort puru·π£akƒÅraphala.

original: gang dag gis sngar spangs pa rnams kyi bral ba'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig thob pa de dag gis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te /üîΩdper na nges pa la 'jug pa na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas phra rgyas bcu po dag spangs pa /
analyzed: gang dag gis sngar spangs pa rnams kyi bral ba'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig thob pa de dag gis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te / dper na nges pa la 'jug pa na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas phra rgyas bcu po dag spangs pa /
translated: Those that obtain the result of separation from previously abandoned objects are the result of conscious effort alone.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i bral ba'i 'bras bu dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i bral ba'i 'bras bu dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: For example, when entering the state of an ƒÅrya, the ten negative tendencies abandoned by the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering are the result of separation and the result of conscious effort for one not yet free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin pa bzhin no //
translated: They are the result of conscious effort alone for one previously freed from attachment.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la ni gdon mi za bar gnyis ka yin pa nas ji srid lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu bzhi po dag spangs pa rnams laüîΩni bral pa dang skyes bu byed ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la ni gdon mi za bar gnyis ka yin pa nas ji srid lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu bzhi po dag spangs pa rnams la ni bral pa dang skyes bu byed ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: So too, for the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, one definitely possesses both until the abandonment of the fourteen afflictions of the form and formless realms that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni khyad par du skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni khyad par du skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na ste /
translated: The result of separation and the result of conscious effort are results of the path of seeing.

original: de'i stobs kyis thob pa gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis thob pa gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of conscious effort is especially strong because other results are obtained through its power.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //üîΩsngon byung ba ma yin pa'i 'dus byas kho na 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras bu yin gyi 'dus ma byas ma yin zhing 'dus ma @299a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o // sngon byung ba ma yin pa'i 'dus byas kho na 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras bu yin gyi 'dus ma byas ma yin zhing 'dus ma @299a * //
translated: So too, the results of the path of meditation should be described as appropriate.üîΩOnly conditioned states that are not past are dominant results of conditioned states, not unconditioned states.

original: byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes ngas par gzung ste bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes ngas par gzung ste bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not definite that only conditioned states are dominant results of conditioned states.

original: sngon byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba las gzhan sngon ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba las gzhan sngon ma byung ba'o //
translated: That which is not past is other than that which is past.

original: de ni lhan cig byung ba dang phyis byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ni lhan cig byung ba dang phyis byung ba ste /
translated: It is simultaneous and subsequent.

original: rgyu bas sngar skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rgyu bas sngar skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is no effect whatsoever that is produced earlier than its cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'bras bu skyes pa'i ma 'ongs pa med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'bras bu skyes pa'i ma 'ongs pa med do //
translated: Why? Because the future does not exist when the effect is produced.

original: bya ba byis zin pas mi skye bar yang 'gyur ro //üîΩma skyes par yang 'jig pa med pas skye 'jig dang bral ba'i phyir 'du byed mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba byis zin pas mi skye bar yang 'gyur ro // ma skyes par yang 'jig pa med pas skye 'jig dang bral ba'i phyir 'du byed mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the activity of the cause would be without effect, it would not produce.üîΩAnd because that which is not produced does not perish, conditioned factors would be without origination and destruction, and it would follow that conditioned factors are permanent.

original: gal te mi skye ba'i chos can bzhin no zhe nam yin te de'i rigs can gyi skye ba dang 'jig pa mthong bas de ni mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs te thams cad las ches snga bar 'das pa'i byed rgyu las 'das pa dang da ltar ba dang
analyzed: gal te mi skye ba'i chos can bzhin no zhe nam yin te de'i rigs can gyi skye ba dang 'jig pa mthong bas de ni mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs te thams cad las ches snga bar 'das pa'i byed rgyu las 'das pa dang da ltar ba dang
translated: If you say that it is like that which is not produced, no, because origination and destruction are seen in that which is of its type. Therefore, it is understood that it is impermanent.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu dang da ltar ba'i ma 'ongs pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ma 'ongs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu dang da ltar ba'i ma 'ongs pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ma 'ongs pa kho na'o //
translated: The future is the effect of dominance of the present, and it is the future of the future.

original: yang na thams cad las zhes bya ba bskyed pa la gegs med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad las zhes bya ba bskyed pa la gegs med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
translated: Or else, all refers to the state of being an absence of obstruction to the generation of an effect.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the difference between the effect of a human action and the effect of dominance?

original: de nyid de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
translated: This question is asked because the effect of dominance is established as the effect of a human action.

original: byed pa po dang zab po'i dngos po las dper na zhing pa rnams kyi lo tog la sogs pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang zab po'i dngos po las dper na zhing pa rnams kyi lo tog la sogs pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a crop is the effect of a human action and the effect of dominance for farmers.

original: de'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin te /
translated: It is the effect of dominance because it is generated by their power.

original: de nye bar longs spyad pa'i zab po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye bar longs spyad pa'i zab po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the effect of a human action because it is the nature of the object that is enjoyed by them.

original: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
analyzed: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
translated: The conditioned that is not prior is the effect of human action.

original: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: The dominant result is only of conditioned states.

original: zhes so // gang dag nye bar longs spyod pa tsam yin pa de dag gi ni bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // gang dag nye bar longs spyod pa tsam yin pa de dag gi ni bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin no //
translated: Those that are merely enjoyed are the dominant result.

original: de bzhin du bzo la sogs pa la yang bzo bo rnams dang gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzo la sogs pa la yang bzo bo rnams dang gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the crafts and so on are the dominant result of the craftsperson and so on.

original: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five possess results in the present.

original: da lta kho na nges par gzung gi lnga po kho na zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da lta kho na nges par gzung gi lnga po kho na zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The present alone is ascertained, but not only the five.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe efficient cause is also similar to that.‚Äù

original: /'bras bu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'phen pa ste /
analyzed: /'bras bu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'phen pa ste /
translated: Possessing results means projecting results.

original: ma 'ongs pa na bskyed pa'i phyir ris mthun pa'i rdzas kyi sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro bas ris tha dad pa 'bras bu gcig pa dang skal ba mnyam pa 'bras bu dum dang kha cig skal ba mnyam pa ma yin pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na bskyed pa'i phyir ris mthun pa'i rdzas kyi sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro bas ris tha dad pa 'bras bu gcig pa dang skal ba mnyam pa 'bras bu dum dang kha cig skal ba mnyam pa ma yin pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: Because it generates in the future, it becomes the seed of the substance of the same type, and it is the single result of different types, the multiple results of similar types, and the results of dissimilar types.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi spyi'i @299b ni de nyid da ltar byung ba nyid da ltar byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi spyi'i @299b ni de nyid da ltar byung ba nyid da ltar byung ba nyid do //
translated: The present of its own continuum is the present of that very continuum.

original: 'di ni 'dus byas rnams kho na'i byad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas rnams kho na'i byad pa'o //
translated: This is the characteristic of conditioned factors alone.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba kho na 'bras bu 'dzin zhes bya ba smos te 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba kho na 'bras bu 'dzin zhes bya ba smos te 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The efficient cause is similar to that, but it is said that only the present one holds its effect, because unconditioned factors have no effect.

original: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed ces bya ba la /
translated: Two causes give rise to it.

original: da ltar ba dag kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya ste gnyis kho na zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba dag kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya ste gnyis kho na zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: Only the present ones should be ascertained, but not that only two.

original: dus mnyam pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la rgyu'i dngos po'i dus kho nar 'bras bu phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la rgyu'i dngos po'i dus kho nar 'bras bu phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are simultaneous, because the effect is given rise to at the very time of the cause.

original: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The present and the past give rise to it.

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: Since this is the topic, the phrase ‚Äúgive rise to it‚Äù should be supplied.

original: / da ltar bdag rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do snyam du ste /
analyzed: / da ltar bdag rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do snyam du ste /
translated: I do not think that the effect of the homogeneous cause is possible now.

original: re zhig gang 'das pa dag ni zhes dri ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: re zhig gang 'das pa dag ni zhes dri ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The question is asked in detail: ‚ÄúWhat is the effect of what cause?‚Äù

original: mjug thogs su bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mjug thogs su bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The answer is given: ‚ÄúThe effect of the past cause that has arisen and ceased.

original: de la 'bras bu gang zhig skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi yin par nges shing de dag gi mjug thogs su skye ba de ni de dag gis 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gang zhig skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi yin par nges shing de dag gi mjug thogs su skye ba de ni de dag gis 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äù The effect that is determined as being the effect of the homogeneous cause and the universal cause, and that arises immediately after them, is held and projected by them.

original: rgyu dag 'gags na ni gzung ba dang phyung zin pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu dag 'gags na ni gzung ba dang phyung zin pa yin na /
translated: When the causes have ceased, the effect is held and projected.

original: de nyid kyi tshe ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not at that time;

original: 'o na ci zhe na phyis kyang phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na phyis kyang phyung ba yin no //
translated: rather, it is later that it is projected.

original: mi 'byin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'byin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not projected.

original: 'on te 'gags pa dag las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu skye na ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'gags pa dag las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu skye na ni /
translated: If the effect of the homogeneous cause arises from the ceased causes,

original: de lta na 'das pa dag gis 'bras bu phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'das pa dag gis 'bras bu phyung ba yin no //
translated: then the effect is projected by the past causes.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The efficient cause should also be mentioned.

original: cung zad cig ni byed rgyu da ltar byung ba'i yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni byed rgyu da ltar byung ba'i yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Some are dominant results of the present cause of the present.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, eye consciousness.

original: cung zad cig na ni de ma thag tu yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig na ni de ma thag tu yin te /
translated: Some are dominant results of the immediately past cause of the present.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering of the supreme mundane state.

original: cung zad cig ni dus gzhan gyi tshe yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni dus gzhan gyi tshe yin te /
translated: Some are dominant results of the cause of the present in another life.

original: dper na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi byang chub gsum lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi byang chub gsum lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: For example, the three kinds of enlightenment of the roots of virtue that are compatible with liberation.

original: 'di ma smos pa'i rgyu sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ma smos pa'i rgyu sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The reason for not mentioning these is as previously explained.

original: dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúA virtuous homogeneous cause is a cause of similar status.‚Äù

original: mi ldan pa la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is asserted that nonpossession is a homogeneous cause.üîΩSince it is stated that it is concomitant, it is concomitant with the mind.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas mtshungs par ldan pa smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas mtshungs par ldan pa smos pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is stated that it has an object, it is concomitant with the mind.

original: thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since it is stated that it is relinquished at the end of all, it is relinquished at the end of all.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu'i chung ngu rnams kyis thob pa thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba dag ste gzhan dag ni sngar dor zin pa'i @300a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu'i chung ngu rnams kyis thob pa thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba dag ste gzhan dag ni sngar dor zin pa'i @300a * //
translated: Others have already relinquished them previously.

original: phyir ro // de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi 'byin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi 'byin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They only maintain their result, they do not project it,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa'i gnas skabs na dge ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa'i gnas skabs na dge ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the roots of virtue are severed, virtue does not arise.

original: gnyis pa ni dge ba'i rtsa bdag gis nyid mtshams sbyor bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge ba'i rtsa bdag gis nyid mtshams sbyor bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is those who reconnect through roots of virtue.

original: 'byin pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byin pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They only project their result, they do not maintain it, because they have already maintained it previously.

original: 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: thams cad kyi dang por rnyed pa da ltar byung ba de ni nges par 'dzin kyang sa do sha tv'atstshi ksha ya ti /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dang por rnyed pa da ltar byung ba de ni nges par 'dzin kyang sa do sha tv'atstshi ksha ya ti /
translated: Those who obtain the first of all, they definitely maintain it.

original: de nyid nying mtshams sbyar ba'i snga rol tu bzung zin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nying mtshams sbyar ba'i snga rol tu bzung zin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But they do not maintain it prior to reconnecting, because they have already maintained it.

original: chos rags pas da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu lnga zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rags pas da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu lnga zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThe five effects of the present are by the gross.‚Äù

original: des na ma 'khrugs pa'i don du slob par byed do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: des na ma 'khrugs pa'i don du slob par byed do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Thus, others say that the five effects are mentioned in order to show that the effects are not confused.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: snga na med pa rnyed na 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'byin pa srid pa'i phyir de dag nyid ces brjod par bya'o //üîΩgnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gnyis po ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: snga na med pa rnyed na 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'byin pa srid pa'i phyir de dag nyid ces brjod par bya'o // gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gnyis po ma gtogs pa /
translated: If one obtains that which did not previously exist, then it is possible that it would both hold and project its effect, so it should be called both.üîΩIn the remaining states

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams bzung ste /
translated: means in the remaining states of the root of virtue that is not severed, excluding the two states just explained.

original: bdag cag la sogs pa lta bu'i thob pa dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pa lta bu'i thob pa dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin no //
translated: Obtainment of the root of virtue that is not severed, such as that of ourselves and so on, both holds and projects its effect.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is excluded from those types.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa'i gnas skabs ni sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa'i gnas skabs ni sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: The state of severing the root of virtue is not holding because it was previously obtained.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //üîΩmi dge ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no // mi dge ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not an issuing cause because it does not link with the root of virtue.üîΩNonvirtuous means

original: mi dge ba rnams kyi tha mar 'dor ba ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams kyi tha mar 'dor ba ste /
translated: at the end of nonvirtue.

original: thob pa de dag ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: thob pa de dag ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Obtainment of nonvirtue is only an upholding cause,

original: 'byin pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'byin pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: it is not an issuing cause.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no homogeneous result immediately after it.

original: thams cad kyi dang por thob pa'i mi dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu 'byin pa yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dang por thob pa'i mi dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu 'byin pa yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The nonvirtuous homogeneous cause that is obtained first of all is an issuing cause, but it is not an upholding cause.

original: sngar bzung zin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bzung zin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was previously obtained.

original: 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states,

original: mi dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'byin pa yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'byin pa yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the nonvirtuous homogeneous cause that is an issuing cause, but it is not an upholding cause.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obtained at the time of freedom from attachment.

original: thob pa gang dag sngon med pa dang por rnyed pa de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa gang dag sngon med pa dang por rnyed pa de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Those that are obtained for the first time that were not previously obtained are neither the obtainment of the result nor the relinquishment of the result.

original: 'di la yang slob dpon 'dus bzang gi rnam par bshad pa ni sgro btags pa yin @300b pas de dgag pa la 'bad pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang slob dpon 'dus bzang gi rnam par bshad pa ni sgro btags pa yin @300b pas de dgag pa la 'bad pa mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the explanation of Master Sa·πÖghabhadra is a superimposition, so one should not make an effort to refute it.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those types.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs ni sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs ni sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin la /
translated: The state of being free from attachment to the desire realm is not the obtainment of the result because it was obtained previously.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i las nyams pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i las nyams pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not the relinquishment of the result because it degenerates from the karma of being free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Obtained from the desire realm to the summit of existence is also like that.üîΩIn response to the question, there are four possibilities.

original: dri ba la mu bzhi dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri ba la mu bzhi dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Obtaining the state of an arhat and fully degenerating are to be applied as appropriate.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod pas 'dzin pa yin la mi 'byin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod pas 'dzin pa yin la mi 'byin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that obscured neutral states are both held by and do not issue forth their result because they are homogeneous causes of obscured neutral states.

original: mu bzhi pa rgyas par brjod de /üîΩmu dang po ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa ldan pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa rgyas par brjod de / mu dang po ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa ldan pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The four possibilities are extensively expressed.üîΩThe first possibility is the obtainment of all states that are discarded at the end through obtaining freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: gnyis pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas thams cad kyi dang por thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas thams cad kyi dang por thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The second possibility is the obtainment of all states that are obtained at the beginning through complete degeneration from freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: gsum pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
translated: The third possibility is all states in the remaining instances of freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth possibility is states that are not included in those mentioned above.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means states that are not discarded at the end through degeneration from freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúobscured neutral‚Äù should be applied to the afflictions that are abandoned by the path of cultivation in the form realm and the formless realm.

original: re zhig 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is an issuing cause is also an appropriating cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the unobscured neutral homogeneous cause exists until the state of nirvana.

original: 'dzin la mi 'byin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dzin la mi 'byin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is appropriating cause that is not an issuing cause.

original: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tham rnams yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tham rnams yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The aggregates of an arhat are the final aggregates.

original: de'i tshe ni phung po thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med pas 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni phung po thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med pas 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the homogeneous cause is only an appropriating cause, not an issuing cause, because the homogeneous result does not exist since all aggregates are relinquished.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas ni skad cig re re ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas ni skad cig re re ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin each moment‚Äù is stated from the perspective of having an object.

original: sngar ni dmigs pa med pa thob pa rnams dang / rgyun la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ni dmigs pa med pa thob pa rnams dang / rgyun la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du bshad la /
translated: Previously, it was explained that obtainment of the absence of focal objects is a homogeneous cause of the continuum.

original: de ni dmigs pa dang bcas ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang skad cig re re la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa dang bcas ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang skad cig re re la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod do //
translated: Here, it is said that it is a homogeneous cause of minds and mental factors that possess focal objects in each moment.

original: dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
translated: Immediately after a virtuous mind.

original: @301a * // dge ba'i sems skyes pas dge ba'i sems rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung ba gang yin pa de'i mjug thogs su mi skye bas 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @301a * // dge ba'i sems skyes pas dge ba'i sems rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung ba gang yin pa de'i mjug thogs su mi skye bas 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: A virtuous mind is not generated immediately after a virtuous mind that is the result of natural outflow, therefore it is the result of a cause that is apprehended, but it is not the cause that projects it.üîΩThe second is the opposite.

original: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i dge ba'i sems de 'byin pa kho na yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i dge ba'i sems de 'byin pa kho na yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma
translated: When a virtuous mind manifests immediately after a afflicted or neutral mind, then the virtuous mind that previously ceased is the cause that projects it, but it is not the cause that apprehends it.

original: yin te / sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been taken up previously.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those types.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can nam mi dge ba'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can nam lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa de'i tshe dge ba'i sems kyis des sngar bzung ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can nam mi dge ba'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can nam lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa de'i tshe dge ba'i sems kyis des sngar bzung ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'dzin la /
translated: When a defiled or nonvirtuous mind is immediately followed by a defiled or neutral mind, then a virtuous mind does not take up its result because it has already been taken up by that virtuous mind.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i sems kyis bar du chod pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i sems kyis bar du chod pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it does not project its result because a mind of a different type interrupts it.

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be applied to nonvirtuous minds and so on.

original: mu dang po ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa'i mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa'i mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is when a virtuous or neutral mind manifests immediately after a nonvirtuous mind.

original: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The second is the opposite.

original: gsum pa ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi dge ba kho na skye ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi dge ba kho na skye ba'o //
translated: The third is when a nonvirtuous mind arises immediately after a nonvirtuous mind.

original: bzhi pa ni gang gi tshe dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba 'am /üîΩlung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gang gi tshe dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba 'am / lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Obstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩma bsgribs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi dge ba yang yin te /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // ma bsgribs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi dge ba yang yin te /
translated: Obstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'ba' zhig ma yin no //üîΩgcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /üîΩgcig ni 'das pa kho nas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'ba' zhig ma yin no // gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la / gcig ni 'das pa kho nas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
