original: gcig kho na 'das pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gcig kho na 'das pa ni ma yin te / de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Obstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Obstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩObstructed indeterminate and unobstructed indeterminate minds are similar.üîΩOb

original: 'di ltar lhan cig gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig gam /
translated: In this way, they are either simultaneous or sequential.üîΩ

original: de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, there is no maturation that is simultaneous or immediately subsequent.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rgyun la bltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rgyun la bltos pa yin no //
translated: The cause of maturation is related to a continuum.

original: 'di la brten pas na rten no //
analyzed: 'di la brten pas na rten no //
translated: That which is supported by this is supported.

original: rten gyi 'bras bu ni rten gyi @301b 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rten gyi 'bras bu ni rten gyi @301b 'bras bu ste /
translated: The effect of the support is the effect of the support.

original: gang zhig gang la brten pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la brten pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That which is supported by something is the effect of that.

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The effect of preparation is the effect of preparation.

original: mi sdug pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te mi skye ba shes pa'i bar lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te mi skye ba shes pa'i bar lta bu'o //
translated: For example, from the beginning of the application of mindfulness of the repulsive up to the knowledge of non-arising.

original: sbyor ba gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be applied to other preparations.

original: mi sdug pa smos pa ni 'dir dpe'i don du yin no //üîΩtshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa smos pa ni 'dir dpe'i don du yin no // tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The mention of the repulsive here is for the sake of an example.üîΩThe effect of a collection is the effect of a collection.

original: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of cultivation is the effect of cultivation.

original: de la kha cig na re ni rten gyi 'bras bu bdag po'i 'bras bu'i khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re ni rten gyi 'bras bu bdag po'i 'bras bu'i khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The effect of dominance is included in the effect of human action.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: thams cad kyang skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
translated: All are included in the effect of human action and the effect of dominance.

original: de la chos gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement, ‚ÄúAny dharma that is produced,‚Äù

original: chos mang po dag re re nas rgyas par bshad par mi nus pas thams cad phung po bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos mang po dag re re nas rgyas par bshad par mi nus pas thams cad phung po bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: since it is not possible to explain in detail each of the many dharmas, all are subsumed in the four aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdor bsdu na chos kyi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag kho na yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdor bsdu na chos kyi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag kho na yin te zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúIn brief, there are only these four types of dharmas.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang de dag gi mtshungs par ldan pa dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang de dag gi mtshungs par ldan pa dag gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdefiled‚Äù refers to nonvirtuous and obscured neutral states such as attachment and concomitant states.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: Those born from the cause of karmic maturation are those that have the nature of the result of karmic maturation.

original: zag pa med pa dang po rnams ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang po rnams ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The first uncontaminated states are the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and those concomitant with it.

original: rnam par smin pa ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that are neutral except for those born from the cause of karmic maturation are the remaining neutral states.

original: de dag ni spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de dag ni spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa thams cad do //
translated: They are all the states of deportment, creative arts, and emanations.

original: dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The virtuous states are those that are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it was explained,üîΩthose born from the cause of karmic maturation are excluded.

original: ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye bas na lhag ma las skyes so //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye bas na lhag ma las skyes so //
translated: Those born from the remaining causes are the remaining states.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Those that are afflicted states are those that are afflicted.

original: rnam par smin pa ni chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can rnams bskyed pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can rnams bskyed pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is excluded because the result of karmic maturation is not an afflicted state.üîΩThe coemergent cause is the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is afflicted phenomena of the same type that arose previously.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is omnipresent afflicted phenomena that arose previously.üîΩThe active cause is all phenomena that do not exclude themselves.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is excluded because the result of karmic maturation is not an afflicted state.üîΩThe coemergent cause is the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is afflicted phenomena of the same type that arose previously.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is omnipresent afflicted phenomena that arose previously.üîΩThe active cause is all phenomena that do not exclude themselves.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is excluded because the result of karmic maturation is not an afflicted state.üîΩThe coemergent cause is the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is afflicted phenomena of the same type that arose previously.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is omnipresent afflicted phenomena that arose previously.

original: de la sems las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: de la sems las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: The active cause is all phenomena that do not exclude themselves.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is excluded because the result of karmic maturation is not an afflicted state.

original: de bzhin du sems las byung ba dag la yang so sor brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems las byung ba dag la yang so sor brjod par bya'o //
translated: The coemergent cause is the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with the mind and mental factors.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i @302a * //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i @302a * //
translated: The homogeneous cause is afflicted phenomena of the same type that arose previously.

original: rgyu ni rang gi ris dangs pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can sngar skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu ni rang gi ris dangs pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can sngar skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The omnipresent cause is omnipresent afflicted phenomena that arose previously.üîΩThe active cause is all phenomena that do not exclude themselves.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is excluded because the result of karmic maturation is not an afflicted state.üîΩThe coemergent cause is the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is afflicted phenomena of the same type that arose previously.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is omnipresent afflicted phenomena that arose previously.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rang gi sar sngar skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rang gi sar sngar skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The active cause is all phenomena that do not exclude themselves.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is excluded because the result of karmic maturation is not an afflicted state.üîΩThe coemergent cause is the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is afflicted phenomena of the same type that arose previously.üîΩThe omnipresent cause is omnipresent afflicted phenomena that arose previously.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni ci rigs par rang ma gtogs pa yin no //üîΩkun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni ci rigs par rang ma gtogs pa yin no //üîΩkun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The active cause is all phenomena that do not exclude themselves.üîΩThe omni

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa can kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa can kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: The universal cause is only a cause of the defiled.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi ma yin la /
translated: It is not a cause of the undefiled.

original: rnam par smin pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de'i rgyu yin pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de'i rgyu yin pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Since the cause of the universal is not the cause of the result of karmic maturation, the cause of the universal is not a cause of the result of karmic maturation.

original: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, the coemergent cause and the concomitant cause are as already explained.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni lung du ma bstan pa sngar skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni lung du ma bstan pa sngar skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The homogeneous cause is a previously arisen neutral state.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag gang dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag gang dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is any nonvirtuous or virtuous contaminated state that is the result of karmic maturation.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The active cause is as already explained.

original: rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase except for the cause of karmic maturation and the universal cause is stated.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs la /
translated: Because they are not karmic maturation, they are excluded from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: nyon mongs can ma yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs can ma yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
translated: Because they are not afflictive, they are excluded from the cause of omnipresence.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
translated: Coemergent causes and concomitant causes are only coemergent.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Homogeneous causes should be explained as appropriate.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Active causes are as before.

original: rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la de dang 'dra ba sngar skyes pa med pa'i phyir dang dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la de dang 'dra ba sngar skyes pa med pa'i phyir dang dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Excluding the causes of karmic maturation and omnipresence and homogeneous causes means that because similar states do not arise earlier and because they are virtuous,

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
translated: they are excluded from the causes of karmic maturation, omnipresence and homogeneity.

original: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
translated: The coexistent cause and the associated cause are only coexistent.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The efficient cause is as above.

original: 'di la kha cig na re nyon mongs pa can bzhi kho na skye'o zhes brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: 'di la kha cig na re nyon mongs pa can bzhi kho na skye'o zhes brjod par bya ste ;
translated: Here, some say: ‚ÄúOne should say that only four defilements arise from the pervasive cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu las skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu de tha dad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu las skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu de tha dad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Why? Because the homogeneous cause is not distinct from the pervasive cause.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de yang de lta ma yin te /üîΩkun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu la aa nu tsya m'a ne tya nee ya yi k'a n'am /
analyzed: de yang de lta ma yin te / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu la aa nu tsya m'a ne tya nee ya yi k'a n'am /
translated: This is not so.

original: rgyu ma bshad par 'gyur ro //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la /
analyzed: rgyu ma bshad par 'gyur ro // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la /
translated: In the case of the pervasive cause, the homogeneous cause is not mentioned.

original: aa nu tsya m'a ne kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang @302b kun tu 'gro ba'i thob pa rnams kyang rgyu'i dngos por ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa nu tsya m'a ne kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang @302b kun tu 'gro ba'i thob pa rnams kyang rgyu'i dngos por ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the homogeneous cause is not mentioned, the obtainment of the pervasive cause and the pervasive cause itself would not be mentioned as causes.

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyu las 'dod chags skye ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rgyu las 'dod chags skye ste /
translated: Desire arises from the cause of desire.

original: thob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po las thob pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po las thob pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the obtainment of the cause arises from the cause.

original: lnga rnams kho na las nyon mongs pa can rnams skye'o zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: lnga rnams kho na las nyon mongs pa can rnams skye'o zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
translated: It is correct to say that afflicted states arise from these five alone.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are said to be the concomitant cause.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yin pa shes te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yin pa shes te /
translated: It is understood that they are minds and mental factors.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu mi smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu mi smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would not be mentioned as the concomitant cause.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for the single concomitant cause.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: They do not have a concomitant cause because they are not by nature minds or mental factors.

original: nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang lhag ma rnams dang 'phags pa'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang lhag ma rnams dang 'phags pa'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: Other afflicted states and so on means afflicted states, those arising from karmic maturation, the remaining states, and the states of ƒÅryas.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can rnams zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so //üîΩrnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can rnams zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so // rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Form that is afflicted is derived from four causes, excluding the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so zhes bya bar sbyar te /üîΩde dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so zhes bya bar sbyar te / de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: Form that is derived from karmic maturation is derived from four causes, excluding the concomitant cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩForm that is not derived from karmic maturation is derived from three causes, excluding the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the cause of karmic maturation.üîΩForm that is not derived from karmic maturation and is not afflicted is derived from two causes, the coemergent cause and the cause of similar lot.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so zhes bya ba la lhag ma'i gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma lhan cig 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so zhes bya ba la lhag ma'i gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma lhan cig 'byung ba dang /
translated: Form that is derived from karmic maturation and is not afflicted is derived from two causes, the cause of karmic maturation and the dominant condition.üîΩForm that is derived from karmic maturation and is afflicted is derived from two causes, the cause of karmic maturation and the concomitant cause.üîΩForm that is derived from karmic maturation and is not afflicted is derived from two causes, the cause of karmic maturation and the dominant condition.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu dang gsum las skye'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu dang gsum las skye'o //
translated: They arise from three causes: the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the enabling cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first uncontaminated states arise from two causes.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni byed rgyu'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag las so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni byed rgyu'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag las so //
translated: The first uncontaminated states that are not associated with form arise from the enabling cause and the coemergent cause.

original: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are no phenomena that arise from a single cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang byed rgyu'i rgyu dag phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir la rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir dus thams cad du skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang byed rgyu'i rgyu dag phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir la rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir dus thams cad du skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Coemergent causes and enabling causes are not confused with each other and enabling causes do not rely on coemergent causes, so it would follow that they would arise at all times.

original: 'di la rgyu'i chos rnams la rgyu'i rang bzhin bsam pa du zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu'i chos rnams la rgyu'i rang bzhin bsam pa du zhe na /
translated: How many causes are there for the causes of phenomena?

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin drug yod pa @303a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin drug yod pa @303a * //
translated: There are six types of causes,

original: nas rgyu'i rang bzhin gcig gi bar du yod do /
analyzed: nas rgyu'i rang bzhin gcig gi bar du yod do /
translated: up to one type of cause.

original: de la rgyu drug gi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu drug gi rang bzhin ni /
translated: The six types of causes are as follows.

original: dper na 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba kun tu 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: dper na 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba kun tu 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: For example, past and present nonvirtuous factors, and the pervasive factors of thought and thought concomitants.

original: rgyu lnga'i rang bzhin yod de 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / kun tu 'gro ba lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / dge ba zag ba dang bcas ba rnams dang mi dge ba rnams dang /
analyzed: rgyu lnga'i rang bzhin yod de 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / kun tu 'gro ba lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / dge ba zag ba dang bcas ba rnams dang mi dge ba rnams dang /
translated: They exist as the nature of five causes: past and present nonvirtuous factors, pervasive virtuous factors, pervasive indeterminate factors, contaminated virtuous factors, and nonvirtuous factors.

original: mi ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: mi ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: They are pervasive nonassociated compositional factors.

original: rgyu bzhi'i rang bzhin yod de 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang mi dge ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams dang / sems dang mi ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang /
analyzed: rgyu bzhi'i rang bzhin yod de 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang mi dge ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams dang / sems dang mi ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang /
translated: They exist as the nature of four causes: past and present nonvirtuous and contaminated virtuous factors, nonassociated compositional factors, nonvirtuous factors that are not pervasive, and pervasive indeterminate factors that are not associated with thought.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba rnams dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba rnams dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants, future wholesome thought and thought-concomitants, wholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire.

original: rgyu gsum gyi rang bzhin yod de /üîΩ'das pa dang da ltar byung ba lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin dang / lung du ma bstan pa sems dang mi ldan pa rnams dang / kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa zag pa med pa gzugs dang mi ldan pa rnams dang ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyi rang bzhin yod de / 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin dang / lung du ma bstan pa sems dang mi ldan pa rnams dang / kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa zag pa med pa gzugs dang mi ldan pa rnams dang ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: They are of the nature of three causes:

original: gzugs dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang mi ldan pa rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa zag pa med pa rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //üîΩrgyu gnyis kyi rang bzhin yod de /
analyzed: gzugs dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang mi ldan pa rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa zag pa med pa rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //üîΩrgyu gnyis kyi rang bzhin yod de /
translated: past and present unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unwholesome thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of desire, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of fine-materiality, unobscured-non-defined thought and thought-concomitants of the realm of immateriality, unwholesome thought and thought

original: lung ma bstan ma 'ongs pa zag pa med pa dang gzugs dang / lung ma bstan zag pa med pa dang mi ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: lung ma bstan ma 'ongs pa zag pa med pa dang gzugs dang / lung ma bstan zag pa med pa dang mi ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The future unobscured non-defined factors and the unconditioned factors are not associated with any of the four conditions.

original: rgyu gcig gi rang bzhin yod de 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu gcig gi rang bzhin yod de 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The unconditioned factors are the single unconditioned cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyas par bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyas par bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The exposition of the causes and effects is completed.

original: // / sngar rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni /
analyzed: // / sngar rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni /
translated: The factors that are not causes and conditions have already been mentioned above:

original: skye bas bskyed bya skyed byed min //üîΩzhes bshad pa de la rgyu rnams ni grangs dang / rang gi ngo bo dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas bstan na /
analyzed: skye bas bskyed bya skyed byed min // zhes bshad pa de la rgyu rnams ni grangs dang / rang gi ngo bo dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas bstan na /
translated: The effect does not exist in the cause, as, for example, the effect of a son in a man.üîΩThe causes have been taught from the point of view of number, nature and effect.üîΩNow, the conditions should be mentioned from the point of view of number, nature and function.

original: da ni rkyen rnams grangs dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / byed pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya dgos so zhes 'dri ba ni rkyen rnams gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rkyen rnams grangs dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / byed pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya dgos so zhes 'dri ba ni rkyen rnams gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: What are the conditions?
